updates.update_content: Look at this happy boi!

updates.update_userinfo: Story Done! Short Story in the Works!
updates.update_content:
Hello all!
Dropping in for another update: the pages for the main story are complete and being edited this week. The additional short story are in the final stages as well. Things are going smoothly, albeit a little slowly. Apologies on that front. But, we are making progress!
For those who have the original volume one, the dust covers have arrived. When the surveys go out, there will be a question on whether you need one or not. **As a reminder: these dust covers will fit only the original volume one, not the reprinted one from this campaign.
Just dropping in to say stickers have arrived! Pins are designed! Pages are nearly complete. Things are, indeed, coming together. :)

updates.update_userinfo: Sliding in for a Quick Update!
updates.update_content:
Hello my wonderful backers!
Things are moving along. The stickers and bookmarks have been ordered. I'm wrapping up the last few story pages in the next week or so, then that's off to the printer. Whew! It's all coming together.
For those who are getting drawn in and/or requested a commission, I sent out direct messages a little while ago. If you didn't see it, no worries. I plan to send a second message to those who have not responded.

Wow. I don't think my brain has fully comprehended the final number yet, but to all 1,334 of you who backed: Thank you! This, by far, has been the most surprising campaign. I feel truly humbled.

Now, onto the fulfillment! I will keep you guys updated on the progress. Stay tuned for more.

updates.update_userinfo: Exclusive Dust Cover for those Oversized Volume Ones
updates.update_content:
Hello to all my original Volume One Owners!

Let's make those oversized Volume One's from the first and second campaign more special, yeah? There will be an exclusive UV Spot gloss with a Matte finish dust cover to give that bigger babe a boost. For FREE.  Because I appreciate you and feel bad about the whole slipcase hullabaloo.

updates.update_userinfo: Scratch that-- let's do Slipcase add-ons!
updates.update_content:
Alright, after my last update and speaking with some of you one-on-one, belly bands are out and slipcase add-ons are in! I was trying to make slipcases free through stretch goals (hence the belly bands), but since that wasn't feasible budget-wise, they are feasible as add-ons. 
 Slipcases are available now as an add-on!

updates.update_userinfo: Over 900 backers and that next stretch goal has been unlocked!
updates.update_content:
We're doing great! We just unlocked the next stretch goal. One more to go then I'll be adding more! 
I had a wonderful backer suggest a belly band (thanks Mossy) to wrap up the three volumes neatly together. After getting some quotes back for slipcases, it just wasn't feasible this go-around, however, belly bands might be the way to go. So, what would you guys think?

We hit that $30k stretch goal! And I can't tell you how stoked I am! You guys are wonderful. 

Now, as for new stretch goals: comic slipcases were suggested through comments, and while I am not entirely giving up on the idea, the quotes I got back were ridiculously expensive. I am not sure how feasible slipcases will be at this moment in time. I'm still trying (and if any of you know a good place to look, let me know), but for now, I've added two more stretch goals.

project_data.project_name: FOR GOODNESS' SAKE: Vol. 3 & the Completed Series

campaign.story:
Welcome Back to the House of Fear!
We're back with our 7th issue of House of Fear, and our 5th Kickstarter campaign!
House of Fear blends everything you love about Goosebumps, Scooby-Doo, and Tales From the Crypt. Each issue features complete, stand-alone stories that are always exciting, sometimes humorous, and occasionally downright scary.
(Okay,  it's not that scary. There are no nightmares here. But we've learned that young readers love the idea of reading comics their parents think are too scary for them.) 
We're using this Kickstarter campaign to raise funds to print the 33-page issue, House of Fear: Rubber & Glue, and hopefully, we'll hit a couple of Stretch Goals along the way for some additional items. 
What's it About?
Our first story, "Rubber & Glue," introduces us to a couple of students from Savini Middle School.
Caden and Isaac aren't exactly friends. 
And everything is most certainly not okay here. 
Caden thinks he has the upper hand, as always. But this time, he's in for a shock. Isaac isn't just repeating a childish retort...
...but instead is casting a curse. One that will force Caden to live a day in the life of the bullied. 
This story isn't the Monster-of-the-Month fare you've come to expect from House of Fear, but instead, examines the roles we play in middle school, and shines light on just how easy a harmless prank becomes something worse. It's as if Stephen King wrote an after-school special. 
This issue also features a backup story, "The Trees Have Eyes." This one starts peacefully enough, with Tosh and his dad out for a pleasant hike in the woods. 
Well, maybe not so peaceful or pleasant for Dad. And when they venture off the trail...
...and into a copse of aspen trees, things take a turn for the worse.
Trust me, you'll never look at Aspen trees the same again. 
What to Expect
Here's what you can expect when you back our latest campaign:
One issue featuring two complete, stand-alone stories.
33 pages of full-color thrills.
Fun, exciting comics suitable for (almost) all ages.
Bagged/boarded comics shipped in sturdy packaging.
We print House of Fear domestically, which means a faster turn around time (within 2 months of the campaign end).  
We're now printing on a heavy 70 lb paper stock with a 100 lb cover stock.  A heavier stock means the comics stand up to multiple reads and make the book more suitable for sharing. 
Stretch and Milestone Goals
We recently had our 175th backer, which means every backer gets a set of print-at-home activity pages. This set includes prompts for kids to draw their own monsters and comics, and of course, also includes coloring pages. 
If we reach 200 backers, all backers will receive a PDF of the B&W version of The Trees Have Eyes. See Jethro's line work in all its glory in this special version of the story. 
If we reach 225 backers, I'll upgrade the Digital Deluxe PDF to a full, behind-the-scenes, making of book. I received lots of feedback after our last campaign for this style of book, and I'm excited for the opportunity to do it again for Rubber & Glue.
Our First Kickstarter Exclusive Variant
We're big fans of the old EC comics, so for this campaign, we created our first variant cover as an homage to those horror comics from the 50s. Those are James Hislope's lines, and Josh Jensen's colors, with Matt Krotzer on letters and design. They absolutely nailed it, didn't they?
As a way to reward backers with a piece of House of Fear history, the variant is an exclusive to Kickstarter. We'll print to order (with an overage of 10% to cover possible damage during transit), so don't expect too many of these to make it to my online shop or to convention tables. 
The Rare, Serialized Variant
We've also got a rare variant for this campaign. This one features art by Jethro Morales and colors by Josh Jensen. There will be no House of Fear trade dress on the cover. Just the frightful artwork. 
Each copy will be individually serialized to only 31 copies. 
Boyle Minifig
We've partnered with Justin at Saber-Scorpion to produce a limited-edition Boyle minifig. The look and accessories are specific to this issue and will only be made available during this campaign. 
The image below is a prototype of what you can expect.
Exclusive, Crossover Print
Our first House of Fear crossover is here! Anyone who backs a physical reward for this campaign and the one for Phil Falco's Haunting 1-3 will receive this exclusive print, signed by the writers on both books. (Digital backers who back both will receive a digital version of the art.)
Stunning art by Jethro Morales and Josh Jensen
Haunting is a solid, supernatural horror comic for teens and adults. So if you have older kids in your house or if you like to sample new horror for yourself, now's the time to try something new!  
 The Rewards 
Add Ons
If you've backed a print tier, you can add additional print copies of House of Fear: Rubber & Glue. You can also catch up on all of the House of Fear comics with the Digital Catch Up add on. We have stickers, too!
After you select a tier to back, Kickstarter will take you to the Add-On page. If you see another issue you'd like to have, simple select it from the Add-On page. 
Other print issues of House of Fear will be available as add-on options after the campaign has ended.
Preview Pages
Below are pages from House of Fear: Rubber & Glue.
Shipping and Delivery
Our young readers aren't overly concerned with mint comics. All they care about is reading the story....and rereading it as many times as possible. 
But there are a lot of collectors reading House of Fear, too. We know true horror is getting a Kickstarter package in the mail and finding a crumpled comic inside.
With that in mind, we pack our books with the same care we used in making the book and the love that we have for our backers.
All comics come bagged and boarded. 
Any order that consists of 1 or 2 comics will be shipped in a sturdy, oversize envelope (stay flat mailers from Pratt Plus). 
All orders of 3 or more comics will be shipped in a Gemini Mailer for added protection. 
All packages will be sent via USPS Media Mail, First Class, or Priority Mail, depending on weight.
Timeline and Budget
The comic is 100% complete, so all we need to do is send the issue and sticker sheet to the printers. After 2-3 weeks, I'll start shipping everything to backers. 
But where do the funds go?
About half of the funds we earn through Kickstarter will be used to print the comic and other rewards. Shipping will take approximately 40% of the funds we receive, and 10% goes to Kickstarter for hosting the campaign.
Any extra money we earn from the campaign will help pay for future issues of House of Fear.
 Meet the Creators 
Will You Help Us Make Comics for Kids?
It's simple: We love making fun, exciting comics, and we want to get them to as many readers as I possibly can. We can't do that without support from readers like you.
Thank you for checking out our latest project. We hope you find a reward that suits you well, and when you do, that you back the campaign and help us continue making exciting, action-packed comics for kids.
Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my FIFTH Kickstarter campaign! The comic is already complete, and all we have left to do is print the comic and other rewards. 

We're big fans of the Kickstarter platform, and we know how important it is for backers to get their rewards in a timely manner. So we plan to do everything we can to meet your expectations. Of course, if anything comes up that throws us off schedule, we will keep Kickstarter backers updated.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
If you filled out the survey, you should have received your digital and physical House of Fear rewards. If you haven't, please send me a note. 
I've been getting great feedback on the issue, and I hope you enjoyed it as much as the others. 
What's Next?

A brief shipping update:  
If you filled out a survey, I've shipped your rewards. 
Well, except for locals...I plan to hand-deliver your comics.  
I sent all digital rewards through email, not through Kickstarter messages. If you don't see an email from james@jameswpowell.com, please check your spam folder.  
Reach out if you have any comments, concerns, or questions.  
After you read the issue, let me know what you thought. I enjoy hearing what our readers like and don't like.

Guess what I found on my porch today. House of Fear comics!
Check out the unboxing:

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys out, comics on the way
updates.update_content:
A few quick updates on House of Fear: Rubber & Glue:
I sent surveys on Friday, and over 150 backers have responded already!
If you want your name on the Thank You page of the PDF, please respond by April 18. 
The stickers are already printed and in hand. 
Justin is finishing up the Boyle minifigs and they'll be here early next week.
The comics are being printed this week, and in hand next week.

Our House of Fear campaign might have ended, but there's still time to get in on the exclusive crossover print we have with Phil Falco's Haunting. (Not much time, though...there's only 2 days remaining.)

Kickstarter is still dealing with the finances from the campaign, but I haven't let that slow me down. This week I've:
Submitted my information to the printer to get rolling on comic printing
Sent the final files for printing the stickers
Paid Justin so he could start creating those magnificent Bolye minifigs 
Secured more bags and boards for shipping

Thank you again for supporting House of Fear. We're excited for you to check out the latest issue. 
So what's next?
1. Those backers whose pledges failed have five days to fix their pledges. There are 5-6 backers whose credit cards failed. If that's you, please take a moment to update your credit card information on Kickstarter.

We did it! Our latest issue of House of Fear has officially been funded on Kickstarter!
And by we, I truly mean you, me, the creators on the issue, and everyone who backed the campaign. Thank you so much for having faith in us and in the House of Fear series. I'm so grateful for the Kickstarter and comic community. 
Up next for me, well, I just want to relax, smile, and feel the love. I'll hop back on in a few days with information about what's next.

updates.update_userinfo: One backer from the 2nd most backed HoF campaign!
updates.update_content:
We only have about 24 hours left, but if we get one more backer, we'll have made this House of Fear campaign our second most backed campaign to date. 
I know, we don't celebrate being second best that often, right? 
But for me, right now, it's a big deal. I took a year off from all things creative and all things online, so I feel like I'm starting over these last few months. And to get back to those loftier numbers again absolutely makes this feel like the right thing to be doing.

project_data.project_name: House of Fear: Rubber & Glue

campaign.story:
Did you ever feel like you can't please others, no matter how hard you tried? Ulrick will go to the ends of the earth to try and fix his mistakes!
Mythic Creature Trainer issues 1+2 is a fun, fantasy-adventure story about training dragons and dealing with troubles at home and at work!
The plus-sized comic, weighing in at 36 pages!
Ulrick, one of the royal stable hands, loves his work and demonstrates talent for taming the king's mythic creatures. It's just a pity he has trouble turning up on time.
 With his job on the line, Ulrick's boss charges him with making a special potion to cure a baby dragon of fever. Ulrick does his best, but his actions have far-reaching consequences that not even he could have predicted!
 Ulrick is always trying to get his housemate, Felka to help him out of a tight spot. She's a palace sentinel: an elite force of king's guards. Felka doesn't really care if Ulrick succeeds or fails, but she'll pitch in when it suits her.
Ulrick's boss is not all that he seems. Kevin the goblin has his own plans, and he's willing to throw Ulrick under the bus to get there.
 Ulrick will discover the hard way that approval from others isn’t the most important thing in life. But he's not alone! Some characters crave approval and status, while others shun it and do what they feel like, without regard for others.
Issue 1 is already printed, now it's time to take issue 2 to press!
This is my FOURTH Kickstarter!
I've funded and fulfilled to satisfaction 3 other campaigns in the last 3 years. Here's some feedback from my happy backers:
I love hearing back from readers when their books arrive!
I've had some lovely things said about me and my work on a number of comic book sites and podcasts, too: 
Hi! I'm René, Australian cartoonist. I created, wrote and drew Mythic Creature Trainer.
I've worked in the animation industry for over 20 years: in character design, animating for Disney on 10 different films, making flash animation for software and pilots for TV series. I was a storyboard artist on Classic Tales and Bob’s Burgers.
I'm so proud of my comic books, and they're only made possible through Kickstarter.

In 2018 I funded my first graphic novel on Kickstarter, Sneaky Goblins: an all-ages story of fantasy mayhem, inspired by Adventure Time cartoons, Tolkien and World of Warcraft. I followed that up with two new comics: Sneaky Goblins at College in 2019, and Mythic Creature Trainer #1 in 2020.
 Some of the films, TV and comics I've worked on: 
I've always loved drawing and telling stories. Making this book was a labour of love, and I hope that comes through as you read it.

You get every single item pictured above when you back at the CATCH-UP Bundle  (AU$95) pledge level and higher. More individual pledge level details below.
My 2018 Kickstarter: the Sneaky Goblins graphic novel!
The chronicles of Wynfirth. Get all 6 tales when you back at the CATCH-UP bundle pledge level.
Over the last year, I've been making and posting the pages of this issue on my weekly webcomic: www.mythiccreaturetrainer.com. Now the entire second chapter is complete, and it's time to print the book! With your help, I'd love to make this book a reality, and get it into the hands of readers like you.
· 36 pages, plus cover
· full colour
· Saddle stitched
· Cover: 170gsm (It'll feel sturdier than your average floppy comic book)
· Interior paper: 113gsm
· Size: 6.625 x 10.25in.
It will be beautiful!
The comic pages are 100% complete and ready for print! Your pledge will make this book a living, physical reality: a crisp, sweet-smelling printed comic book.
Once this campaign funds, all l have to do is make the Thank You page (including drawing the backer portraits) and then send the files off to the printer.

Let's have a look behind the scenes shall we?
Here's my process for making a comic page: from rough sketch, to inks, to final colours:
The amount raised will all go to funding a print run of 600 copies of the comic. Copies of the comic left over after the campaign will be stock that I can sell at comic conventions, libraries and book shops.
I've come to Kickstarter to help get this book into as many hands as possible, and I'd love your support to bring it to life.
Here's a quick introduction to some of the the characters:
A short sample of the book:
 Want more? 
Download a free preview of issue #1 here
Here's what you get in each pledge level... with pictures:
More details on the ORIGINAL PAINTING pledge level in this update.

If you'd like some more info about the COMIC BOOK PENCIL ART pledge level, you can check out this update, or take a look at this here video, where I lay it all out:
  Jump to 6:20 for the short version!

Here's some more of those signed sketches included in the AU$60 ORIGINAL CHARACTER SKETCH level and above:
You can tell me which character you'd prefer in the Kickstarter comments, or through the Kickstarter survey at the end of the campaign, once the pledges have gone through. Or I can just surprise you!
Check out some more sketches available on this PINTEREST BOARD
I've framed some using in regular 6x8" window frames from Target, and they look great!
For more info on sketch requests, look at this update.
Last year I made a process video making a sketch request reward:
 Here's some detailed shots of that original, one-of-a-kind oil painting. More details in this update.
You can find some more details about this painting over on my painting blog.
 At checkout, you'll be able to customise your order with add-ons. Add-ons are available with every physical pledge (i.e. non-digital). Here's what you'll find on offer: 
 You can find more info about original character sketches and comic book pencil art, in the FAQ section.

What will the funds be used for?
I'm only on Kickstarter to print the book and get them out to all of my wonderful backers! The whole amount raised will go back into the book, the rewards, and  shipping it out safely to you:
You should have your books by the end of June 2021.
I plan on sending the final book files to to the printer as soon as the funds come through from Kickstarter (about 2 weeks after the campaign ends).
Printing and delivery of books to my address will take about a month.
Postage is a bit more unpredictable, especially when you factor in COVID-19. But I've built in a buffer just in case there is a delay at any stage. I'll be packing and shipping the books from Melbourne, Australia.

Thanks so much for checking out my campaign. I'm really excited about making this book and I'd love for you to be involved. Choose a pledge and lock in your copy now!
Cheers, René
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After successfully running and fulfilling three comic book kickstarters: in 2018, 2019 and 2020, I have a good understanding of the demands and potential pitfalls involved in this kind of project.
The comic is totally finished - it's ready to go to press!
The biggest risk are slight delays in shipping out to international backers from Melbourne, Australia, due to Covid. So in response to that, I've built in a buffer in the delivery schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The three dragons depicted in this painting are in need of a responsible trainer like Ulrick, the hero in MCT #1+2. Instead of helping the kingdom, they are staging an attack on a beloved public building.
This cannot stand!
Fortunately for you though, this painting could be hung in your home as a testament to the importance of trustworthy creature trainers.

updates.update_content: What better way to wrap up a Kickstarter than to get a bunch of boxes full of comics, and post them out to my awesome backers!

Check your messages for your PDFs!
You should have received your digital rewards in your Kickstarter messages from April 6, 2021.
Sometimes I back a Kickstarter at the digital level and I wonder-- hey, did I get that PDF? And the first thing I do is check the updates. So I'm making this update as extra insurance.

Another exciting thing happened yesterday: the proofs arrived from the printer!

Kickstarter all wrapped up!
Now it's time for the work to begin.

Fully funded?!?
Thank you so much to everyone who pledged to MCT 1+2, you're the best!

So how does the sausage get made? (And by sausage, I mean a comic book page)
I begin with a series of small page layouts called thumbnails. Like this:

updates.update_userinfo: New reward level: an original oil painting.
updates.update_content:
I've just uncovered a brand new, never-seen before pledge level: it's the Original Painting tier. Limited to one backer only!

In this tier, you get an original oil painting by the me, artist of Mythic Creature Trainer. Yep, I was a landscape and portrait painter in a former life.

We're basically at 80% funded, so let's make this official:
Sketch requests are back!

Hi team!
Thanks for making this a rocking Kickstarter-- we've just sailed past 76% funded after just 1 week. 
How good's that?
Also, we got an official 'Project we love' badge from Kickstarter staff.

Ok, so we're 3 days in and just hit 69% funded! That's amazing. 
Thanks to you, this comic has a real shot of getting funded, printed and out into the world. From there, who knows what it will do? Meet another nice comic and have little comics of its own?

Err... ok, forget about that last part!

project_data.project_name: Mythic Creature Trainer 1+2

campaign.story:
Coral Island is a re-imagined farm sim game inspired by classics. Grow crops, nurture animals, and befriend the islanders. Decide whether to revitalize not only the town but also the surrounding coral reefs.  
Promising to keep intact what makes classic farm sim games fun, Coral Island aims to modernize and make the experience more inclusive. We feature a large cast of diverse characters and weave environmental awareness into the core game loop —  all the while keeping it a wholesome good time.


There are over 50 islanders living on Coral Island. Coming from all walks of life, get to know these people by chatting them up — extra brownie points for gifts!

Transform your overrun land into a lush and lively farm. Find your play style by deciding what crops to grow, which animals to nurture, or what structures to build.
Choose from a variety of crops, flowers, fruit plants, and trees. There are over 75 plantables in the game, ranging from age-old classics to the exotic and obscure native to Asia.
Crops are seasonal, which means they only grow in a specific season. However, some crops can be planted in multiple seasons and be re-harvested every several days. 
Fruit plants take 11 days to mature. They are bi-seasonal, able to grow 2 seasons out of the year, and will wither offseason. Does not need to be watered after maturity.
Fruit Trees take 28 days to mature and will not wither off-season. They bear 1 fruit a day, every day for the season, and will continue to bear fruit every year.

Make a living by caring for animals and raising livestock. Though you'll first need to build a coop or barn to house them! These farm animals can be left outside during the day and will return inside as night falls.


Poultry are farm animals that live in a coop. If fed daily, mature poultry usually produces 1 egg, and sometimes, a feather.

Barn-dwelling animals range from the traditional Sheep and Cow to Luwak and Llamas. They need to be brushed and fed daily to keep their produce flowing.

Dive into the ocean to restore the coral reefs! Select a diving spot around the island, and unlock deeper levels to explore. Unravel all that the ocean has to offer.
Clean up the sea bed to make a home for rare fish, and collect ocean kelp to hone the quality of livestock and crop.
Bring processed kelp to Ling's Lab to permanently upgrade the quality of your products. Decide which you'll upgrade first: seeds, saplings, seedlings, fodder, or bait.
16 singles and ready to mingle. Sweep them off their feet and find the one. Find out what their personalities are like, take them on a date, and fall in love!
 Unlock various relationship scenes and when you're ready, build a life together at the farm — perhaps even have children. Yes, no, maybe?
Go deep into the caverns to mine precious gemstones — use the loot to upgrade your tools and farm. But beware, monsters protect rare finds so bring a weapon or two!
Packed with a variety of outfits, accessories, and options to choose from, you are armed with plenty of styles to express yourself. Conform to the community or be different! There is no wrong answer because there is only one you in Coral Island.
Select 1 out of 3 starter houses. Upgrade, decorate… personalize! Purchase furniture, collect paintings and display exclusive decorations. Welcome home, Farmer.
Catch a variety of fish, starfish, and squid! There are also crabs at the beach. Fun fact! Several freshwater and saltwater fish can only be caught at specific seasons or certain times (i.e: at summer dawn, or rainy winters).
Coral Island was once home to an expansive variety of aquatic life. As you restore the island's ecosystem, more types of fish will be available to catch. Perhaps, you'll even cross paths with something legendary?
Level up! As you make your way around the island, you will earn skill points that can be invested into skills. 
Decide on a path and create an experience unique to you. Along the way, you'll unlock new, exciting techniques that might come in handy on the farm!
Get busy and immerse yourself in Coral Island! You can pick projects to work on or a fun skill to develop in your free time... or not. Your time, your choice. Here are some of the additional features in Coral Island worth noting.
Improve the town: Take part in community projects to build and liven up the town. Spare some extra gold to add a community garden for the locals or build a brand new museum and more…
Festivals: Join the local community in a Cherry Blossom Festival, annual beach clean up, and many more. There are 2 festivals each season that you can participate in.
Pets: Choose a companion. Decide between a dog, cat, monkey, fox & more! Your pet will play around the farm and come inside the house.
Weather & Time: The forecast includes sun, wind, rain, storm, and snow. Coral Island also features a day and night cycle with dynamic lighting.  Set the pace by adjusting the passage of time with a time slider.
Cooking: Build a kitchen and start cooking. With over 70 recipes to learn, including Popiah, Lodeh, and Cauliflower Casserole. Gather all cooking utensils and try them all.
Quests: Embark on adventures! There are elaborate quests that will give you cutscenes and storylines, and there are simple quests. Rack up relationship points and get paid!


Welcome to your new home, a small town with big personalities called Starlet Town. It's located on the coast of Coral Island. This tropical island features a setting loosely influenced by Southeast Asia. You'll see this come across the lore, world-building, crops, animals, and more. Nestled in between the equator and northern tropic, Coral Island is graced by four seasons per year.

This is Coral Island. Segmented into 7 different areas, your farm is located on the left side of the map, just on the outskirts of town.
 Starlet Town is the heart of Coral Island. Not only is it roomy and features a butterfly garden, but this charming little town also has stories hidden behind its townies.
The Beach is rich with sparkly white sands, seashells, and seasonal fruits. On the pier sits a handsome old Inn and a gateway to ocean exploration, the Diving spot. 
The Lake perhaps guards the most magical place in Coral Island. Find your way through the wooden bridge and discover the ancient temple. It’s believed to be the main source of water and where the island's rich soil originates from.
The Forest is a mystic sanctuary for wildlife, filled with ruins and who-knows-what. Underneath the musky floor, it's a hoarding place for messages from the past, the Cavern.
The Lookout used to be a place where locals prepared for battles of old and whatnot. As time passed, the Lighthouse is now solely used for navigational aid. Come here and enjoy wicked sunsets and pick some wild fruits on your way home.
The Woodlands used to be part of the Forest, but since the arrival of humans, it is now tamed and family-friendly, without losing its green allure. Walk alongside the river to see the School, Taco Truck, and houses belong to those who prefer quiet nights over paved pathways of the town.
 Hillside, sandwiched between the Forest and Woodlands, is the perfect combination of green and privacy. Take a peek at the Vineyard and familiarize yourself with the local Carpenters.

The Coral Three were said to be the Goddess of Flowers, Merfolk, and Giants. Once upon a time, they worked together to maintain the balance of Coral Island. 
The Goddess of Flowers was worshipped by both Merfolk and Giants. To this day, locals continue to believe that the Goddess is responsible for rejuvenating the island's water, soil, and well-being.
Submerged artifacts suggest The Merfolk Kingdom protected the oceans. It appears they were tasked with ruling the underwater world around Coral Island, making sure that order was maintained.
Legend has it The Kingdom of Giants existed to cultivate the rich soil of Coral Island. Ruins around the island depict Giants, and what appear to be humans, farming alongside one another.

Pufferfish Drilling Corp. is a disgraced company whose goal is to drill oil on and around Coral Island. Set to open this Spring, they plan to lobby their way into the community and collect properties to secure voting rights.


We hope to color your days in Coral Island through music. Please listen to several key tracks that can already transport you to the shores of the island:


The image below displays the correct rewards for each tier. Some rewards listed on the pledge tier list show incorrect quantities. Note: We made a mistake and Kickstarter does not allow us to change after posting. Sorry about this!

Deluxe Farmer Pack and above
Mythical pet: for every purchase of a Deluxe Farmer Pack, you will receive 2 mythical pets. One of them is the dragon below (color has not been finalized yet). Also available as an add-on.
Pioneers Pack and above
For every purchase of this pack, you will receive 1 crown, 2 outfits, and 3 wings. Includes everything from the previous tier.  Also available as an add-on.
Founders Pack and above
Customize your founder's statue, including its name and description text. Similar to a character creation menu, select the body type, hair, clothing, and even your pose!



Step 1: Press the 'Manage your pledge' button.
Step 2: Increase your pledge amount in the 'Pledge Amount' box equal to the total of the add-ons you are adding.
Step 3: At the end of the Kickstarter campaign, a survey will be emailed to you. Please confirm how the add-on money should be assigned then.

The current plan is to release Coral Island for Steam on the Windows platform first. Since we've passed our Console Stretch Goals, Coral Island will also be coming to Nintendo Switch, Playstation, and Xbox! 

We understand that localization is very important. Coral Island will launch into early access with Bahasa Indonesia and English support. Shortly after, we will update the game to support the additional 8 languages seen below.
Based in Indonesia, our team currently consists of 20 passionate talents. This includes both permanent crew members and remote collaborators. Although this is our first game as a studio, our team is comprised of veteran and junior game developers.
You can learn more about us on our website: www.stairwaygames.com

Our goal is to release the best version of Coral Island. We believe the only way to achieve this is through community involvement. With Kickstarter, we hope to build a community of passionate backers and involve you all in the process of development. All in service of producing the best farming game we can create.  
So far, development has been entirely self-funded. Although we have enough funds to complete the game, there are several features we would love to add but don't have the resources to do so. It's always been our dream to play a farming game that features changing seasonal outfits for NPC's, or finally, having kids grow up! We hope Kickstarter helps us realize some of the stretch goals we have for Coral Island.
As backers, we invite you to join our Discord to see daily developer diaries and have a direct open line of communication with us. 

Development began in October 2019. Initially, we focused on preproduction and coding core features that now serve as the foundation of Coral Island. Over the last 6 months, we've shifted gears into full production.  
Our focus right now is finalizing and polishing content for the Alpha that will be released to Alpha Farmer tier backers and above. From there, we'll work alongside the community, releasing two content updates and iterating feedback into the game before eventually launching into Steam's early access.



This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $300MM through crowdfunding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've been working on Coral Island for close to 15 months now. 

The two biggest challenges we see ahead for the project are developing alongside community feedback and, provided we reach the stretch goal, implementing the multiplayer component into the game. 

Depending on the amount and type of feedback we receive, the dates for milestones on the development timeline may shift. Should dates shift, we'll openly communicate this to the community.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to my tasty Kickstarter project! My name is Tracy, and I'm the creator of a small business called Atomik Cupcake Designs--I make kawaii accessories such as stickers, jewelry, keychains, and of course, enamel pins! This will be my 5th enamel pin Kickstarter project, and I'm really excited to share it with everyone! To have a look at the finished products of our past work, visit our shop here!

This collection of designs was actually influenced by my mother (how fitting!), who told me that she thought animal cookies would make great pin designs. It always weirded me out that these delicious cookies came in such obscure shapes, so when designing them, I tried to make them a more recognizable and give them a bit more personality. I also swapped out the traditional camel shape for an alpaca, because why not? =D

IMPORTANT NOTE FOR UK BACKERS:
Due to new VAT collection laws, I am unfortunately unable to take UK pledges on this Kickstarter, and all UK pledges will be refunded at the end of the campaign. If you are from the UK and want to back these pins, please use these links to pre-order on our Etsy page:

 Animal Cookies Pins: https://www.etsy.com/listing/954546775/kawaii-animal-cookies-soft-enamel-pins 
 Inflatable Shaker Charm: https://www.etsy.com/listing/954551593/kawaii-animal-inflatable-bag-shaker 
 Heart Filler Pins: https://www.etsy.com/listing/940605160/kawaii-heart-shaped-cookie-mini-pin 
Learn more about all of the tasty designs below!
Each of the four pin designs comes in the two traditional pink and white cookie colors! Because we wanted to dye the metal for these, our designs are soft enamel with an epoxy coating, with sprinkle details printed on top of the epoxy! Each pin measures between 1.5 and 1.75 inches on its longest side. They each have a backstamp of the Atomik Cupcake Designs logo, as well as two backing posts and pink rubber clutches.

These goodies have been added as stretch goals outside of the main design! All of these extras have been unlocked!
 Freebie rewards are compounded,  so higher tiers will get all of the rewards of the tiers before it! Those who pledged for a shaker charm or heart filler pin/earring set will receive both the glitter and cupcake sticker as freebies!

How add-ons work: If you'd like to add extra sticker sheets, filler pins, or keychains, just add that additional amount to your pledge. When surveys are sent via Backerkit, you'll have the option of choosing which rewards you pledged for!
 Project Launch: January 12
 Project End: February 5
 Production Begins: Middle/end of February
 Rewards Shipped: mid/late April
Thank you so much for checking out our Kickstarter campaign! If you'd like to follow us and see what other cool stuff we've made, click the links below!

 Website: www.atomikcupcakedesigns.com 
 Instagram: www.instagram.com/atomikcupcakedesigns 
 Facebook: www.facebook.com/atomikcupcakedesigns 
 TikToK: www.tiktok.com/@atomikcupcakedesigns
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have now successfully created over two dozen enamel pin designs, most of which have been funded with the help of Kickstarter! As a result, I have gained valuable experience in understanding not only how to manage a Kickstarter campaign, but about manufacturer standards, quality control, and how much time it really takes for pins to be made.

There is always the risk of factory mishaps which can delay the progress of a Kickstarter. These can include pins that have the wrong color, a high defect rate that requires a reorder, shipping delays, and other issues that can delay the production of pins. I've done my best to anticipate that sometimes these things happen (especially considering how crazy this year has been due to COVID), and I have set my delivery date accordingly to allow for PLENTY of time to get these all out to you!

Backers will be notified every step of the way on whether we're ahead of schedule, on schedule, or delayed, so there will be no surprises!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Enamel pins are made of a combination of hard enamel and plated metal. They are designed to be worn for a VERY long time, and they can be a part of your collection for many years to come!
Sustainable Distribution
Last project, Atomik Cupcake Designs switched from using plastic bags to recyclable glassine ones to protect our enamel pins during transit! When we use boxes, we've also switched from using plastic to using recyclable kraft boxes with eco-friendly, recyclable synthetic cotton linings!

updates.update_content:
OH MY GOD GUYS, I finally finished it. xD I'm sorry it took me ages--in the future, I now know what it'll take to send out 300 orders at once and will be much more prepared for it! This was by and far my most successful project, so thank you all for your patience while I learned!

ALL Animal Cookies rewards have been shipped out as of today! Some of you have e-mailed me for tracking numbers, and if this is something you would like, you may continue to message me on here, on Instagram, or e-mail me at atomikcupcake@hotmail.com!

Hey everyone! I just wanted update you that pin rewards have begun shipping! I'm about 20% through all rewards--please bear with me as I'm only one person, but I'm doing my best to be speedy. 😂 I started out sending individual tracking numbers, but it was a cumbersome process, so if you would like to be notified of your reward shipping and would like a tracking number, please contact me and I'll do that for you!
I also wanted to share a couple more pictures, for those who don't follow me on IG and may not have seen them!

HURRAY. The pins arrived to me yesterday--there are a lot of them. =D I haven't looked through all of them yet, but the ones I've seen look beautiful! I LOVE that the screenprinting on the outside of the epoxy makes a little shadow on the enamel underneath, it makes the sprinkles look 3D!

Here's a sneak peek at some of our awesome goodies!
I love them so much! There are so many...😅 Here's a little video and some pictures!

The die-cut circus performer stickers have arrived! These were available as a pack in the add-ons store...but don't worry, they'll also be available individually with free shipping if you didn't see these sooner, or if you're just interested in one or two designs!

updates.update_userinfo: Non-pin rewards sent, pins are on the way!
updates.update_content: AHHHH, I'M SO EXCITED. Some of the cookies already have their sprinkles on, and they look absolutely adorable. =D Here are a couple manufacturer photos (the pink one's a bit blurry, sorry!)--here we have both color bears and the unicorn!

Good news! My manufacturer sent me some progress photos of the pins today, and I am SO EXCITED. They look good enough to eat! Here's a couple shots (minus the sprinkles of course, as those are screenprinted on last)!

project_data.project_name: Kawaii Animal Cookies: Enamel Pin Series + Keychain

campaign.story:
Cover by WAILING BLADE's Joe Mulvey
DEADSKINS! 3-4 is a 60-page, perfect bound comic book collecting the third and fourth issues of the series critics call:
DEADSKINS! was the first graphic novel we ever created, and it was serialized on our website from 2013-2014. The full story clocks in at 5 issues, roughly 30 pages each.
We're remastering this book 2 issues at a time, darkening the lines to improve print quality and bring out the beauty of our black, white, and red production. And if you missed our last campaign for issues 1-2, we've made it super-easy to catch up. 
Here's the pitch:
"A Harvard-educated dandy and his blind, drunk companion are all that stand between the Old West and an Undead Apocalypse. This is the true story of Custer's Last Stand... whatever they taught you in school is bullsh!t."
In addition to the 60-page, perfect bound book, backers get: 
Credit inside the book
Exclusive digital bonuses
FREE U.S. SHIPPING!
TART'S Kevin Joseph on DEADSKINS!
THE GALL-DANG PREVIEW
Last time out, we met Shane, a Harvard dandy on his way back home to propose to his girlfriend. He falls asleep on the train, and when he wakes up, everyone else on board is dead:
When he gets to town, same story. Everyone's dead (or gone), except the town drunk and his, uh, "wife":
Together, they have to solve the mystery of what happened and why they were spared... and save the girl, of course:
But when word gets out that there's something special about our unlikely heroes, they're quickly drafted into a war they don't understand... and it's not entirely clear who the real bad guys are... 
In this volume, you'll meet General Custer:
No relation to Yosemite Sam.
Custer sends Shane and Jack on a "special" mission alongside the brutes Thomas and Boston... and a kid aptly named "The Kid":
Dynamite vests. (Don't try this at home.)
Along the way, they meet some butt-kicking cowgirls...
Cowgirls. Kickin' ass and taking names since 1876.
...and, of course, zombies:
Busted. And on National Talk Like a Pirate Day for zombies, too...

Plus: Shane finally reunites with his beloved Annie! But, uh, she's full of surprises:
Reunited and it feels... so bad?
So settle in for some weird western action! 
If you're still not sold and want to read the first issue for free...
CLICK HERE TO JOIN OUR ONLINE LETTER COLUMN
BABY BADASS writer D.E. Schrader on DEADSKINS!

We're keeping our rewards pretty simple this go 'round. But in addition to our main cover by Wailing Blade's Joe Mulvey, we have...
 THE ALEX CORMACK VARIANT 
Variant cover by SINK and SEA OF SORROWS artist Alex Cormack
And if you missed any of our other campaigns for RED XMAS or PBOW, you can catch up with our ...
Box of Fries
More details below...


NOTE ABOUT THE SLANG
DEADSKINS! takes place in the Wild West, and as such, some characters--particularly the villains--express attitudes that seem outdated today. We think our readers are smart enough to know that we aren't condoning these things, but we also know that in 2020, some people don't want to read about it. So: fair warning.
There's also donkey-f*cking.
FRIED Comics is a proud purveyor of offbeat, irreverent pulp fiction since 2013, and a labor of love for Clay Adams and Alexandre O. Philippe.
So far, we have eight successful Kickstarters under our belts. (And between us we have a lot of belts. ) So, we're stoked to return to the scene of the crime.
Clay is the co-writer of RED XMAS, which was released in comic shops this December by Scout Comics, and served as co-editor for the NIGHTMARE THEATER anthology on Kickstarter. His feature script, THE ECLIPSE, placed second in the horror category of the FADEIn Awards, and his latest comic, ELECTRIC YOUTH, co-written with Kyle Roberts, was recently featured in the LA Times. He has written and directed for television and holds a BFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU. When Clay first met Alexandre, he thought, "My, what a sophisticated European." Boy, was he wrong!
Film nerd/director Alexandre is the co-writer of RED XMAS from Scout Comics. His most recent documentary is LEAP OF FAITH: WILLIAM FRIEDKIN ON THE EXORCIST, now streaming on Shudder. He holds a Masters Degree in Dramatic Writing from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts and has written and directed numerous award-winning films and documentaries, including MEMORY: THE ORIGINS OF ALIEN, 78/52: HITCHCOCK'S SHOWER SCENE, AND THE PEOPLE vs. GEORGE LUCAS. When Alexandre first met Clay, he thought, "My, what a stupid American." Boy, was he right!
Leila is a comic book artist and writer living in Portland, Oregon. She draws SLEEPLESS, SHUTTER and writes AFAR at Image Comics. Leila has drawn for titles such as THE WICKED + THE DIVINE, SCARLET WITCH, AMERICAN VAMPIRE, and THE PANTHEON PROJECT. In 2015 and 2016, Leila was nominated for the Russ Manning Promising Newcomer Award for her work on SHUTTER. She only took this job because she thought she'd be paid in fries.
Brett Nienburg is a Denver-based artist who has worked as a concept artist for LEGO and  designed sets for feature films. We're sorry we made him peel so many potatoes. He looks pretty sad about it.
Charles is from Canada, so we imagine he looks like one of those flappy-headed dudes from South Park.* He has lettered books for Aftershock, Image, IDW and Top Shelf (among others) and is a founding member of Frozen Beach Studios. (*As far as we know, Charles has a normal-looking head.)
Ugh. Just... ugh.
The Package
We've gotten our fair share of comics that arrived mangled by the mail carrier.
You pay premium prices on Kickstarter, and you deserve better. That's why we've started using Gemini Comic Mailers:
These babies are sturdy. They require a little more money, a little more time (and a lot more tape!) but it's worth it to make sure your comics arrive in pristine condition.
And if somehow your comic still gets roughed up?
Frieda will replace it free of charge.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
We are coming to Kickstarter to put the first two issues into print. The book is 100% complete, our printer is still operating as an essential business, and we are ready to deliver quickly. We just need YOU to make it a reality.
All funds from this campaign will go to:
Printing rewards
Shipping them to you
Anything above our goal goes towards making more comics
Image copyright Can Stock Photo / pressmaster
THE TIMELINE
The Kickstarter Campaign: 30 days (Feb 2-Mar 2)
Kickstarter Funds Released: ~Mar 15
Digital Rewards Released: ~Mar 31
Book Goes to Printer: ~Apr 15
Book Printed and shipped to us ~Apr 30
Pack and ship - ~May 1
Expected delivery to US backers - 2 Weeks (Early May)
Expected delivery for International Backers - 4 Weeks (late May)
 THANKS, HON!
We're not asking for a million dollars. We just want to put a cool book in your hand and entertain you for a bit during these crazy times. So find a pledge level you like and pre-order. We'll make more comics.
Oh! And finally:
We heard somewhere that Kickstarter campaigns do better when they have pictures of cats on the page. So, here's a picture of Clay's cat:
Thanks for supporting! And remember...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book is 100% finished. We've worked with our printer on multiple campaigns and we know they will deliver a quality product on time. Right now, the biggest risk is that the postal service will continue to see delays. We sincerely hope this won't be a problem... but if it is, we'll get your books to you via an alternate service.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Final week to back PBOW on Kickstarter...
updates.update_content:
Hey there!
Quick note to say there is just a little less than one week left to back the new issue of PBOW on Kickstarter.
So far we have fully funded and unlocked a series of bonus books that will go out to all backers who pledge $8 and above.

Howdy, cowpoke!
True story: yesterday I packed up the last of the books and then breathed a huge sigh of relief:

Howdy, pardner!
In a world where 73.6% of all statistics are made up, I'm 98% certain this one is real:
As promised, books arrived last week, and after spending a few days sorting and checking the stock, I dropped off the first of the packages at the post office on Thursday.

updates.update_userinfo: Books arriving from printer + Address changes locked!
updates.update_content:
Howdy pardner - 
As you may (or may not) have noticed, I closed address changes this afternoon, meaning you have about 48 hours to change your address if you need to. That's because...
Books are arriving Monday! 
What's Next?

updates.update_userinfo: At the Printer! + Third Stretch Goal Unlocked?
updates.update_content:
Howdy!
Quick update to let you know that the book is at the printer, and as soon as copies arrive here at the Fried Diner, we'll start shipping them out. 
I'm leaving address changes unlocked for now, so if you need to update your address, go for it.

updates.update_userinfo: Order up! Your digital rewards are here...
updates.update_content:
Howdy, pardner! It's new comic book day, which means Frieda just delivered all digital rewards via Kickstarter messages. 
We know not everyone downloads their rewards right away, so we always:
a) set the link to "Never Expire"
b) will follow up in a few weeks to the email address you provided in your survey (as a gentle reminder)

Howdy, pardner!
Surveys rolled out earlier today, and if you could pretty please fill them out ASAP, we'd be much obliged.
In fact, let's aim to all have them in by say, Friday the 19th by sundown. 
That way I can get the backer Thank You page put together over the following weekend and then send out digital rewards the next week.
Late this afternoon, our campaign rode into the sunset...

campaign.story:
Hello! My name is Gilles and I am a UK based artist with 9 years of experience in pop culture t-shirt and other merchandise design. I have now dived head first into the world of enamel pins and I am absolutely in love with it.
KonNYAchiwa!
This project features Nya Nya Neko, a group of adorable cat girls. The pin series will see them taking on the personalities and outfits of some very special and popular princesses from our childhood. Inspired by a mixture of vintage dolls and kawaii plush toys, they are cute, eye catching and playful.
Pin Selection *IMPORTANT*
Different characters will be unlocked as more Stretch Goals are reached. You will not have to select your pins until the very end of the Kickstarter Campaign, giving you a larger variety on available enamel pins to choose from.
Your Contribution
Funds from this Kickstarter will help to cover the costs of creating a minimum order of each pin as well as the moulds, screen printing elements, glitter features and backing cards. 
Add-ons and Shipping *IMPORTANT*
You will be able to add additional pins, tees, stickers and prints, as well as other exclusive goodies at the end of the campaign when completing your survey.
The shipping costs attached to this Kickstarter DO NOT INCLUDE Tracked Shipping, but you will be able to UPGRADE TO TRACKED at the end of the campaign when completing your survey.
Made of hard enamel in gold plating and approx 45mm to 55mm.
 Glitter features on all pin designs.
 Screen Printing on all pin designs.
2 Rubber clutches at the back of each pin.
 #GillesPinClub branding on the back of each pin.
Each pin is attached to an embosed and illustrated backing card.
The original Kickstarter goal of £1000 will be covering the costs of the first 3 pins as shown below.
The following designs are made available after the project hits certain targets.
The goal targets reflect the costs of creating the pin moulds and set up fees, as well as minimum order of each pin. I will be updating the graphic below to show when goals are met.
Unlike previous campaigns, I will be unlocked groups of pins together once reaching individual targets, starting with £2000, £3000, £4000 and the final group at £5000.
No more designs will be created or unlocked through this campaign beyond these designs.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Some of the designs may be subject to small changes during the campaign and in post production.
Below you will find the "Glitter Guide!" The areas coloured in pink will be glittered for that particular pin.
This "Fairy" Pin will be available as a FREEBIE for pledges of any 5 pins or more. 
Note: You can also see the prototype for the Nya Nya Neko backing card in the image above, designed to resemble a vintage doll box. 
I have self-funded some samples of the first 4 pins unlocked through this project. Below you can see some of the photos of the sample pins.
NOTE: As you can see, The Fairy pin comes with very special Stained Glass Wings~! How fantastic does that look?!
Next you can find some images of previous Nya Nya Neko enamel pins I have manufactured both through Kickstarter as well as my Patreon Pin Club.
Below are a series of questions which are frequently asked during my Kickstarter campaigns. I have complied this FAQ to help set your minds at ease about any queries you might have.
If your question is not tackled below, please feel free to leave a comment or send me a private message and I will get back to you as soon as possible. 
Q. Will the Villains be added on this set?
A. Yes, I will be adding a series of Villains that go along with these pins, however they will not be added as part of this campaign. Instead there will be other campaigns to expand this collection. I have made this decision in order to make collecting the full set more affordable, especially in the current financial climate. 
Q. Why are these pins prices a little higher than you usual Kickstarter Pins?
A. Due to the level of detail in each pin, the ammount of screen prints and the variants available for some of the designs, the Unit Price of each pin is much higher than some of my other designs, and therefore had to up the price slightly. However, the Early Bird prices still reflect the same discounts from previous campaigns.
Q. Can I add more items (stickers, pins, t shirts) to my current pledge? 
A. Yes, you will be able to purchase addons ontop of your pledge rewards at the end of the campaign while filling in your surveys.
Q. Should I add more money to my reward to purchase addons.
A. No, please do not add extra money to contribute to your addons. Addons will be purchased and paid for at the end of the campaign separately to your pledges here on Kickstarter, using BackerKit.
Q. BackerKit surveys never make it to my inbox. How will I get my survey?
A. If your survey does not arrive once I send out the update here on Kickstarter notifying everyone that surveys have been sent, simply send me a private message here on Kickstarter or by email and I will link you directly to your survey. No surveys shall be lost here!
Q. I don't have any funds to contribute to your Kickstarter Campaign but I'd love to help. How can I do this?
A. Sharing a Kickstarter with your friends is the easiest and most efficient way to help any campaign. Thank you in advance to all those who share the link to this and all my other Kickstarters~!
Q. Will my Reward come with Tracked Shipping?
A. To keep the rewards at a low price point, Tracked Shipping is not applied automatically to each reward. Instead you can purchased tracked shipping for your parcel as an addon upon completing your survey.
Q. My parcel has not arrived yet but I didn't purchase the Tracked Shipping. Can you help me?
A. Unfortunately if you chose not to purchase Tracked Shipping, I am unable to determine if you parcel was delivered and where. The best I can do is confirm it was shipped to the correct address. So please do purchase the Tracked Shipping Addon if you would like to ensure extra safety to your parcel.
I would like to take a moment to thank you for reading and supporting this Kickstarter campaign. I am so excited for you to receive your pins.
For the latest news about this Kickstarter as well as other projects, please feel free to follow me on Instagram at @GillesBone, Twitter at @GillesBone and on my Facebook Page GBIllustrations.
Kickstarter launches on January 28th and runs for 25 days.
The Kickstarter campaign will end on February 22nd.
Kickstarter Funds will be received after about 15 - 17 days.
Backerkit surveys are sent for your pin selection, add-on purchases and mailing address info once the Kickstarter Funds are recieved.
Production will approximately take between 2 to 4 months due to the volume of designs. The duration may vary  due to the global pandemic. 
It will take about 1 to 2 weeks for the pins to be shipped to me.
I will package and send out your orders as soon as the pins arrive to my home.
You can expect to receive your pins no later than Mid July 2021. Please make sure that your address is correct to prevent any unnecessary delays. If there are any setbacks in the production process, I will keep you posted.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Some pins may vary ever-so-slightly from the mockups above during production, however such changes will be minor and few and far between.

There is also always the possibility of delays in production and shipping time, however I will be in close contact with the manufacturer throughout the entire process to make sure they are keeping with the timeline mentioned above.

I will be personally examining each pin before dispatch to make sure that no one receives any blemished or defective pins.

Please make sure that you double check that your address is correct to make sure that you package does not get lost.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
I hope this update finds you all well and in good health.
It has been of a difficult week dealing with the pin manufacturer. The pins should have arrived to me by now but some difficulties at the factory have caused some delays. I have been told that they had some issued with some of the machinery which needed repairing, and due to high volume of orders, ours was slowed down in production.

Hi everyone,
I hope this message finds you well.
I have been getting a few Kickstarter Update Requests and I'm afraid the pins are still in production and I will not have much to show you until the end of the month. This was to be expected with the high volume of pins being producted and the large number of quantities for each one.
Since we last spoke, the artwork was approved based on what you had seen during the campaign, the payment was sent to the manufacturer and production began. Now, we wait.

Hello everyone!
I hope this update finds you and your loved ones safe and healthy.
I got a couple of requests for updates so I thought I would send out a quick message to you all to get you up to speed with the progress of our campaign.
Production

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys Sent + Pre Order Store Launch + 2 NEW PINS!?!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
I hope you all had a great weekend and are keeping well and safe. I have had my first full day off (Sunday) since January when I started preparing for this campaign, and I have to say, it was much needed!!  
With the surveys ready to send, I can now take a moment to work on other small projects and commissions, and then roll up my sleeves to work on the next set of Disney Nya Nya Neko pins~!
Surveys

Hello everyone,
I hope this update finds you and your loved ones in good health.
I thought I would drop an update and get you all up to speed with what’s happening with our lovely campaign.
Kickstarter Payments

updates.update_userinfo: Payments + Poll + Sticker Collection + Discord + Thank You
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! 
I hope this update finds you and your loved ones safe and in good health!
It is with great excitement that I announce that the Nya Nya Neko Princesses Enamel Pin Series (Part 1?)  has been fully funded!!!  I am incredibly overwhelmed by your support and I really am thankful the campaign has been such a smashing success. Thank you to each and every one of you!
Payments

Hi everyone,
I hope this update finds you all in good health!
We're under a week away from the funding portion of this campaign to be over, but there is still so much more work for us to do together!
Today I wanted to send you an update to share with you what I have been working on, as well as get some feedback through a poll I had mentioned I'd be doing regarding other characters for me to work on for future campaigns.

updates.update_userinfo: Other Pins + The Poll + Stitch Pack
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
I hope this update finds you healthy and safe.
It's been a little over a week since this Kickstarter has launched, and my goodness how far we have come! I am now making preperations for my upcoming campaigns based on your suggestions, as well as planning surveys and addons for this one.

Hi everyone,
I am live streaming right now on my Twitch Channel, answering comments and questions about the campaign as well as working on a Lilo and Stitch inspired postcard design. 
Please feel free to drop in and say hello if you'd like.

project_data.project_name: Nya Nya Neko Hard Enamel Pins, Princess Edition

campaign.story:
To celebrate the 7-Year Anniversary of Comic Frontline, we are hoping to make the transition to an edited, stripped down audio format of Comic Book Weekly that our listeners can take on the go and enjoy while they drive, exercise, cook dinner or various other tasks that require their attention.
We love comic books. We love the entire culture that surrounds them including the other media that they populate and have become popular in. We love the heroes and the villains, the bold and the subtle. We love how many different types of stories can be told and the many different genres and sub-genres that they can encompass.
Comic Books are unlike any other medium. They combine the beautiful imagery of art with the emotional and dramatic phrasing of prose or screenplay into this unparalleled art form that transcends time and class.   
We love being whisked away into fantastic and strange worlds filled with colorful characters and dynamic sequences of action, drama, horror and comedy. We enjoy being engrossed in an intricate murder mystery with the clues hidden in panels, or captivated by rich fantasy worlds full of creatures and races we've never seen before, or even entertained by alternate versions of our own world where people fly or become invisible, or can read minds!
Comic Books are our passion, and so we talk about them. Every week. LIVE. And we have for years! And we'd like to continue sharing that with even more people!
 18 episodes of Comic Book Weekly (90-120 minutes each) from March-June, 2020
Discussion of each week of comic books from Marvel, DC, Image, IDW, BOOM!, Aftershock, even Kickstarter at times, and more!
 Top 5 Picks, Big Book Discussion, Under the Radar titles, Most Anticipated and Comic Book and Media news talk!
 Bonus episodes from the first year of the YouTube LIVE version of Comic Book Weekly
And more!
 NEW REWARD TIERS!
One of the various segments highlighted on the show.
For Make/100, we are offering a Custom Comic Book Weekly USB Flash Drive limited to only 100 units, spread across several reward tiers! This Flash Drive will contain ALL of Season 1 of the Podcast (18 full episodes, plus bonus episodes) and is exclusive to this Kickstarter campaign!
Rotates to reveal USB stick, logo on both sides, pen light on the end.
One of our recent episodes of Comic Book Weekly on YouTube:
A little over a year ago, the three of us (and a couple of good friends of ours, the DiBuduo brothers) started over with a brand new show called Comic Book Weekly. New format, same great comic discussion, infused with positivity!
Mike Spider-Slayer (Comic Book Corner 2.0)
Mike is the host of the YouTube channel Comic Book Corner 2.0, which focuses on what comic books to buy. He produces series such as Cover of the Week, Top 10 Comics and Most Anticipated, and his long-running Weekly Comic Haul series. When he's not talking comics on YouTube, Mike teaches Tennis or is spending time with his lovely wife and two kids.
Facebook: Comic Book Corner 2.0: Webheads Unite FB Group
Twitter: @MSpiderSlayer | Instagram: @comic_book_corner_2.0
Kat Calamia (Comic Uno)
Next to her weekly comic book reviews on Comic Uno, Calamia also currently works for Newsarama and DC Comics’ DC Universe with bylines with IGN, Fandom, and TV Guide. She has a Bachelor’s degree in Communications and minor in Journalism through Marymount Manhattan and a MFA in Writing and Producing Television from LIU Brooklyn.
Facebook: @ComicUnoReviews | Twitter: @ComicUno | Instagram: @KatComicUno
Kat has successfully funded several Kickstarter campaigns for her creator-owned comic book series Like Father, Like Daughter.
Brant Fowler (Last Ember Press)
Brant ran his own podcast, Zone 4 for 10 years, and co-hosted several other podcasts through the years. He currently edits the ComixLaunch Podcast each week. He is also the Co-Publisher of Last Ember Press and creator/writer of The Last Ember series, and co-writer of Celestial Falcon. He has also been lettering comics for the better part of two decades, with work published through Image Comics, Action Lab, etc. Recently, he has been designing Kickstarter pages like this one!
Facebook: @BrantFowler or @LastEmberPress
Twitter: @BrantFowler or @LastEmberPress | Instagram: @LastEmberPress
Brant has successfully funded several Kickstarter campaigns for his creator-owned comic book series The Last Ember, and other titles from Last Ember Press.
Chris DiBuduo (Dark Avenger C86)
Chris is a YouTuber and lifelong comic book and Superman fan. He has been writing stories for half his life, and now gets to live out his dream seeing his creations in print. Celestial Falcon is his first comic book, which has two successfully funded issues on Kickstarter!
Facebook: @Chris1450 | Twitter: @DarkAvengerC86 | Instagram: @DarkAvengerC86
A sticker and emoji of Chris will be added to the rewards below featuring the sticker and emoji packs.
 Another one of our recent episodes of Comic Book Weekly on YouTube:
You can add a number of items onto your pledge at checkout. Including these:
One more recent episode of Comic Book Weekly on YouTube:
The funds we receive during this campaign will help with primarily with the cost of hosting fees and editing fees for the podcast. We are bringing on an editor to make the podcast as clean and tight as can be for all of you to enjoy to the fullest!
Here's the breakdown of funds:
An example of our on-screen shout-outs to viewers, which we also vocally shout-out.
This campaign is funding Season 1 of the audio version of the show, which will air during March-June. This comprises of 18 episodes of the weekly show. Here's how the timeline breaks down for production and fulfillment:
We showcase comments from our LIVE viewers on the weekly YouTube version of the show.
Thank you for helping us create this special audio version of Comic Book Weekly! We are very excited to expand the show and its audience, and you are a huge part of that!
If you'd like to share this campaign, here are some quick links to use to do so.
CLICK HERE TO SHARE ON TWITTER
CLICK HERE TO SHARE ON FACEBOOK 
- The Cast of Comic Book Weekly (Mike, Brant and Kat)
The LIVE YouTube version airs Tuesday nights at 10pm ET on YouTube.com/ComicFrontline.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The end product is an audio podcast, but while there is no main physical end product involved in this campaign, we are offering some physical rewards. You can rest assured that anything offered (thumb drives, prints, stickers, etc.) here will be produced and shipped promptly.

Even though Comic Frontline is new on Kickstarter, two of the Co-Hosts involved, Brant Fowler and Kathryn Calamia, have launched, funded and fulfilled many campaigns between them over the past few years. They are experienced and respected Kickstarter creators with positive track records, so you can back this project with confidence.

Should there be any delays in production of the podcast or delivery of any items, we will keep backers apprised via project updates and on our social media. We believe firmly in communication and being open about any setbacks or hiccups, so backers will be the first to know, even though we do not foresee any delays at this time.

We have been recording weekly on Comic Frontline for almost 6 years now, and several years before that on other channels, with few missed weeks for holidays and other occasional circumstances. We are committed to our schedule.

We understand that your time and money are precious, and we greatly appreciate those that choose to give us their support. Because of that, we want our backers to have the best experience possible when supporting this campaign and any future campaigns we may run.

Reach out to us at anytime with any questions you may have and we will respond promptly.

Thanks!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
"Blue" is about being happy being you!

"Blue" is a children's book that explores, through the prism of colors both common and unusual, what it might be like to be someone else and, ultimately being happy with who you are. It's a story about self-esteem. Being happy with the skin you are in. And that is a lesson that is becoming more and more important to teach to children even at the earliest stages of their lives. 
After reading story after story of children who were starving themselves to emulate their favorite pop star or the latest supermodel of the minute or who were begging their parents for plastic surgery before their age even reached double digits, I knew something was very wrong. And while I've never exactly been in love with the way I look, I have long since come to terms with it and found things about myself that I do love. So, I felt that it was important for children to see that there were a lot of good things about themselves that they can love, too.  So, I wrote the original poem about Blue. Which, with the artistic talents of Rodney Fyke of Hazzum Productions, has become the book that we hope to create through your kind and generous pledges. 
Blue Cover Art by Rodney Fyke
Blue Contemplates Colors
Fallow? Zomp?
Blue Talks to Old Grey
The Wisdom of Age
Anger and Apathy
Rewards
In addition to the 30 pages "Blue" book signed by the author,  and the bookmark that reads "I'm never "Blue" when I have a book to read", I have commissioned four incredible prints based on the Blue character from four of today's most talented artists. They are Comfort Love and Adam Withers,  independent comics megastars and creators of the uber-popular "Uniques" and "Rainbow in the Dark", Chandra "Spookychan" Free, eclectic and amazingly talented artist and colorist for companies including Archaia Entertainment, Ape Entertainment, Image Comics, and creator of "The God Machine" and "Machina Corpse.", Sean Forney, the endlessly prolific print, cover and card illustrator and creator of the Scarlet Huntress, and Jeremy "Skare Kro" O'Ryan, independent graphic designer and illustrator with a nearly boundless imagination. At the two highest tiers, $100 and $200, backers will receive a personalized poem, written by me, featuring the person of their choice and Blue. And finally, the $200 tier features the one of a kind, original artboard from the print created by Comfort Love and Adam Withers.

Print Sketch from Rewards contributing artist Chandra Free
Possible Print Process Sketch from Rewards Contributing Artist Jeremy "Skare Kro" O'Ryan
More Possible Print Process Sketches from Rewards Contributing Artist Jeremy "Skare Kro" O'Ryan
Sean Forney's "Blue" Print
Comfort Love and Adam Withers' "Blue" Print
"Spider-Blue" original art by Rodney Fyke
TARDIS original art by Rodney Fyke
Chandra Free Print
Jeremy "Skare-Kro" O'Ryan Print
Iron-Blue original art by Rodney Fyke
"Blue and the Ghost" by Jeremy "Skare-Kro" O' Ryan
"Blue and the Ghost-Rainbow Edition" by Jeremy "Skare-Kro" O' Ryan
Who are we?
I am John Wilson and the author of "Blue". I was an Art teacher in an inner-city school for 11 years until a variety of medical issues and chronic pain forced me to give up my career. Since that time, I became a comic journalist for websites including Comic Related, Complete Set, and CBR and wrote two comic books for Last Ember Press, "Pneumatic Cases" and two of the three stories in "Fireside Tales": "Charmageddon" and "EEK! Lil' Monsters!". "Blue" will be the first book created under the banner of my own publishing company, The Monkeywerx Publishing Company. 

"Blue" artist Rodney Fyke is a writer and artist from Cincinnati, Ohio. He's been working on and off in Independent comics since the early 90s. His art style varies from high detailed illustrations to cartoony drawings. His published projects include Superior Seven, Peanut, Puddin’ n’ Jelly, Pitter Patter, Unchained, and Roadkill Rampage. He has over twelve comics that have been published in which he's either written, illustrated or both. You can see more of his work at www.hazzum.com 

Pledges 
The lion's share of the money request, 3/4 or it will go to our first initial planned print run of "Blue", which is 100 copies. if demand and pledges exceed that, we will be able to print more to meet that demand. The remaining 1/3 of the requested funds will go to shipping the products, pay for promotional material like the bookmarks and flyers and, in part, pay the commissions of the talented artists that are providing the incredible prints that are available throughout this Kickstarter. 

Where Your Pledges Go
Shipping
A note on shipping: shipping is one of the most difficult to price and predict. We are genuinely committed to bringing you a quality package that is shipped securely. We will be using the best "media shipping" envelopes designed to ship books and prints. We have tried to keep costs low but international shipping and domestic shipping rates continue to rise. if you have any questions about specific shipping arrangements, feel free to contact us through the community section of this page. 

Stretch Goals
Goal 1: If we exceed our originally stated goal of $750 and are able to achieve $1000, everyone who pledged at the $15 level or higher (ie purchased a physical copy of "Blue") will receive a print by artist and designer Jeremy "Skare Kro" O'Ryan. 
Goal 2:  If we exceed our originally stated goal of $750 and are able to achieve $1500, everyone who pledged at the $15 level or higher (ie purchased a physical copy of "Blue") will receive a print by "The God Machine" creator and artist Chandra Free.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of our key challenges is not being embraced by parents, children, and the children's book community at large. This is my first children's book and may not follow the "normal" format. It also may not fall within a particular genre or age range. That may be a problem in getting acceptance and donations from more than just friends.

This is my first Kickstarter and while its success or failure will not mean that "Blue" will never see the light of day, it does mean that it will be delayed significantly longer as I save the funds to self-publish on my own.

As mentioned, this is my Kickstarter. It's impossible for me to know if it will be embraced or ignored until it happens and where I made mistakes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
