campaign.story:
We've now unlocked FIVE Stretch Goals and revealed a 6th!
The books included in the first Indie Bundle are listed in update #23!
Update #24 shows larger versions the Bookplate and Art Print for the next two!
Cover A by Sabbatini & Celestini
Ember Madison is the last of the fire goddesses incarnate, but she is not aware of this!
All she knows is that one day, the fire deep inside came swirling to the surface and her world was changed forever. Now, she is... The Last Ember!
A hooded figure watches her every move from the shadows, while a serial killer hunts beings of power like Ember, slowly making his way to her.

Previously, Ember had trouble dealing with her new abilities, and accidentally set a few things on fire. Not to mention having a run-in with a school bully, alienating her friends, and being watched by a mysterious hooded figure. 
In the epilogue, we learned of the man hunting down people like Ember as his quest brings him closer and closer to her doorstep.
In "Hunted," Ember tries to rise above recent troubles and get back to some semblance of normalcy, but Tiana, her new nemesis, isn't quite done with Ember just yet. She and her minions set out to make life a living Hell for Ember.
Elsewhere, the hooded figure meets with Quincy, a new player on the board as they make some startling discoveries and run into some trouble of their own!
"Hunted" #1 is the first chapter in a bold new direction for The Last Ember, and is a great jumping on point!
Interview on KICKSTART THE WEEK
with NICOLE D'ANDRIA
We've now unlocked ALL our Milestone Bonuses!
A digital copy of TART Vol. 1 has already been sent to all backers! 
You'll be getting a print of Ember by Mike Watson of Freestyle Komics and Short Fuse Media digitally or physically! The print will be colored by Lisa Moore!
You'll get a Metal Bookmark by FaerieMetal.com. (Digital backers will get a high-res background of the same image).
And we just added a New Reward Tier and Add-On for a 5" x 9" METAL PRINT of Ember!

This is the first issue of a brand new 4-issue arc in the saga of The Last Ember by the new creative team of the series, Federico Sabbatini and Andrea Celestini of Bigs and Tiny fame! The mythology that Ember's powers stem from comes into play, the action is kicked up a few notches, and Ember's personal life has never been more chaotic!
Waiting for you in this issue:
20-page, standard single issue comic on high quality paper! 
Tons of Action, Drama and Mystery! 
Incredible artwork from the AMAZING team of Sabbatini & Celestini! 
The first issue of a Brand New Arc! 
 First Appearances of several new characters!
SAMPLE OF THE SONG:
CROSSOVER PRINT!
You can still get this print IF you already backed Like Father, Like Daughter and you back Crossover Division and this campaign of course. If you missed LFLD, which is now over, this is no longer available, sorry. Crossover Division ends on the 11th!
 THESE WILL BE SIGNED & NUMBERED!
 #AMA Below
Details and links in Update #2, which you can find by Clicking Here!
 WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING: 

Brant is the Co-Publisher of Last Ember Press and creator/writer of The Last Ember series. He has also been lettering comics for the better part of two decades, with work published through Image Comics, Action Lab Entertainment, Arcana, Moonstone, AC Comics and more. Celestial Falcon is his first foray into full-on co-writing a project.
Federico lives in Rome and works as a Comic Artist for Sergio Bonelli Editore, Aspen Comics, Noise Press, Blackbox Comics, Ink Forged Studios, Last Ember Press & Remer Comics and likes drawing everything especially American Superheroes.
Hi there, my name is Andrea Celestini and I'm a comic book colorist. I work for American indie publishers since 2008. I also color erotic graphic novels for the French market. I worked for Evoluzione publishing, Action Lab Entertainment, Monkeybrain Comics, Splotch Comics, Outpost 426, BlackBox Comics, Tabou Editions just to name a few. If there's action, super heroes, monsters, explosions or pretty girls, I'm the one you are looking for.
Nicole is the creator/writer of Road Trip to Hell, her first creator-owned project! She's a passionate comic book collector who has worked for Action Lab Entertainment as marketing director, submissions editor and a script editor. She has also worked on several of their adaptations, including Peter David's Artful and on the Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir comics. She helped write an issue of their ongoing DollFace series. She's also an accomplished freelance editor. Learn more at ComicMaven.com.

The funds we raise in this campaign will help pay for the remaining art and colors, as well as printing costs. Anything extra we are fortunate to raise will be poured back into the project for future issues.
This platform has, time and again, proven to be a phenomenal community for independent comics, and one we've had great success on. 
Collectively, Last Ember Press has successfully funded 8 previous projects:
For this book, we've brought in the top notch art team of Federico Sabbatini and Andrea Celestini that are taking this series to the next level. Add to that the experience of editor Nicole D'Andria, and the time and money we've put into the issue already, and we feel we have a product worthy of the fantastic backers here on Kickstarter!
We've also commissioned this gorgeous variant cover by Francesco Tomaselli (Heavy Metal), and there are more surprises to come during the campaign!
This book is a passion project for me, and is the flagship title of our company. Ember is a character that was literally birthed from the creation of this company and has become very near and dear to my heart, and important to the brand that we are building. This is why we continue to step up our game with each new issue.
The Last Ember is also the kind of book I love to read. Mystery, action, drama, magic and fantasy elements, and a touch of romance. It's got it all!

Check out this stunning preview of The Last Ember: Hunted #1 with beautiful line art by Federico Sabbatini and gorgeous colors by Andrea Celestini!
Left to Right: Danny, Tiana, Kendall, Ember, Gaby (in order of height).

Help us make sure even more people know about this campaign and learn about The Last Ember: Hunted! Hit one of the links below to share with your followers, friends, email lists, etc.!
CLICK HERE to Share on Facebook!
CLICK HERE to Share on Twitter!
I really appreciate you taking the time to look through the campaign and consider supporting it here on Kickstarter. And thanks for helping us keep the fires lit for The Last Ember! You are AWESOME!
"From a single ember, an endless fire can grow!"
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Backer's support on Kickstarter has been instrumental to the success of Last Ember Press since our very first project in 2017. That success would not have been possible without all the backers and supporters like you for the past three years who have continued to come back and support our new launches.

We take your trust very seriously, believe that!

While this book is not yet finished, the art team is currently working on it right now through the campaign so that we can finish it as soon as possible. 

We have established a strong relationship with a quality printer that we have worked with several times in the past who does great work and helps to insure we deliver the best product possible.

Every campaign here on Kickstarter does come with a certain amount of risk, unforeseen obstacles and lessons learned. We continue to learn with every launch.

Right now, with the state of the world what it is here in 2020, we know that steady communication with our backers throughout the campaign and fulfillment is an absolute must, and should any unforeseen issues arise causing delays, our backers will be the first to know!

Are are dedicated and committed to delivering a great experience and quality reward delivery experience for our backers, so we've invested in the best protective shipping materials for comics and collectibles and we're handling fulfillment 100% in-house to eliminate any risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition.

Last Ember Press and THE LAST EMBER team have a long track record of delivering the goods, and the fact that we are fortunate enough to enjoy so much support from returning backers is evidence of that.

So you can back this campaign with confidence, and we hope to entertain you for years to come!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey everyone!
I have some fully lettered pages to share now!

Hey everyone!
Sorry it's been a while since the last update. If you follow our other projects or social media you probably know, but for those that don't, we had to move suddenly recently (like REALLY recently). In fact, we just moved the last bit of our stuff in yesterday!

Hey all!
Some exciting news today as Rob Leigh has sent in the first 8 lettered pages of Hunted #1!
I'll share some full pages soon, but for now, here are a few panels from random pages to show his style on the book!

updates.update_userinfo: Who's That On the Cover of ASM?
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
I just wanted to give a quick shout out and congrats to The Last Ember artist Federico Sabbatini. For this:

Hey all!
Andrea sent me the last three colored pages today, which look FANTASTIC! 
Which means...
THE COLORS ARE DONE!

Hey everyone!
Federico is a beast! 
Even while working on his first Marvel gig (Which, according to Federico's Facebook page, his editor loved!), he continued to work on Ember and has now completed the inks!

Hello! And Happy Easter to those that celebrate!
As it has been a month since my last update, it seems some of you are eager to get an update on the progress of the book. I know we're slightly behind schedule, but I assure you we are almost there!
We're moving right along on this issue. Here are a couple more issues inked by Federico:

Hey everyone!
Federico has been turning in a page a day of finished inks and the book is looking great! But don't take my word for it, check these out!

Hey Emberverse!
I've got a cool update for you today!
Before I get into that, I wanted to remind you that our Kickstarter for the Comic Book Weekly Podcast ends TONIGHT! In just a couple of hours in fact! So please head over there and check it out!
  PRINTS & BOOKMARKS!

campaign.story:
Welcome to...
Crossover Division #1, Cover A

When stories come to life and threaten to fracture reality beyond repair, only an English professor and a research librarian have the knowledge and smarts to save us all. Join Hank Wallace and Hector Ramirez in Crossover Division #1 as they repel fictional realities that crossover into reality. 

Crossover Division #1 is a 48-page standard comic book with 2 Crossover Division stories. "At the Window" is 26 pages, and "No Place Like Home" is 8 pages. Crossover Division #1 has 2 alternate covers by Conor Hughes and Stéphane Roux. Other campaign exclusives include stickers, temporary tattoos, sketches, and even a handmade book.
Also available is this special Collector's Box containing all the goodies available during this campaign! This is for the serious collectors that want it all!
IF you backed Like Father, Like Daughter #1-7, you can STILL get this print by backing this campaign (Crossover Division #1) and The Last Ember: Hunted #1. If you missed LFLD, though, I'm sorry to say it will no longer be an option.
We've already unlocked four milestones! Check out what's coming up below:
 NEW REWARD TIER!
Be a dreamer, the one causing the crossover in THIS issue!
Pablo Martinena is an Argentinian artist who has worked on many biographical comics for TidalWave Productions. These include Nelson Mandela, David Beckham, Prince William and Kate Midletton, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, Prince, Pope Francis, Diego Maradona, Elizabeth Warren, Lio Messi, Cristiano Ronaldo, and more. Most of these re-edited and translated into other languages. 
Brant Fowler is a designer with over 15 years of industry experience. He has lettered comics for such companies as Image Comics, Action Lab Entertainment, ComixTribe, Moonstone Books, and more. Brant is also co-publisher of Last Ember Press where he writes The Last Ember. Brant also does Kickstarter page design for creators.
Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou is an Algerian-English editor and letterer behind the Eisner-winning PanelxPanel magazine, as well as various comics.
Will Allred is a writer, professor, and technologist. He created and wrote Diary of Night, has fulfilled 2 successful Kickstarters and contributed to the Eisner Award-nominated Comics through Time. His work can be found in multiple anthologies, including Always Punch Nazis, Roads (Not) Taken, and the Edgar Alan Poe Chronicles.

Kickstarter video produced by MK Palmer at SparkHopper.

What People Are Saying...
Comics, coupled with my love of literature and science fiction, has birthed Crossover Division and allowed us to probe the nature of truth and how fiction influences the world. 
We're coming to Kickstarter to help raise funds to pay the art team and print copies of Crossover Division #1. 
The book is nearly complete and nearly ready to go to print. We've come to Kickstarter to help get the book into as many hands as possible and would love your support to bring it to life. 

Here's how the funds we receive during this campaign will be broken down and used:

Click Here to Download Crossover Division - "No Place Like Home"

Crossover Division#1 Variant Cover by Conor Hughes
Crossover Division#1 Variant Cover by Stephane Roux
Money-Back Guarantee
We'd like you to back our project with confidence that we'll deliver the rewards we promise in a timely manner. We're offering a 100% Backer-Satisfaction or your money back. 
If you're not 100% satisfied with your pledge, we'll do what it takes to resolve your issue. And if we can't, simply return your reward, and we'll refund your full pledge amount.
Here's how we expect things to take place for Crossover Division #1:
Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about Crossover Division #1! We really do appreciate it.
It would mean a great deal to us if you became a Crossover Division #1 Backer and helped us bring this series to the world.
If you'd like to help, please select one of the awesome pledge rewards and click the green BACK THIS PROJECT Button at the top of the page to help us make this book a reality.
Thanks again.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a member of the Kickstarter community myself with 2 successfully fulfilled Kickstarters, I know how much it means to ask you to support a new project with your hard earned money, so I've made every effort to minimize any risk to you as a potential backer.

This issue is nearly complete so that when the campaign is successful and Kickstarter has released the funds, files can be uploaded to the printer immediately and digital rewards can be distributed.

This project is very important to me, and my goal is to make sure that every backer leaves this experience satisfied and eagerly looking forward to the next issue of Crossover Division.

If you have any questions or concerns that I may not have covered, please feel free to message me. I want to make your involvement in this project as rewarding as possible.

Feel free to review my previous Kickstarters to see how I have communicated with backers and delivered on fulfillment.

Again, I thank you for your time and support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Crossover Division #2 is live!

Thank you so much for supporting us and Crossover Division!
All Rewards Have Been Delivered!
That's right, the USPS tracking on all the packages shows that they have been delivered! 
So, if you haven't received your reward, please let me know.
If you've had a chance to read Crossover Division #1, the team and I would love to hear what you thought of our debut issue. Also, feel free to post pics of you and Crossover Division #1 on social media and tag me. Who knows, you could potentially show up on the Kickstarter project page.

Thank you so much for supporting us and Crossover Division!
It's time for another weekly update on Crossover Division #1, so let's get right to it.
All Rewards Have Shipped!
That's right, I loaded up the last of the packages in our MINI and dropped off all of the remaining rewards at the Post Office on Saturday. Well, almost all of them. There is still 1 backer who hasn't filled out the survey, so I can't ship that package yet.

Thank you so much for supporting us and Crossover Division!
It's time for another weekly update on Crossover Division #1, so let's get right to it.
Books are shipping!

Thank you so much for supporting us and Crossover Division!
It's time for another weekly update on Crossover Division #1, so let's get right to it!
I received this in an e-mail from the printer today...

Your comic Crossover Division #1 is complete and ready to ship.

Thank you so much for supporting us and Crossover Division!
It's time for another weekly update on Crossover Division #1, but there's not really much to update this week.
Printing has been a little delayed due to Covid-19, so I hope to have an update soon on when I can expect the books to be delivered. The good news is that once the books are delivered, I can immediately start shipping out rewards!

Thank you so much for supporting us and Crossover Division!
It's time for another weekly update on Crossover Division #1.
Not much to update this week. The printer is still working on the book. I did contact them today, and it looks like we might have a slight Covid-related delay, but I'll know more later this week.

Thank you so much for supporting us and Crossover Division!
It's time for another weekly update on Crossover Division #1.
Brant uploaded the files to the printer last week, and they promptly created a digital proof for us to approve.
And, we approved it!

Thank you so much for supporting us and Crossover Division.
It's time for another weekly update on Crossover Division #1.

project_data.project_name: Crossover Division #1: 48-Page Sci-Fi Adventure Series

campaign.story:
Magic! Murder! Mystery!
 In an alternate 1920s, a clueless girl and a man-about-town team up to dive into New York's underground world of rum runners and black market magic.
In an alternate 1920s, America's 18th Amendment outlaws both alcohol and spellcraft--the technology once used to power modern American lives. While the Practical Scientists have stepped in with their new technology, Arcanists won't go down without a fight, and continue to trade spellcraft and crafting materials to keep the art alive.
The 18th Amendment and the Practical Scientists of America
In this double-length issue, the irreverent Chester Radison gets Emily involved in an underground spell-dueling club run by his bookie Mikey Hernandez. Our rag tag pair will have to contend with the seductive spell slinger Sherry Blair, and may even run into her husband, Connor Blair--who happens to be  a Practical gangster. And if Emily can survive all that, luncheon with her sister's fiancé might be a piece of cake.
Black Ball Issue 3 is the next exciting installment in the world of Arcanists vs. Praticals, spell running, moonshining mystery and adventure!
Manga-sized, double-length issue: over 60 pages of half-seas hootnanny adventures with Emily, Chester, and a colorful cast of characters
Beautiful hand-colored, palette shifting art work -- you never know what you'll see next on each page as the colors and tones help tell the tale
Over 30 pages have NEVER BEEN PUBLISHED on any platform. This will be the first time over half this book is ever seen!
Hello! I'm Melissa J Massey, creator of fine fantasy comics like The Alchemist of Aurillia, a fantasy adventure in the Ottoman Empire, and Vatican Assassins, a tale of the Vatican's demon hunting militia. I'm best known for creating lovable and emotive characters and drawing epic architecture. As I always say: when in doubt, slap a cathedral on it.
Black Ball is my ongoing webcomic series, publishing online since 2018.
I've been published in anthologies from Wannabe Press, Arcane Inkdustries, and Kara Love.
Black Ball is many things for me: a challenge to write a concise story; a fun exploration of historical fantasy; and a deconstruction of typical 1920s literature. But as I have written and drawn the story, it has evolved into something much bigger as I look at the characters and the effects of removing a technology that people rely on. So you may find some themes developing in this issue in particular that feel a little familiar.

Here's what people say about Black Ball
"This thing crackles like a 20's comedy, albeit with sound and color (which just makes it even better). You've really taken it up a couple notches artwise, since your triumphant return, mj. " - Charlie Wise, Groovy Kinda

"I've been loving the limited color palettes you've been using for prior pages and enjoying when you break that for emphasis, but I have to say, this page is my favorite so far- the colors are just gorgeous, and the reveal is beautiful! The hot pinks with the electric blue are so vibrant and really give this page great energy!" -Nattosoup
As a history nerd, there's lots of time periods that I love. But fantasy stories haven't yet taken advantage of them all.
One day while chatting in a comic creators group online, the topic of different fantasy setting came up, and I thought of the 1920s as being a perfect setting. The gears started spinning, and I began putting together a tale of magic, murder, and mystery...thus, Black Ball was born.
The best part of making Black Ball is just how much fun it is. Emily embodies a lot of how I felt about myself in High School. Putting her up against Chester, her total opposite, has resulted in some of my best writing and art yet, and it has been a joy to create their adventure through New York's underground together.  At the end of the day, that's why I make comics - to have fun, and to share that fun with others. 
And also to deliver crushing blows every so often...they don't call me a purveyor of fine fantasy comics and tragic shenanigans for nothing!
Most of the project funding will go towards printing books, ordering the extra products, and covering those shipping costs.



Looking for more? The first 90+ pages  of Black Ball are available online to read for free.
 BRAND NEW REWARD TIERS! Original Art at Black Friday prices!!!

Being a solo creator is a real challenge, but thankfully I have the support of great fans like you that help me bring these projects to life.
With you, we can make Black Ball issue 3 a reality, continuing into the meat of the story from Issues 1 and 2. I hope you come along for the ride. It's gonna be a blast.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my third time running a Kickstarter and last time around was a very smooth campaign. My number one goal with my book launches is to create the best experience for you and to make sure you get your rewards with the most convivence and on time.

I'll be honest, we don't know exactly where things are going to be in the next few month. But it's my promise to you that I will do everything in my power to fulfill all rewards on time. I always build in extra time into my timeline estimates to cover any potential delays with vendors, shipping, or any other incidents that may occur. Since I use a domestic printer, I won't have to worry about customs or port delays.

If you have any concerns or questions, please feel free to message me. It is my goal to make your experience with me as rewarding and delightful as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello there my beautiful backers!
Well, I've already had an eventful week! On Monday my motherboard in my computer failed, so I have been trying to deal with that. However, I was at last able to get the digital Add On rewards out to people. Thank you for your patience as I sorted all that out.
And with that, that's a wrap! Everything has been sent out unless you didn't get your survey in to me, which I am still missing a couple. If you haven't gotten your survey in, there's still time for you to do that!

project_data.project_name: Black Ball #1-3

campaign.story:
A father with superpowers, leaves his wife and daughter to become “Invulnerable” - the world’s only superhero. Ten years later his daughter discovers that she has inherited the very superpowers that made her father leave their family.
In our newest installment, Invulnerable has been kidnapped by the KGB - led by none other than Casey’s mother, Jessica Ryder. Casey never wanted to be like her father, but will Invulnerable’s kidnapping cause Casey to embrace her super heroic roots?
It’s the penultimate issue of our first arc, and we promise nothing will be the same following our finale!
What Critics Have To Say... 
Following a successful round of variant covers for issue 6, we have even more talented artists that contributed to issue 7.
Cover B – “Fight For Your Life – An Invulnerable Portrait” – Andrew Hunt
Invulnerable has been through the ringer both emotionally and physically in these past few issues. Andrew Hunt shows these wounds perfectly in our Cover B Variant.
Andrew Hunt is a graduate of Otis College of Art and Design. His work includes concept art for Warner Brother’s Suicide Squad film and as an illustrator for Stan Lee’s POW! Entertainment.
 Cover C – “Lo-Fi Hip Hop” – Alina L. 
An homage to Lo-Fi Hip Hop radio with an anime styled cover as Casey, Stephanie, and Wes relax and study in Casey’s room.
Alina L. is a current student at Otis College of Art and Design as a digital artist.
 Cover D – “Dual Identity” – Linnéa AKA PapurrCat Virgin Cover 
Casey in superhero action as her mother does what she does best - hides in the shadows!
Linnéa AKA PapuurCat is a 2D artist best known for her artwork of female TV heroines that she shares to her large, loyal twitter following.
Cover A
What happened to Casey? Has she been captured? Who's in the body bag?  Find out more with Like Father, Like Daughter #7!
Following multiple successful Kickstarters – Kat Calamia and Wayne A. Brown’s Like Father, Like Daughter returns with its seventh installment where Casey takes center stage. Self-publishing under Calamia’s brand, Comic Uno, a reliable source in comics for over a decade.
Writer - Kat Calamia
Writer - Kat Calamia
Next to her weekly comic book reviews on Comic Uno, Calamia also currently works for Newsarama and DC Comics’ DC Universe with bylines with IGN, Fandom, and TV Guide. She has a Bachelor’s degree in Communications and minor in Journalism through Marymount Manhattan and a MFA in Writing and Producing Television from LIU Brooklyn.
Artist - Wayne Brown
Artist - Wayne Brown
Brown has been an artist his whole life, being more passionate about art than anything in the world. He has a degree in Graphic Design, four wonderful children two boys and two girls, a beautiful wife.
Colorist - Lisa Moore
Colorist - Lisa Moore
Lisa Moore is a comic book enthusiast, colorist and illustrator, who has worked as a colorist on books like GARFIELD, PEANUTS, BRAVEST WARRIORS, and more for BOOM! Studios, DAMSELS AND GRIMM for Dynamite and more. She's the writer of SECRETS OF WILLOWMYST from Last Ember Press where she's co-Publisher. She also just got married to her best friend - Brant Fowler!
Letterer - Brant Fowler
Brant Fowler has been lettering comic books for nearly two decades working on titles from companies like Image Comics, Action Lab Entertainment, ComixTribe, Moonstone Books and more. He's worked in various capacities in the industry from flatting to editing, to running comic journalism websites.  Brant is the writer/creator of THE LAST EMBER (also live on Kickstarter!) and co-writer of CELESTIAL FALCON for his and his wife's company, Last Ember Press. Brant also designs Kickstarter pages, like this one you're reading!


Back Like Father, Like Daughter, Last Ember: Hunted, and Crossover Division at a physical level to get this gorgeous print by the Last Ember art team - Federico Sabbatini and Andrea Celestini.
Last Ember - Ember Madison is the last of the fire goddesses incarnate, but she is not aware of this!
All she knows is that one day, the fire deep inside came swirling to the surface and her world was changed forever. Now, she is... The Last Ember!
A hooded figure watches her every move from the shadows, while a serial killer hunts beings of power like Ember, slowly making his way to her.
Crossover Division - When stories come to life and threaten to fracture reality beyond repair, only an English professor and a research librarian have the knowledge and smarts to save us all. Join Hank Wallace and Hector Ramirez in Crossover Division #1 as they repel fictional realities that crossover into reality.
Get this beautiful print by Michael Oeming (Powers, The After Realm) colored by Lisa Moore by backing this project and The After Realm. Physical backers get this physically and digital backers will get it digitally. 
"The After Realm is an ongoing fantasy series about an Elf escaping her world after Raganarok. By the co-creator of the comic POWERS."
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've attempted to manage all of the risks associated with this project by doing most of the leg work before this campaign's launch so that we could ensure that we continue to deliver immediately after the campaign. As we did with our previous Kickstarters we will consistently update backers and supporters with any issues that may potentially cause delays in the completion of this project and make the necessary adjustments to resolve those matters quickly and efficiently. We understand the importance of fulfilling our promises and always ensure that all of our supporters receive their rewards. And we always find ways to sneak extra swag into our reward packages as a thank you for the patience in supporting our projects on the front end and patiently waiting for them to be completed and delivered....so we can focus on the fun part.....making comics!!! It's because of your continued support that we are able to make these AWESOME comics! And for that we truly appreciate ALL of our backers and keep a wide open form of communication for you all to reach us at any time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
HAUNTING/Like Father, Like Daughter Crossover #1 is LIVE on Kickstarter!
This is my newest project with my writing partner, Phil Falco, where our 2 flagship titles CROSSOVER!
Bram is a bratty teenager who just wants to be left alone. Too bad wherever he goes, THE DEAD RISE!
Casey is a high school student whose father abandoned her to become a full-time superhero. She's finally forced to grapple with her complicated feelings towards him when she !

updates.update_userinfo: HAUNTING/Like Father, Like Daughter Crossover #1 LAUNCHES May 24th!
updates.update_content: The next Like Father, Like Daughter Kickstarter is launching May 24th and this time its a 44 page CROSSOVER with my writing partner - Phil Falco. He has a horror/supernatural comic book called Haunting. Bram is a bratty teenager who just wants to be left alone. Too bad wherever he goes, THE DEAD RISE!

We still have plenty of days left for THE DANCER campaign, but with my good friend Phil Falco's horror comic book - HAUNTING also live I didn't want to miss the opportunity to give a sneak peek of our next project. LIKE FATHER, LIKE DAUGHTER and Haunting is getting a 43 page crossover this Summer!

updates.update_userinfo: They Call Her...The Dancer #1 Kickstarter is LIVE!
updates.update_content:
The creator of Like Father, Like Daughter has launched a new Kickstarter for her comic book, They Call Her...The Dancer.
"A dancer/ASSASSIN is forced to deal with her childhood trauma of witnessing her parents' deaths."

Thanks to Comic Impressions the physical copies of Like Father, Like Daughter are here. I'll be taking this week to pack everything, and head them off to the post office. Check your Kickstarter messages if you want the tracking number.

Like Father, Like Daughter #7 has officially hit your inbox, and all the other digital rewards including add ons and previous issues. I would love to hear your thoughts. Order has been put in with the printer. So, we should be packing physical rewards in the next few weeks.

updates.update_userinfo: Lettering in Progress + Our Weekly Comic Book Podcast Launches A Kickstarter!
updates.update_content: Hello Like Father, Like Daughter readers. Kat here. I’m excited to let you all know that we are extremely close to the finish line for LFLD #7. Brant is working on the letters as we speak and I’m aiming to have the digital version of the book in everyone’s inbox in about 2 weeks and then we are off to the printer.

I hope everyone had a great holiday! This week I sent out the surveys for the campaign - it's very important to fill these out, especially for physical backers for the sake of fulfillment. 
I'm glad to say we are pretty ahead of schedule for the book. All the interiors have wrapped and we are now up to the coloring and lettering stage - then off to the printer.  
What's Next For 2021
They Call Her...The Dancer #1 Kickstarter

project_data.project_name: Like Father, Like Daughter #1-7: A Superhero Drama

campaign.story:
THE CHRISTMAS ODYSSEY CONTINUES!
Last Fall, the first issue of BRIC-A-BRAC successfully funded on Indiegogo.
We met our main characters Garret and Marie as they embarked on their journey to find Father Christmas and save Planet Christmas from impending doom. That doom, almost single-handedly, was brought by General Almond and his army of Nutcrackers who were determined to take over the Planet and steal its resources.
Issue Two continues this epic story while adding more characters and obstacles! You will meet new characters like the ominous Jack Frost, the evil Caesar Dimitrius, and the Ghosts of Christmas Past, Present and Future among others!
Issue Two will be a 30-page comic book written by Ryan Haack, featuring interior art by Rafael Sam. The comic book will also include a five-page back-up story with art by Tom Barton. 
BRIC-A-BRAC #2 Interiors, Rafael Sam
BRIC-A-BRAC #2 Interiors, Rafael Sam
Page 1, The Tragedy of Jack Frost
Page 3, The Tragedy of Jack Frost
Exclusive Jack Frost Print
THE CREATORS
WRITER/CREATOR - RYAN HAACK
My name is RYAN HAACK and I'm the creator and writer of BRIC-A-BRAC! Since I was a little kid, I was fascinated by Christmas and all the lore surrounding it! I loved the imagery, the decorations, the holiday specials, and I still do to this day! BRIC-A-BRAC is my attempt at creating a story that can show adults and children how valuable and important Christmas is as a concept! It's an incredibly useful holiday with ideals and values which we can implement every single day of our lives! I am so passionate about this story and had an absolute BLAST writing in the dramatic, fun, and always exciting world that is BRIC-A-BRAC! I am the host of the FAR-FETCHED STORYTELLING PODCAST and the creator of the web-comic the UNSPEAKABLE TEXT, too!
Me circa 2002
INTERIOR ARTIST/CHARACTER DESIGNER - RAFAEL SAM
Born in São Paulo, and raised in Recife (PE), Rafael Sam has worked as a freelance illustrator and comic artist for 9 years. He has worked in the area of textbooks and also comic books, in cartoon style, concept art, and has made scenes for animations. Some time ago, he worked for DreamWorks Animation's comics division, where he made 3 editions of the Madagascar title. He recently worked on the catharsis-funded Black Desert author project where he made the official launch at ccxp 2018. His Instagram is @rafael1234hc. 
COVER ARTIST/BACK-UP STORY ARTIST - TOM BARTON
Tom’s been working as an illustrator for the last 5 years. He’s done several comics, including a short webcomic series for League of Legends called “Olaf Vs Everything”. His biggest influences are the likes of Joe Madureira, Chris Bachalo, and Ed McGuinness. When he’s not working on comics, he’s coming up with character designs, concept art, and writing his own stories. His Instagram is @tomo_tron.
Page 2, The Tragedy of Jack Frost
FAN ART FOR BRIC-A-BRAC #2! 
Christmas Money by The Howl Comics
General Almond by @ZachDB
Garret by Milton Aguiar
Garret, Marie and the Spider-Snowman by MuttManComics

THE LOGISTICS
As mentioned before, this will be a 25+ page comic book. It will be identical in design to the last comic we produced for BRIC-A-BRAC #1. Because they are so similar, it was very easy for me to calculate shipping costs and how much I will need to deliver the best product possible. Here's some breakdowns for those interested:
PRODUCTION OF COMIC (ART/LETTERING) : $5,000
PRINTING (ISSUE 2 and REPRINTS of ISSUE 1): $1,000
SHIPPING (NATION-WIDE AND INTERNATIONAL) : $2,500
EXTRA FEES (KICKSTARTER FEES) :$500

SHIPPING
This book will not be completed before Christmas, although we presently have about 20% of it done. My goal is to have it in your hands by January or February, which was the same time the books were in the backers hands with BRIC-A-BRAC #1. The digital books will be available first. This might be upsetting to backers, but digital copies of issue #1 will be available before Christmas 2020. If the physical copy being delivered before Christmas is a deal-breaker for you, we want you to know that this story is about the idea of Christmas--not the holiday. On Planet Christmas, Christmas is every single day. It's about implementing Christmas cheer into each of our lives everyday, for a better tomorrow!

PLEASE HELP US MAKE THIS COMIC BOOK A REALITY!

updates.update_content:
Hey backers, 

We are only 10% away from funding BRIC-A-BRAC #2 on Indiegogo! Hooray! We are so close! 
However, we just have three more days to make it happen. 
I know this project has been through the wringer more than one time, but we've never been this close to funding before! If you've been hesitating to back the book, consider doing it now. If you can't contribute but you'd like us to fund, then please consider sharing the book on all your social media platforms!

Hey backers,
Wow! People are really showing their Christmas Spirit over on our campaign on Indiegogo! We already got to 51% and we launched last Tuesday!
If you backed the book already, thank you. If you haven't, I encourage you to check out what we have in store for you with BRIC-A-BRAC #2! Back or share the campaign if you can!
LINK: https://igg.me/at/jUExRVHK1i4/x/22413235#/
Thanks,
Ryan

Hey backers, 
So we've been through a lot with this campaign. If you've been following, we had to can this campaign 'cause the goal was simply too high. 
But a new hope has ARISEN! BRIC-A-BRAC #2 is on Indiegogo right now with a goal of 5k! 
I know we can reach this goal, as it was the same goal as last time. Please, consider sharing or backing the campaign. I hope I've demonstrated to all of you how much I care about continuing this epic Christmas tale!

Hey backers, 

You're probably noticing that the campaign has been cancelled. Before you worry, just know that it's temporary. We're coming back before Christmas, rest assured! Actually, we're coming back on November 15th.

updates.update_userinfo: SHARE THE CAMPAIGN AND HELP US SPREAD THE WORD!
updates.update_content:
Hey backers, 
We're at about 20% and we have roughly three-weeks left of the campaign. That means, we're in good shape, but if we really want to ensure this campaign's success, we must work together to share the campaign!
If you are feeling generous, consider raising your pledge to one of the awesome tiers, too!

Hey backers, 
Things are going well so far. According to Kicktraq's analytics, we're still on the way to reaching our goal. 
That being said, I need you guys to make like elves and share this campaign as much as you can. If you know somebody who loves Christmas and comics (or one of the two exclusively) then please tell them about this epic Christmas odyssey called BRIC-A-BRAC!

updates.update_userinfo: THANKS FOR A GREAT LAUNCH DAY!
updates.update_content:
Hey backers, 
Yesterday was awesome! Thanks to all you early backers who joined the party on launch day! 

I can't tell you how much it helps. Launch day is probably the most critical day of a campaign, except for the last day of funding. Although I've had some pretty lousy launch days in the past, this is the best one yet! Thanks to you, I have confidence we can reach our goal--but we'll have to fight hard!

campaign.story:
There's the wrong way to do social media, and then there's DR. BRADLEY J. GUIGAR'S FOUR-C's OF SOCIAL MEDIA. And with this gorgeous new magnet, you'll always be ready to use the Four-C's...
Creation! 
Curation! 
Commercial!

This two-week Quickstarter from the "Comics Dads" of ComicLab aims to make this gorgeous 2.5"x4" magnet. Join us now! Time is short!

The big risk, here, is that Brad will get EVEN MORE HANDSOME during the course of this two-week Quickstarter, and then the magnet image will no longer match his handsomeness.

...We're kidding! The risks here are that the pandemic could in some way *delay* the production and distribution of this magnet to folks. And in such a circumstance, we'll do everything we can to communicate with you clearly and honestly until the situation can be resolved to your satisfaction!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
THIS IS THE FINAL DAY OF THE CAMPAIGN!
An ancient power rises once again and it is up to an unlikely hero and his friends to save the world from this dark evil force that threatens to consume and destroy all life on Earth!

Celestial Falcon is a coming of age superhero story dealing with supernatural forces that challenge this group of friends to become more than they ever thought possible: heroes.
 We've unlocked the first, and we're close to unlocking the second!
 We've just added this new reward tier to join a Zoom call with the writers!
WHY DIGITAL?
To keep costs lower, we decided to come back this time for a digital edition. This way, we'll also be able get it in your hands faster. 
Because it's digital, it allows us to do some really cool rewards we're excited about!
People who love Superhero stories.
People who love stories with supernatural themes and action.
If you love sharks, you're going to LOVE this issue.
Fans of coming of age stories where characters go on epic journeys and face seemingly insurmountable obstacles.

People who don't like character-driven stories.
Those that don't root for the underdog.
People that don't like twists on popular themes and plots told in refreshing ways.
Uncool people that don't like sharks in their comics!
 Celestial Falcon #2 is a 32-page standard American size single issue digital comic book.
This is an extra-sized issue with 26 pages of story! Plus additional content!
Digital Prints of our JAWS homage variant and  Celestial vs. Megalodon Battle variant! 
All backers will receive extra bonus digital content throughout the campaign!
Chris is a YouTuber and lifelong comic book and Superman fan. He has been writing stories for half his life, and now gets to live out his dream seeing his creations in print. Celestial Falcon is his first comic book.
Brant is the Co-Publisher of Last Ember Press and writer of The Last Ember series. He has also been lettering comics for the better part of two decades, with work published through Image Comics, Action Lab Entertainment, Arcana, Moonstone, AC Comics and more. Celestial Falcon is his first foray into full-on co-writing a project.
Lucas is a 2D and 3D artist developing artwork for comic books, and concept art for the entertainment industry. He is the series artist for Celestial Falcon and creator of the fan comic Spider-Cop. https://www.artstation.com/lulisluc
Nimesh can be found coloring for Indies and self-publishing comics. He lives in the top vacation spot, Portugal. When I’m… oops…. I mean, when he’s not coloring comics he usually is watching movies/Tv Shows or enjoying the family and reading comics.
He can be reached at social medias under @nimesh.art.
Clay is an actor, writer and director, best known for his animation voice-over work and as a co-creator for FRIED Comics. An alum of the Comics Experience lettering course, he currently letters the book RED XMAS for FRIED. You can read his work for free at friedcomics.com/free"
Nicole is the creator/writer of Road Trip to Hell, her first creator-owned project! She's a passionate comic book collector who has worked for Action Lab Entertainment as marketing director, submissions editor and a script editor. She has also worked on several of their adaptations, including Peter David's Artful and on the Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir comics. She helped write an issue of their ongoing DollFace series. She's also an accomplished freelance editor. Learn more at ComicMaven.com.
ADDITIONAL ARTISTS:
Linnéa did the stunning digital painting of Celestial Falcon facing off against the Megalodon! Find more here: @Papurrcat 
Laura Rimaszombati did the gorgeous JAWS Homage and Shark & Dingy image! Find more here:  @laura_rimaszombati
"Very professionally done. Well done, guys."
~ JLS Comics
"I'm really excited for the ride and where it's going to go!"
~ Comic Uno
Brant was interviewed about Celestial Falcon #2 by Bill Coulombe on his Under the Mask Podcast!
Brant was also interviewed by Matt Kund on his Constructing Comics Podcast:
This time around, we are looking for funding to complete the art for the rest of this issue, and we're adding in some cool ways to do just that in this campaign. See the rewards for details on how YOU can be a part of that!
We also just love this platform and community. As a whole, Last Ember Press has successfully funded 7 previous campaigns, including the first issue of this series!
Check out these killer pages straight from the issue! Plans are made, threats are encountered and secrets are revealed!
 We tried to come up with some really cool rewards for this digital edition, including exclusive audio and video commentaries, your likeness in this very issue, and more!


If you have decided to join us on this journey, THANK YOU sincerely from the entire creative team of Celestial Falcon and everyone at Last Ember Press and Shooting Star Universe.
If you're still trying to decide on which reward to get, scroll back through the page, and if you're a fan of SUPERHEROES, SHARKS, SUPERNATURAL VILLAINS and FUN, COMING OF AGE stories, please show your support by backing this campaign!
Help us continue to spread the word so more people like you can find it!
You can direct your friends to CELESTIALFALCON.COM/take2 or use one of these links:
Share on Facebook
Share on Twitter
Thanks!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We realize how risky backing a project can be, so we want to alleviate that concern.

Last Ember Press has successfully funded 7 previous campaigns and we continue to deliver on our promises. LEP and SSU are in this for the long haul. We are passionate and dedicated to completing quality books and getting them in the hands of our readers.

This issue is being worked on and we will continue to update backers on the progress of the issue after the campaign is over all the way until it has been delivered to all of your inboxes.

We value your support and know that at any given time there are a number of other projects you could be backing instead of ours. We greatly and deeply appreciate you choosing to put your support with us on Celestial Falcon #2.

So really, the only risk is missing out on an awesome project should you choose not to support it. Otherwise, we know you will be pleased with the process and the final product!

Should you have any further concerns, you can message us directly here on Kickstarter or email me at brant@lastemberpress.com.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
Sorry for the long silence and delay on rewards.
Lisa and I recently had to move and we've just gotten settled in over the past week. It was a long month and a half process getting all that squared away.

Hey everyone!
I just emailed you and messaged you all your rewards!
We hope you enjoy the new issue, and for those that got the digital deluxe, the over 100 pages of content!
We'll have an announcement coming soon, which we teased at the end of both the standard and deluxe editions, so look for that in these updates soon as well.
Thank you all again for your support and patience!

Hey everyone!
As promised, all the surveys have now been sent, so please get those back to us ASAP!
We will send all digital rewards this week to those that complete surveys right away.
Otherwise, as soon as we get your surveys back!

Hey backers!
You will get your digital deluxe hopefully this weekend!
The reason why is this genius work by our letterer Clay Adams:

Hey all!
You may recall in the last update how I said we were working on something for the signs in that one panel.

Hey everyone!
Clay has wrapped up ALL the lettering on Celestial Falcon #2!
Or at least 99.99% of it!
As you may recall from the campaign, we had a tier where you could get your name on a sign.  Those will be on page 5. And while the dialogue is lettered on page 5, those signs are NOT!

Hey everyone!
Just a quick update to let you know that Nimesh just wrapped up the colors on the issue!
Here is a really cool flashback sequence:

Hey all!
Nimesh sent a few more colored pages of Celestial Falcon #2! Before I get to that, though, I wanted to remind you of mine and Chris' current Kickstarter for our Podcast, Comic Book Weekly!
This campaign is to fund an audio version of our weekly LIVE YouTube show with our friends Kat and Mike. We've been doing a version of this show for many years now, and we are looking to expand our audience.

Hey everyone!
We have some new colored pages to share with you! 
Before I get to those, I want to tell you about a children's book campaign our friend John Wilson is running right now called BLUE.

project_data.project_name: Celestial Falcon #1-2: Supernatural Superhero Digital Comic

campaign.story:
ADD-ONS now available at check out. If there are any books or extras that don't fit into your pledge you can now add them on. If there's anything you don't see, let us know and we will make sure you can get it!

Set in a near future where monsters appeared suddenly and without warning, bringing death and destruction. Ramon Alejandro Estévez-Guerrero roams the earth fighting these monsters in memory of his late wife and to make a better world for his daughter – he is the MONSTER MATADOR!
 WHO?
Ramon Alejandro Estévez-Guerrero - the MONSTER MATADOR! 
WHAT?
Born from out love of Mad-Max, Kaiju and Santo and... telenovelas?! The Monster Matador is an action-packed mash-up of all those things, with more than a few laughs to spare. Just don't laugh at the Matador. He does not like to be laughed at.
HOW?
Yes, how?! How exactly does a 6 ft tall Matador fight giant-sized-Kaiju monsters? With a cape and sword, of course. Sometimes also with dirty diapers, but we don't need to get into that here (hint, check out issue #2)
WHY?
Uh, why not? But seriously did you not see the pull quote from DAVID PEPOSE of the hit Kickstarter THE  O.Z., or the one from Ringo-Award Winner RYLEND GRANT, or Kickstarter mainstay Clay Adams or... well, you get the picture.
But seriously, this book is a wild ride. If you love any of the things I mentioned above, or if you just love good comics, I promise you'll love MONSTER MATADOR. And for you art lovers out there, the book is drawn by Ringo Award Nominated artist FABIO ALVES (BANJAX, THE JUMP). Just check out this cover: 
Fabio Alves Cover
 Right?!
MONSTER MATADOR is written by Steven Prince with Colorist Alex Zief joining Fabio Alves on art duties. We launched the first issue of our 3-issue mini-series, Tango of the Matadors, on Kickstarter in June 2020 and were fully funded in 24 hours! Now we're back with Issue #2. 
Our campaign is to raise funds to print Monster Matador: Tango of the Matadors #2 and hopefully hit a couple of Stretch Goals along the way.
Psst, these are our variant covers from Tony Donley (ALBERT EINSTEIN: TIME MASON) and FANGORIA artist Puis Calzada. 
Tony Donley KS Exclusive and Puis Calzada Limited Variant
In Chapter 1 we met the Monster Matador in the midst of battle with the dreaded Volagante and her brood among the Mayan ruins in Guatemala. Fighting alongside a rag-tag group of locals and joined by a second "Monster Matador", they formulate a plan to defeat the Volagante once and for all...
PLAY

Chapter 2 continues the story with action, adventure, romance, and... betrayal. I'm hesitant to give away more because there are some great twists and turns and a cliffhanger that I guarantee will have your jaw on the floor. Oh, and there's that thing about fighting monsters with dirty diapers I mentioned above.
The main story is 27 pages and will be printed on UV coated glossy paper with a 100lb UV coated cover stock. Here's a look at what to expect...
Ringo Award Nominee for Best Cover Artist, Fabio Alves (BANJAX, THE JUMP), draws our main cover with striking colors from Alex Zief (HATCHET, RAMAS) featuring the Matadors and Angelo riding to battle.
Fabio Alves Cover
In addition to the main cover from Fabio Alves, you can also choose from our Kickstarter Exclusive Cover by Tony Donley and Variant Cover by Puis Calzada with colors by Alex Zief. Both covers will be printed in extremely limited quantities.  
Tony Donley KS Exclusive & Puis Calzada/Alex Zief Variant
Missed issue #1? Don't worry, we've got you covered. Choose from the main Fabio Alves cover, KS Exclusive by Kyle Roberts or the Check Your Matador Variant. Both the KS Exclusive and Check Your Matador are available in very limited quantities. 
As a special thank you and bonus, each Issue 2 cover will come with its own trading card. Certain tiers will also come with an additional Signature card signed by Creator/Writer Steven Prince. And you'll also have the opportunity to get a mini-print of Tony Donley's Kickstarter Exclusive cover.
Honestly, we just thought this was cool... and it looks pretty awesome, too. This 9x12 glow-in-the-dark screenprint is printed by world-famous Nakatomi Print Labs on 100lb Cougar White stock. For the color scheme we decided to go with the colors of the Mexican flag to represent the Monster Matador's heritage. 
Art: Fabio Alves. Color/Design: Steven Prince. Limited Edition of 55. S/N by Steven Prince
We have a very limited amount of Tony Donley original art Sketch cards that will be available in their own specific tier. Here's a peak at some of the cards:  
You'll also be able to get sketch cards from series creator, Steven Prince. Here's a sampling:
Fabio draws digitally, so original art from Tango of the Matador's is rare to put it simple. Tony Donley's cover, however, was done in pen and ink on Bristol board. This is your chance to own the 9x12 original art to Tony's Kickstarter Exclusive cover in a reward tier that includes everything but the kitchen sink!. 
All backers will receive extra bonus content throughout the campaign, and we'll be adding stretch goals along the wat including stickers, prints, digital comics and more!
DETAILS COMING SOON!!! 

And if there is some combination of rewards that you don't see or would like, we are happy to work with you and get you what you want. Just send us a message.
STEVEN PRINCE used to work in the toy industry where he  managed and developed toy lines and animation projects for Puppy in My Pocket, Stink Blasters, and Power Buggz. He is the writer and occasional artist of MONSTER MATADOR, INTERGALACDICK, and unemployANT. He lives in Los Angeles.
 FABIO ALVES is an independent comic artist  based in Brazil. In addition to MONSTER MATADOR, Fabio has collaborated with Ringo-Award winner Rylend Grant on the Kickstarter hit, THE JUMP, and on the critically acclaimed  Action Lab: Danger Zone series, BANJAX for which he was recently nominated for a Ringo Award.
ALEX ZIEF is a  colorist based in Mexico City. She has colored for American Mythology  Press, as well as comics including MS. VALKYRIE and RAMAS.
TONY DONLEY is an SVA alum and the creator and artist of ALBERT EINSTEIN: TIME MASON and has drawn comics for Zenescope among others. 
PUIS CALZADA, Monster Master, is a Comic Book Artist for American Mythology, Chido Comics, Eibon Press and illustrator for Fangoria Magazine 
KATRINA ROETS is our proofreader. She is also the author of children's stories and young adult fiction.
Rest assured we pack your rewards with care. The last thing we want is for anyone to receive a mangled copy of the book and their extra rewards. All books are bagged and boarded and will be shipped in a sturdy Gemini Mailer. 
For those ordering the limited edition print, those will placed in a hard plastic topload holder and shipped in a USPS priority mail box to ensure it arrives mint.
The book is 100% complete and the initial Kickstarter goal will go towards printing. Everything beyond that will go toward production for issue #3 on which we are already underway. 
Just as with our first Kickstarter, once the funds transfer the book will go straight to the printer and PDFs will be sent. We don't want to keep you waiting! 
All funds from this campaign will go to:
Printing rewards
Shipping them to you
Anything above our goal goes to toward for production issues 3 and beyond.
Because the Kickstarter community is amazing. I’ll be honest in that I was a little late to the party, but some of the best comics I’ve read over the past couple of years are books I’ve backed right here on Kickstarter. I'm happy to be a part of it and the entore creative team appreciates your support.

Risks and challenges
While any project comes with some risk, given the challenging times we are living through, we're doing everything we can to minimize it. The book is 100% finished and ready to go to print. With your backing, we are confident we can make Monster Matador: Tango of the Matadors #2 a reality.

updates.update_userinfo: ONE DAY LEFT + CINCO DE MAYO BONUS!
updates.update_content:
Happy Cinco De Mayo!
There is only one more day to hop on board to check out the thrilling conclusion to Monster Matador: Tango of the Matadors! If you haven't yet, you can back it here: bit.ly/MonsterMatador3
I'm also announcing a special Cinco de Mayo bonus for backers. A postcard featuring art from Upper Deck artist Michael Watson (digital backers will receive a PDF). This was drawn live on his show Chat and Draw. You can check that . Or just click on the drawing below:

Hola Matadors!
Just a quick reminder that we have only 1 week left in our campaign for the final issue of Tango of the Matadors. Not only that, but we are only $15 away from unlocking our first stretch goal and moving toward the second. Who's going to bring us over the top? Back it HERE:

updates.update_userinfo: HALFWAY THERE + LIMITED MAGMA FOIL COVER
updates.update_content:
Just a quick reminder that we are halfway through the campaign and while we have reached our initial funding goal, we are now about halfway to hitting our first stretch goal at 4k! So if you haven't yet had a chance to back the campaign, there's no better time than now. Back it HERE.
Myself, Fabio and Alex are really happy with how this one turned out and can't wait for everyone to see it.

updates.update_userinfo: Vote Monster Matador! Ringo Awards Nominations are open!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone
As we head into the weekend just wanted to drop a quick note. Ringo Award nominations are now open and everyone can vote for their favorites at www.ringoawards.com For your consideration... MONSTER MATADOR!

updates.update_userinfo: Issue 3 Early Bird Specials End Soon
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone

Just a quick note that Issue #3's early Bird Specials end later tonight. We're currently at about 66% to our funding goal. So now is a great time to back and check out the epic conclusion to our first mini-series. Visit the campaign page here:

updates.update_userinfo: MONSTER MATADOR #3 is live on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hello Matadors!
Just a heads up that the epic conclusion to our first mini-series, TANGO OF THE MATADORS is now live on Kickstarter. Check it out right here to find out who lives, who dies, and whether or not the Monster Matador will prevail against the Volagante!

Hey Everyone,

Hope you're all doing well and enjoyed Monster Matador: TOTM #2. You should have received your digital rewards back in November to your email, but I've noticed that some people haven't got them yet, probably cause the email went to SPAM. So if for some reason you haven't gotten your rewards, let me know and I will send the ASAP.

Hey Everyone,
The books have all been shipped! You should have received a tracking # automatically, but if you haven't let me know and I can send it over. As you're probably aware, there have been delays and shipping has been slower than usual. Everything was shipped First Class and Priority for the bigger packages so hopefully the wait won't be too long.

project_data.project_name: MONSTER MATADOR: TANGO OF THE MATADORS #1-2

campaign.story:
/// FUNDED + 3 Stretch Goals Unlocked ///
Scroll down to view our Stretch Goals, which include 8 Digital Indie Comics and two Print Illustrations at no additional cost to backers!

/// New Add-On Print! ///
Get into the holiday spirit with this Halloween Print by Mauricio Mora! Add it to your rewards for just USD $4!
"Halloween Print" by Mauricio Mora
/// Foil Cover Upgrade (Kickstarter Exclusive) ///
For those collectors who love metallic covers, we're offering a Kickstarter Exclusive upgrade for the HAUNTING #2 Cover C. Any backer who is already receiving our "Stained-glass" Cover has the option to upgrade their cover stock from 100# gloss to Rainbow White Stream Foil.
Click image for Foil Cover sample photo
To upgrade to the Foil Cover, simply add USD $6 to any pledge which already includes HAUNTING #2 Cover C as a reward item.
Note that this offer is only for HAUNTING #2 "Stained-glass" Cover C and not any of the other covers available at this time. Jump on board now, because this will be your only chance!
HAUNTING is an ongoing supernatural horror comic series. It is written and created by Phil Falco, with art by Anna Wieszczyk, colors by Andres Samboni, and letters by LetterSquids.
HAUNTING follows Bram, your average, everyday bratty teenager...who just so happens to RAISE THE DEAD!
Wherever he goes, ghosts appear - restless spirits that attack the living viciously and without prejudice. Bram has spent his entire life turning a blind eye to the destruction and deaths caused by his strange ability. But his recklessness finally catches up to him in the form of Deacon, a mysterious and vengeful man from his past. Deacon corners Bram and Faith, a small-town girl with a tragic past, in Dusty Springs. Now Bram will be forced to learn that his actions have consequences... whether he takes responsibility for those consequences is another question entirely.
Our first Kickstarter was a success, so we're back with more supernatural goodness! When we last left Bram and Faith, the two had just barricaded themselves in a church mausoleum. Unfortunately for Faith, she is unaware of Bram's ability. And she has no idea just how much danger she's in!

Check out this 5-page Preview for HAUNTING #2 below! You can also view the pages in a higher resolution here.
Page 1
Page 2
Page 3
Page 4
Page 5
All that and more awaits you in HAUNTING #2! So pledge now for action...
...drama...
and of course: GHOSTS! 


In an effort to show the many different sides of HAUNTING and its characters, we're offering two Variant Covers as rewards for this issue. Some really talented artists worked on these covers, so we hope you'll consider backing a reward that includes them!
Cover B by Cassio Ribeiro
Cover C by Longestdistance
And be sure to check out more of Cassio Ribeiro's and Longestdistance's artwork!

Here are the Rewards we're offering this time around!
We're also offering some of the Rewards from our first Kickstarter as Add-ons for those looking for even more HAUNTING content!
Simply add the above dollar amounts to your pledge total to receive these add-on rewards!
Now take a look at the three Stretch Goals we've managed to unlock!
If we hit USD $7,000.00 before the campaign ends in a few hours, we'll be adding another five (5) comics to the Digital Indie Comics Bundle!

Our team is already hard at work on HAUNTING #3, so jump on board now for the ghostly adventure of a lifetime!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As was the case with our first issue, risk for this project is minimal. The covers and 24 interior pages for the issue are complete, so we expect digital rewards will be sent just a few days after the funding period ends.

We intend to use the same printer, Comic Impressions, for production of the physical comics. Rewards should arrive before December, but we wanted to give ourselves extra time in the "Expected Delivery" window to allow for any unanticipated production or shipping delays.

Even though the risk of spreading of COVID-19 via mail is very low, we intend to be overly cautious in all matters involving the transfer of goods. To mitigate risk as much as humanly possible, we will wear gloves and masks while handling all rewards and shipping materials. The health and safety of our backers is of the utmost importance to us.

We are committed to consistently and frequently updating backers each step of the way and intend to deliver as quickly as humanly possible!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hi, I'm Barry Lewis, a food lover & YouTuber .... & I like pizza! Big time.... Before I get started if you'd like an audio version of this section, click to hear about the campaign in my own words whilst scrolling.
A few years back I picked up a camera and filmed myself trying to poach an egg. I stuck the clip on the Internet... and it changed my life. I taught myself how to cook online and subsequently fell in love with good food, plus accidentally became part of a really cool story; inspiring people to cook, helping viewers through tough times and, I guess to a degree, becoming an online friend to lots of folk around the world.
My Wife (aka Mrs Barry) made this as she said it sums me up in two photos?!
If you don’t know, I live in Weston-super-Mare, a small seaside town in South West England. I absolutely love pizza and want to share my passion for it here in my town by creating an artisan pizzeria complete with wood-fired pizza, fresh dough and the most funky, cosy layout that doubles up as a cooking school for all you guys around the world.
This is a huge passion project of mine, I’ve been waiting on the right premises for 18 months, and it is just perfect. Of course it’s risky, everything is, but I believe in it massively and want to give something back to my hometown, as well as to everyone whose followed my journey over the years.
Yes, that's me lol
Here’s the twist: the campaign is called 'The People's Pizzeria' because the Pizzeria doesn’t have a name, logo, colour scheme, anything...yet. I want you to work with me and vote to decide those things and so much more! I also want to give a portion of any profits away to a charity every year, and again you can help me pick that. Who knows, if this works maybe it could inspire other creators to give back too in a similar way.
I’ve created some hopefully awesome rewards: behind-the-scenes video diaries, signed cookbooks, digital cooking classes, right up to having your name on the wall, or your own pizza on the menu! There really should be something for everyone so please do check them all out, some even feature some very special guests...
Here's answers to some of the most popular questions i've been initially asked
Will you still be doing videos? Yep, don’t worry, the channel isn’t going anywhere! In fact, I could potentially be doing even more! I’d love to film extra videos in the pizzeria from time to time, do podcasts there, special events and of course I will be hosting cooking classes both in person and for the internet & selling kitchen gadgets there & online....I’ve some pretty big plans for extra content, watch this space.
What do you need to raise? I need to raise an absolute minimum of £20k to help pay for a pizza oven and some basic other essential costs. Any extra funds raised can help with refrigeration, a dough machine, fitting out costs, staff, rent & ingredients, the list is endless, but this will get me started. IF I do pass the target, I have stretch goals.
Why crowdfund? I love the concept of having a collaborative project with a community. I’ve seen & backed my friends like DanNerdCubed, Stuart Ashen and Paul Rose do it and it’s very inspiring. I love that it’ll help build a great community around the project straight from the beginning to help shape what it is and can be, something that’s not just mine but ours.
If you don’t raise enough funds will it happen? Probably not. I have to minimise risks to make it achievable, so if you think it’s a cool idea and want to help make my dreams come true, please support it!
Can I get a reward as a gift for someone? Yep, a lot of the perks have no time limit so you can get them as a voucher for a birthday, Christmas, that anniversary you forgot about (it's tomorrow, I've got your back) or just a general gift.
I live overseas, what’s in it for me? I've tried to make loads of the rewards available to everyone, things that will be posted or emailed. And you know you may even come to England one day & have a day out by the sea with your pizza voucher, visit the place that you helped create and see your name on the wall! How cool would that be?
The pizzeria will also mean more, fresh content for you to enjoy wherever you are in the world. And let's not rule out one day making more locations in other countries too - dream big right?!
What about the cooking school part? This will be so cool. The pizzeria will also host and produce cooking classes. You can come in and attend courses in person and we will also over time start to create modules for download, co-hosted by myself and an expert in the field, alongside e-books and recipe cards. This really is just the tip of the iceberg (lettuce) of the plans.
If you can’t support the campaign, I understand, but you can also help in other ways - It might be that you are, or know someone that makes signs or drinking glasses & can help out. But honestly the thing that would mean the most to me is if you shared this campaign with as many friends as you can that may discover and want to be part of the story. Hopefully you can see that this isn’t just a restaurant, it’s potentially something really special.
Look, I know this is completely bonkers, going from learning to poach an egg to possibly creating my own pizzeria and cooking school. But I truly believe in this and, just like in Wayne's’ World, maybe just maybe, “if you make it, they will come”.
Thanks so much for your support, please check out the perks and until next time… thanks for watching.
Barry xx
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My biggest risk is going for it. I've wanted to do this for so long... in fact i've waited 18 Months for the perfect spot to come free! But let's not be over confident. I'm aware that running a restaurant is hard work and difficult, but I have been planning this for over 18 Months and am going to surround myself with the right people that are just as passionate as I am.
Perks wise I aim to fulfil them ahead of time if possible but depending upon demand i'll keep you updated, this is the unknown, but something i'm prepared for.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
