campaign.story:
Ember Madison is the last of the fire goddesses incarnate, but she has no idea! 
One day, that fire deep inside came swirling to the surface and her world was changed forever. Now, one in the shadows watches her every move, while another hunts and preys on those like her slowly making his way to her.
She is... The Last Ember!
As requested, here are several items you can add onto your pledge! Just add the dollar amount for the item you want and message me which item(s) you've added for!
Let me know if you have any questions and I'll try to update the FAQ to accommodate.
Now that we've reached our initial funding goal, it's time to reveal some additional stretch goals to add even more value to your pledge!
ALL EIGHT Stretch Goals have now been Unlocked and Revealed!
5 Mobile Wallpapers will go to ALL backers for reaching 150 Backers on this campaign!
And we've unlocked a SKETCH VARIANT of Cover C as an optional upgrade or add on!
You can switch out your Cover C variant for the sketch variant, or you can ADD the sketch variant for the cost of Cover C on the add-on menu ($20 extra)!
This is a definitive, special edition of The Last Ember #0-1 that properly introduces anyone unfamiliar with the series to Ember and her story. We decided to put together this book to showcase the beginnings and journey of Ember so far. What you'll get with this book is:
A 60-Page, remastered version of The Last Ember #0 and #1!
Loads of extra content like sketch gallery, cover gallery, prose and more!
The definitive version of Ember's origin!
The funds we raise through this Kickstarter will be used to print this book. 
THE BOOK IS COMPLETELY DONE!
In fact, it's already pre-pressed and ready to be sent to the printer as soon as we receive the funds!
You can back with confidence as we have run and fulfilled several Kickstarters in the past, and this one will be no different!
Cover A is by the original artist/cover artist for The Last Ember, Rudi Sucipto, who provided us with several gorgeous images we've used in prints, banners and so on!
Cover B is by Yasmin, an amazing artist I had the pleasure to work with on this special variant cover! You may have seen her cover work on IDW's Marvel Action Captain Marvel or at Oni Press and elsewhere!
Cover C is by the fantastic team of artist Federico Sabbatini (Bigs & Tiny, Aspen) and colorist Andrea Celestini (Bigs & Tiny, Action Lab), whom I've worked with before and am thrilled to have collaborated with on this new variant cover!
My friend Kat has launched Like Father, Like Daughter #1-6 and we decided to team up and bring her character, Casey Ryder, and mine, Ember together in a special print:
LFLD's Casey & The Last Ember!
This print is by Linnea Jalando-on, aka @PapurrCat on Twitter, and you can have it if you back both THIS campaign and Like Father, Like Daughter both at any physical copy level!
Support Like Father, Like Daughter #1-6 on Kickstarter here!
 Here's a closer look at the keychain and some of the stickers:

  Here's the fully colored CUTE Print by Lisa included at $77+
BRANT FOWLER (Writer, Letterer, Logo Design)
Brant Fowler is the writer/creator of THE LAST EMBER, the flagship title of Last Ember Press (LEP) where he serves as Co-Publisher. In 2015, he co-founded LEP with his then girlfriend (now wife), Lisa Moore to work on their own creations after working in the industry in various capacities for over 15 years. Most notabley, he lettered comics for such companies as Image Comics, Action Lab Entertainment, ComixTribe, Moonstone Books and more. He has written and co-written other comics such as WANNABEZ and CELESTIAL FALCON, and short prose stories for Pro Se Productions' SINGULARITY: RISE OF THE POSTHUMANS. Brant also does Kickstarter page design for various other creators. 
GIULIA LALLI (Penciller Chapter 1)
After graduating at the age of 21 from International Comics Academy in Reggio Emilia (Italy), I published 4 comic books for kids with Medkidz co. (2014-2016).
Now I'm working on my personal project "Puck" with an Italian editor, Cronaca di Topolinia (2017).
I also collaborated with Last Ember Press for The Last Ember #1.
LISA MOORE (Inker, Colorist)
Lisa is a professional colorist, mainly doing work for BOOM! Studios' all-ages imprint KaBOOM! She has provided colors for titles such as Garfield, Bravest Warriors, Regular Show, Saved by the Bell, Care Bears and more. Lisa has begun branching out in o writing and inking for Last Ember Press, with The Secrets of Willowmyst successfully funding two issues on Kickstarter to date. She also designs clip-art for teachers and general users. KeepinitKawaii.com

Several others, like chapter 0 artist Rudi Sucipto and variant cover artist Yasmin Flores Montanez, were instrumental in the creation of The Last Ember as well!
We literally could not have done this without you! Our company and The Last Ember really found their footing here on Kickstarter and developed a wonderfully supportive audience, YOU! It's because of you we get to keep doing what we love!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have funded and fulfilled several Kickstarter campaigns to date, so there's no fear of not getting this book! Plus, it's completely done and ready to go to the printer!

If there are any delays or problems, I always communicate constantly with my backers. What I know, you know! You can support this campaign with confidence that you have a direct line with me and I will always answer your questions, comments and concerns.

The Kickstarter audience has been incredibly supportive and understanding, and we would never take that for granted or betray that trust. You are why we can continue to create, produce and deliver great comics!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
The Last Ember: Hunted #1 is coming!
Head on over to the prelaunch page by clicking the image or link below so you will get notified when we launch!

Hey all!
The Last Ember: Hunted was, by far, our most successful campaign to date! 
Thank you to everyone that also supported it! 
If you weren't able to, I'll share the BackerKit store here when it's up so you can pre-order it then if you like!
But this post is about Reforged!

Hey, everyone!
The last batch of packages should be going out this week! So sorry for the delay on those! 
Also, The Last Ember: Hunted ends TONIGHT! At 8pm CST, we'll wrap up our largest campaign to date!
We've unlocked several stretch goals and beat personal records all campaign long!

Hey everyone!
I hope you had a Happy Thanksgiving if you celebrate, all things considered. And I hope you are healthy and well!
Update on Reforged Packages...

Hey everyone!
Many of you should have received an email with tracking info! More packages are going out and should be arriving soon!

Hey all!
While you're waiting on your packages to arrive, and for the next Ember campaign to launch (I think it's going to be the 16th now, by the way!), check out a brand new project that just went live:

CROSSOVER DIVISION #1

Hey everyone!
We have Locked Addresses this morning, and we have our packing station set up! We'll be packing everything up starting this afternoon and we'll start shipping packages tomorrow!

Hey Emberverse!
Okay, orders are locked! If you purchased extra items, we are about to charge cards. And thank you for those extra purchases!
Locking Addresses!

Hey Emberverse!
This morning, I started locking orders. You have 48 hours to update yours, so please do so by Wednesday, October 28th!  
After this date, we will lock your reward selections and charge cards for add-on item purchases, pledge upgrades, and pre-orders.

campaign.story:
Following multiple successful Kickstarters – Kat Calamia and Wayne A. Brown’s Like Father, Like Daughter returns with a heart pounding sixth installment – self publishing for the first time under Calamia’s brand Comic Uno, a reliable source in comics for over a decade. 
Writer - Kat Calamia
Next to her weekly comic book reviews on Comic Uno, Calamia also currently works for Newsarama and DC Comics’ DC Universe with bylines with IGN, Fandom, and TV Guide. She has a Bachelor’s degree in Communications and minor in Journalism through Marymount Manhattan and a MFA in Writing and Producing Television from LIU Brooklyn.
Artist - Wayne A. Brown
Brown has been an artist his whole life, being more passionate about art than anything in the world. He has a degree in Graphic Design, four wonderful children two boys and two girls, a beautiful wife.
Colorist - Lisa Moore
Lisa Moore is a comic book enthusiast, colorist and illustrator, who has worked as a colorist on books like GARFIELD, PEANUTS, BRAVEST WARRIORS, and more for BOOM! Studios, DAMSELS AND GRIMM for Dynamite and more. She's the writer of SECRETS OF WILLOWMYST from Last Ember Press where she's co-Publisher. She also just got married to her best friend - Brant Fowler!
Letterer - Matt Bowers
Matt Bowers is a Memphis, TN based artist that puts out an ongoing comic book simply called MEMPHIS. He also does freelance lettering for several indie comic book titles such as: Like Father, Like Daughter, They Call Her...The Dancer, American Dreams, Crucified, Concrete Jungle, Snatched, and Lawfully Evil 
LFLD #6 Regular Cover
A father with superpowers, leaves his wife and daughter to become “Invulnerable” - the world’s only superhero. Ten years later his daughter discovers that she has inherited the very superpowers that made her father leave their family.
Six issues later - Casey and Invulnerable begin to reconnect, but is it too late? Following Like Father, Like Daughter #5’s big revelation – issue 6 lifts the curtain on Casey’s mother’s double life.
Jessica pays Jim’s mother a visit.
 This issue is all about the VILLAINS – characters just as grounded as the superhero plot!

Following the release of the Like Father, Like Daughter #1’s variant cover by Zack Dolan. We wanted to debut even more variant covers for Like Father, Like Daughter #6 from some amazing artists - exploring all different sides of the Like Father, Like Daughter universe.
 Cover B – “The Future/Celebrating Pride Month” – Wayne A. Brown 
These first two arcs have had a very heavy focus on Casey and her family drama, but I’ve always said the heart of this book is and will always be Stephanie and Casey’s friendship. Stephanie has been a support system for Casey, and now it's Casey’s turn to be that for Stephanie as she explores her own self-identity. 
There are plenty of coming out stories in media, but not many for bisexuals, and this is something I really wanted to explore with Stephanie's arc. I’m excited for everyone to meet Stephanie’s new love interest, Faith! It’s a storyline I’m very proud of that I can’t wait for the world to see.  
Cover C – Black and White – “Family Reunion” – E.V. Cantada
As our second arc continues you will be seeing the darker side of Like Father, Like Daughter. If you thought our first arc had an emotional punch – just you wait. E.V. Cantada the artist for my comic book, They Call Her…The Dancer, beautifully displays this intensity with a Black and White variant. 
 Cover D – "Welcome to the Band" - Sarah Leuver AKA ComickerGirl 
Sure - there’s a lot of drama, but Wes, Stephanie, and Casey’s friendship will bring some levity along the way, as you can see with Comickergirl’s variant, best known for her DC TV fan art. 
Back up both Brant Fowler's The Last Ember #1: Reforged and this Kickstarter at their physical tiers or higher to receive this beautiful print by Linnea Jalando-on, best known as @PapurrCat on Twitter. A special thanks to Brant who helped work on this very Kickstarter page. 
Support Brant's Kickstarter: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/brantfowler/the-last-ember-1-reforged-mythology-magic-and-mystery?fbclid=IwAR3ni_5F_ZqHtm10JsrZV9g7HZSuMN1BVVs2vBGohEXUP0j0NjeI-wf9vrE 
Support both Daniel Kablan's American Dreams and this Kickstarter at any level to get this Wayne Brown print and a print offered by Short Fuse Media featuring American Dreams and Invulnerable drawn by American Dreams' artist Dody Eka. (Digital backers get digital version. Physical backers get print version.) https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/americandreamscomic/american-dreams-issues-1-3-ongoing-comic-series?ref=user_menu
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've attempted to manage all of the risks associated with this project by doing most of the leg work before this campaign's launch so that we could ensure that we continue to deliver immediately after the campaign. As we did with our previous Kickstarters we will consistently update backers and supporters with any issues that may potentially cause delays in the completion of this project and make the necessary adjustments to resolve those matters quickly and efficiently. We understand the importance of fulfilling our promises and always ensure that all of our supporters receive their rewards. And we always find ways to sneak extra swag into our reward packages as a thank you for the patience in supporting our projects on the front end and patiently waiting for them to be completed and delivered....so we can focus on the fun part.....making comics!!! It's because of your continued support that we are able to make these AWESOME comics! And for that we truly appreciate ALL of our backers and keep a wide open form of communication for you all to reach us at any time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
Questions about this project? Check out the FAQ
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Mythic Creature Trainer #1 is an action-packed, full-colour 48-page fantasy adventure comic about training dragons and dealing with troubles at home and at work!
 Fully Funded! Thank you so much!
 ...and some sweet stretch goals unlocked! (See below)
The king’s dragon trainer is fired for accidentally unleashing a mutating corruption on the royal stables. Now, he must save his job and his reputation by finding a long-lost cure before the advancing orc horde takes advantage of this new weakness in the kingdom’s defenses.
The main character in Mythic Creature Trainer is Ulrick.
He loves his pet griffin and takes him everywhere. Ulrick is always trying to get his housemate, Felka to help him out of a tight spot. She's a palace sentinel: an elite force of king's guards. Felka doesn't really care if Ulrick succeeds or fails, but she'll pitch in when it suits her.
Ulrick's boss is not all that he seems. Kevin the goblin has his own plans, and he's willing to throw Ulrick under the bus to get there.
When orcs and goblins get together, that means trouble.
 Ulrick will discover the hard way that approval from others isn’t the most important thing in life. There are characters in the story that will stand at different points on this spectrum: some crave approval and status, while others shun it and do what they feel like, without regard for others. 
Will Ulrick save the city and his reputation? More importantly, will he stay a total flake or become a towering pillar of integrity?
Bumper-sized 48-page issue!
This isn't my first Kickstarter! 
I've funded and fulfilled to satisfaction 2 other campaigns in the last 2 years. Here's some feedback from happy backers:
Some of my happy kickstarter backers!
Hi! I'm René, Australian cartoonist. I created, wrote and drew Mythic Creature Trainer.
I've worked in the animation industry for over 20 years: in character design, animating for Disney on 10 different films, making flash animation for software and pilots for TV series. I was a storyboard artist on Classic Tales and Bob’s Burgers.
In 2018 I funded my first graphic novel on Kickstarter, Sneaky Goblins: an all-ages story of fantasy mayhem, inspired by Adventure Time cartoons, Tolkien and World of Warcraft. I followed that up with a new comic: Sneaky Goblins at College, which successfully funded in 2019.
Some of the films, TV and comics I've worked on:
I've always loved drawing and telling stories. Making this book was a labor of love, and I hope that comes through as you read it.
 Included in every copy of Mythic Creature Trainer #1: Sophie the Spy is a 9-page short story, written by me and drawn by the talented Jake Kalsbeek, animator and cartoonist hailing from San Francisco! 
Jake K, artist on Sophie the Spy
Jake worked as a 3D animator for games, DVD, commercials and TV, and has begun posting pages for nis new webcomic, Super Rocket Space Punch! Jake has strong memories of his first time experiencing E.T. in the movie theater as a five year old, reading Calvin and Hobbes in elementary, and finding Miyazaki’s Nausicaa manga in college.
Set before the events of Mythic Creature Trainer, this short story introduces us to the world of creature trainers, and shows us the link between the Sneaky Goblins storyline and Mythic Creature Trainer.
Sophie in spy mode: ingratiating herself with the savage orc tribe!
 
   It's been so awesome to have Jake involved in the comic. Having another comic artist make his version of my characters is such a blast- it almost feels like my comics are gaining a life of their own!
 If you've been following the adventures of Sneaky Goblins, you might find this chart useful:
You get every single story pictured above when you back at the Catch-up Bundle!  (AU$90) pledge level and higher.
My 2018 Kickstarter: the Sneaky Goblins graphic novel!

Mythic Creature Trainer #1 comes in the regular BLUE SKY edition plus two limited-edition variant covers: CORRUPTION and SOPHIE THE SPY. Check below for full details about all reward levels.
You can grab yourself a limited SOPHIE THE SPY cover with the 'All the Editions!' pledge level.
Over the last year, I've been making and posting the pages of this comic on my weekly webcomic: www.mythiccreaturetrainer.com. Now the first chapter is complete, and it's time to print the book! With your help, I'd love to make this book a reality, and get it into the hands of readers like you. 
· A massive 48 pages, including cover
· full colour
· Perfect bound
· Cover: 105lbs (It'll feel sturdier than your average floppy comic book)
· Interior paper: 70lbs
· Size: 6.625 x 10.25in. 
It will be beautiful!
The comic pages are 100% complete and ready for print! Your pledge will make this book a living, physical reality: a crisp, sweet-smelling printed comic book. 
And we're so close. Once this campaign funds, all l have to do is make the Thank You page and then send the files off to the printer.
Here's my process for making a comic page: from rough sketch, to inks, to final colours:
The amount raised will all go to funding a print run of 1000 copies of the comic. Copies of the comic left over after the campaign will be stock that I can sell at comic conventions, libraries and book shops.
I've come to Kickstarter to help get this book into as many hands as possible, and I'd love your support to bring it to life.
Let's have a peek inside!

Want more? GET A FREE PDF SAMPLE OF THE COMIC HERE!
Here's what you get in each pledge level... with pictures!

 Here's some more of those signed sketches included in the AU$55 level and above:
They look great framed in regular 6x8" window frames from Target:
 I made a process video making one of the sketch rewards:
 Check out more of the sketches available on this Pinterest board.
You can tell me which character you'd prefer in the comments, or through the Kickstarter survey at the end of the campaign, once the pledges have gone through. I can't guarantee you'll get the drawing you want, but I can get you your favourite character!
 Stretch goals UNLOCKED!
What will the funds be used for?
I'm only on Kickstarter to print the book and get them out to all of my wonderful backers! I'm not trying to make money or reimburse myself for any of the time I spent making the comic itself.
The whole amount raised will go back into the book, the rewards, and  shipping it out safely to you:
You should have your books by the end of November 2020.
I plan on sending the final book files to to the printer as soon as the funds come through from Kickstarter (about 2 weeks after the campaign ends).
Printing will take a month or two- at the most. 
Postage is a bit more unpredictable, especially given the current state of the COVID-19 epidemic. But I've built in a buffer just in case there is a delay at any stage.
I'll be packing and shipping the books from Melbourne, Australia, and from Pennsylvania, USA.
 Want to help the campaign?
I'd love a share on the socials! Tweet or Facebook post the project link:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/pfitzy/mythic-creature-trainer-issue-1
Or share my pinned posts: 
Share this post! Even better, tag a friend!
Retweet! Tag a mate!
Much obliged!
Thanks so much for checking out my campaign. I'm really excited about making this book and I'd love for you to be involved. Choose a pledge and lock in your copy now!
Cheers, René
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After successfully running and fulfilling two comic book kickstarters: in 2018 and 2019, I have a good understanding of the demands and potential pitfalls involved in this kind of project.
The comic is totally finished - it's ready to go to press!
The biggest risk is an unforeseen delay in shipping out to international backers from Melbourne, Australia, especially as how we're in the middle of an epidemic. So I've built in a buffer in the delivery schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I just wanted to quickly update you on developments for the next Kickstarter.
I originally planned to launch in early November 2020. You might have noticed we're past that now!

 Even though I'm ready to take Mythic Creature Trainer #2 to print, I decided to change my plans for 2 reasons:
It's been a big week, but all the comics are packed up and in the post!

updates.update_userinfo: Limited Patreon offer: one week only
updates.update_content: The books are here, and they're looking great!

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Rewards are out and proofs are in!
updates.update_content:
I sent out all digital rewards earlier this week, so check your Kickstarter messages. 
(Some of you may have 2 messages from me, I sent the wrong link in the first one: thanks to everyone who alerted me to this!)
And perhaps just as exciting: I got the proofs from the printer yesterday!
This Kickstarter is done! Finished! Kaput! Outa here!

And we're down to the last 12 hours!
You guys have been awesome!
I love how you've shared the project, interacted on the comments, sent me sketch requests-- you're the best!
Allright! With just one day to go, we've just busted through our first stretch goal!
Guys! We're almost down to 2 days left!

campaign.story:
Sheet pan cooking is the easiest and most efficient way of making a delicious homemade meal.
There are lots of ways to cook on a sheet pan, but they are often wasteful or messy and not everything takes the same amount of time to cook.
We knew there had to be a better way...
Introducing Cheat Sheets, a completely new approach to sheet pan cooking.  Oven-safe, non-stick silicone dividers that will streamline your cooking and divide your ingredients, to make one-pan meals and meal prepping a breeze.
Everyone loves sheet pan cooking, but it’s not always as simple as putting everything in the oven together and coming back to find it has all cooked evenly. Reality is, not everything takes the same amount of time to cook. With Cheat Sheets, you can easily remove ingredients when they're ready and never overcook them again.
We get it... If you're new to oven cooking, it can feel like a bit of a science experiment that involves a lot of guesswork. That's why we've tested the most popular everyday ingredients and created an easy timing guide so that you’ll get perfect results every time.
Cheat Sheets are made for meal prep. With our modular dividers, you can cook all of your ingredients with even better organization and control. 
You can fit up to 6x small portions or 3x large portions on a single sheet pan and with multiple sets, you'll have everything you need to prep for the family or a week's worth of meals.
With Cheat Sheets you can easily separate ingredients and flavors without having them mingle. Whether you want to use different marinades, cook savory and sweet dishes at the same time, or simply don’t want your food to touch, Cheat Sheets has you covered.
Separation also comes in handy for families with different preferences, allowing you to create different portions for those with special dietary requirements or specific tastes - because not everybody likes pineapple on their pizza.
Aluminum foil and parchment paper are hugely wasteful and non-recyclable. Sheet pans are also notoriously difficult to clean, collecting stains and grime with every meal.
With Cheat Sheets you'll never have to scrub another sheet pan again and you'll save tonnes of wasted paper and foil. Cheat Sheets are naturally non-stick so clean-up is a breeze. They're also dishwasher safe!

The Cheat Sheets dividers are made with a premium, food-grade silicone material resistant to temperatures up to 450 degrees F. The dividers will fit on a standard half sheet pan or perfectly on the Prepd Sheet Pan included with each set.
The Prepd Sheet Pan is made from Aluminized Steel and coated with a non-stick PTFE and PFOA free coating.

Around 18 months ago we had an insight...
Out of all the Prepd Pack owners (now over 100,000 people), those who consistently meal prep all use sheet pans. But sheet pans have never changed since their inception. They are hard to clean, require you to constantly waste parchment paper and aluminum foil and are not designed to best serve how we actually cook, ie, multiple items in the oven at once.
We knew there had to be a better way. A solution that is easier to clean and gives ultimate versatility to the sheet pan. Allowing you to easily time each ingredient of the meal. A zero-waste solution removing the need to constantly create non-recyclable waste.
We were immediately drawn to silicone as it is completely food safe to high temperatures, naturally non-stick, long-lasting and resistant to bacteria. In our first phase of development, we tried dozens of different types of silicone and different colors to ensure our solution would be stain-resistant and have perfect heat transfer. Then we started our testing and prototyping phase. 
This is where we started cooking meals in the Cheat Sheets to ensure every dimension was perfect and more importantly, food cooked just as well as on a 'naked' sheet-pan.
We then opened our first tooling, received FDA approval and did a wider beta test. The feedback was phenomenal all round.After hitting our Kickstarter funding goal we have kicked off all of our final tooling so that production can begin shortly after the campaign end.
"Cooking just might be the single most important thing you can do for your dietary health . . . "Cooking just might be the single most important thing you can do for your dietary health . . . Cooking for yourself is the only sure way to take back control of your diet from the food scientists and food processors” Michael Pollan - Food Rules.
At Prepd we strongly believe that cooking for yourself or your family is the best and easiest way to stay healthy, especially during these challenging times. It doesn’t have to always be health food, so long as you cooked it and know the ingredients, that's enough.
Since we started Prepd in 2015 it has been our sole focus to help make preparing meals at home easier and more enjoyable. By creating tools and systems to help make healthy living easier, we hope to make healthy resolutions - lifelong habits.
Prepd was founded by two industrial designers, Chris Place & Will Matters. Together, we have designed and manufactured dozens of products and delivered product to customers all over the world. Our first product together was the Prepd Pack a reinvention of the lunchbox that was launched and successfully delivered to over 12,500 backers on Kickstarter in 2016.
Since launch, we've grown to a community of more than 100,000 avid meal preppers and talented cooks.
We can't wait to go on this next Prepd journey with you!
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
This project is promoted by Green Inbox.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

Over the last 4 years we have delivered over 100,000 products to customers all over the world. Over the journey, we have continued to improve how we work and the products we make.

We are now a globally remote team in Asia, Oceania, Europe, and America. We work around the clock and have honed the art of working separately, but together. 

Production

We have already completed an extensive pilot run, done in-kitchen tests and completed the silicone tooling. As soon as we are funded we will kick off tooling for the metal tray. The design has already been refined and approved by our engineers and is ready to go. 

We have mapped out the critical path and have made all necessary precautions to ensure we can scale production if we significantly surpass our goals.

We are very confident in our timeline, but it's our core belief to never settle for a mediocre product, so we won't be compromising on quality in order to save time. Should any issues arise we promise to keep you updated every step of the way and deliver you the best quality product as soon as possible.

Supply Chain

We have built a very capable team that works hard to ensure smooth delivery of all our products. However, processing delays and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem.

Covid-19

The health and safety of our team and partners is always our top priority. We follow all government-mandated guidelines and always err on the side of caution when it comes to the physical and mental health of our team and partners.

Our manufacturing partner for this product is operating at 100% so we are incredibly confident in our manufacturing timeline.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Cheat sheets are durable and designed to last for decades of daily use.
Reusability and recyclability
Naked sheet pans require aluminum foil or parchment paper, both are non-recyclable once used. In contrast Cheat sheets are zero waste.
Sustainable materials
Unlike plastics that are made from oil, silicone comes from silica which is derived from sand, the second most abundant material on earth. We have paid particular attention to ensure that we have used as little silicone material as possible to eliminate unnecessary waste.
Environmentally friendly factories
All of our factories follow strict environmental and social guidelines and are regularly inspected.

campaign.story:
Standard cover by Afro Samurai's Takashi Okazaki. Trade dress not final.
DEADSKINS! 1 & 2 is a 64-page, perfect bound comic book collecting the first two issues of the series critics call:
DEADSKINS! was the first graphic novel we ever created, and it was serialized on our website from 2013-2014. The full story clocks in at 5 issues, roughly 30 pages each. 
We're remastering this book 2 issues at a time, darkening the lines to improve print quality and bring out the beauty of our black, white, and red production. 
Here's the pitch:
"A Harvard-educated dandy and his blind, drunk companion are all that stand between the Old West and an Undead Apocalypse. This is the true story of Custer's Last Stand... whatever they taught you in school is bullsh!t." 
In addition to the 64-page, perfect bound book, backers get: 
Credit inside the book
Exclusive digital bonuses
FREE U.S. SHIPPING!
 WANT TO TRY BEFORE YOU BUY?
No problem! Here's a 9-page preview:
We're keeping our rewards pretty simple this go 'round. But in addition to our main cover by Afro Samurai's Takashi Okazaki, we have... 
THE BEN TEMPLESMITH VARIANT 
And if you missed any of our other campaigns for RED XMAS or PBOW, you can catch up with our ...
Box of Fries 
More details below...
NOTE ABOUT THE TIME PERIOD
DEADSKINS! takes place in the Wild West, and as such, some characters--particularly the villains--express attitudes that seem outdated today. We think our readers are smart enough to know that we aren't condoning these things, but we also know that in 2020, some people don't want to read about it. So: fair warning. 
There's also donkey-f*cking.
FRIED Comics is a proud purveyor of offbeat, irreverent pulp fiction since 2013, and a labor of love for Clay Adams and Alexandre O. Philippe.
So far, we have seven successful Kickstarters under our belts. (And between us we have a lot of belts. ) So, we're stoked to return to the scene of the crime.
Clay is a writer and filmmaker who's funded seven projects on Kickstarter with FRIED Comics. His feature script, THE ECLIPSE, placed second in the horror category of the FADEIn Awards, and his latest comic, ELECTRIC YOUTH, co-written with Kyle Roberts, was recently featured in the LA Times. He has written and directed for television and holds a BFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU. When Clay first met Alexandre, he thought, "My, what a sophisticated European." Boy, was he wrong!
Film nerd/director Alexandre's most recent documentary is LEAP OF FAITH: WILLIAM FRIEDKIN ON THE EXORCIST. He holds a Masters Degree in Dramatic Writing from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts and has written and directed numerous award-winning films and documentaries, including MEMORY: THE ORIGINS OF ALIEN, 78/52: HITCHCOCK'S SHOWER SCENE, AND THE PEOPLE vs. GEORGE LUCAS. When Alexandre first met Clay, he thought, "My, what a stupid American." Boy, was he right!
Leila is a comic book artist and writer living in Portland, Oregon. She draws SLEEPLESS, SHUTTER and writes AFAR at Image Comics. Leila has drawn for titles such as THE WICKED + THE DIVINE, SCARLET WITCH, AMERICAN VAMPIRE, and THE PANTHEON PROJECT. In 2015 and 2016, Leila was nominated for the Russ Manning Promising Newcomer Award for her work on SHUTTER. She only took this job because she thought she'd be paid in fries.
Brett Nienburg is a Denver-based artist who has worked as a concept artist for LEGO and  designed sets for feature films. We're sorry we made him peel so many potatoes. He looks pretty sad about it.
Charles is from Canada, so we imagine he looks like one of those flappy-headed dudes from South Park.* He has lettered books for Aftershock, Image, IDW and Top Shelf (among others) and is a founding member of Frozen Beach Studios. (*As far as we know, Charles has a normal-looking head.) 
Ugh. Just... ugh.
The Package
We've gotten our fair share of comics that arrived mangled by the mail carrier.
You pay premium prices on Kickstarter, and you deserve better. That's why we've started using Gemini Comic Mailers:
These babies are sturdy. They require a little more money, a little more time (and a lot more tape!) but it's worth it to make sure your comics arrive in pristine condition.
And if somehow your comic still gets roughed up?
Frieda will replace it free of charge.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
PLAY

We are coming to Kickstarter to put the first two issues into print. The book is 100% complete, our printer is still operating as an essential business, and we are ready to deliver quickly. We just need YOU to make it a reality.
All funds from this campaign will go to:
Printing rewards
Shipping them to you
Anything above our goal goes towards making more comics
Image copyright Can Stock Photo / pressmaster
THE TIMELINE
The Kickstarter Campaign: 23 days (Apr 29-May 22)
Kickstarter Funds Released: ~June 15
Digital Rewards Released: ~June 15
Book Goes to Printer: ~June 15
Book Printed and shipped to us ~June 30
Pack and ship - ~July 1
Expected delivery to US backers - 2 Weeks (Early July)
Expected delivery for International Backers - 4 Weeks (late July)
 THANKS, HON!
We're not asking for a million dollars.
We just want to put a cool book in your hand and entertain you for a bit during these crazy times.
So find a pledge level you like and pre-order. We'll make more comics.
Oh! And finally:
We heard somewhere that Kickstarter campaigns do better when they have pictures of cats on the page. So, here's a picture of Clay's cat:
"Don't just stand there... refill it."
Thanks for supporting! And remember...

updates.update_content: Howdy, pardner! It's been a long time coming, but the next volume of DEADSKINS! arrives on Kickstarter one week from today...

Howdy, pardner. 
We're dotting our Qs and crossing our Ps, getting ready to launch the next volume of DEADSKINS!
The page is about 75% finished, and we already have a handy-dandy "Notify Me" link:

updates.update_userinfo: DEADSKINS! 3-4 main cover reveal + NIGHTMARE THEATER is (a)live!
updates.update_content:
Howdy, cowpoke. 
We are pleased as punched to reveal that the main cover to our next volume has been drawn by none other than Joe Mulvey (with Alex Cormack providing the colors):

Howdy cowpoke! 
Ready for the next volume of our little bit of nonsense?
To be honest, I'd hoped to be launching by now, but a couple of things happened that slowed us down, one bad, one good.
Bad news first:

Howdy, cowpoke!
True facts: yesterday I shipped out the last of the packages, and now I can see the floor of my spare bedroom again.
In case you haven't heard, the USPS is experiencing some severe delays these days, so please be patient if you haven't received your rewards yet. Especially if you're overseas, please give it another week to ten days, and if your package hasn't arrived by then, drop me a line and I'll track it for you.

Howdy!
Quick note to let you know that books did indeed arrive this Monday, and after a couple days worth of unpacking and sorting, the first batch of rewards went out on Wednesday. We have been steadily pumping out packages ever since. 
Please bear with us, as the FRIED sweatshop is rather small and well, there are a lot of you! But keep your eyes glued to your mailboxes--the books are on the way.

Howdy, pard. 
It's getting to be late July. So where are the gall-dang books?
Here's the story: as reported in my previous update, I approved the proof back on July 1st. The printer said we'd have 'em about a week later. 
Unfortunately, a staffing shortage caused them to fall behind. I didn't want to write until I had something firm to report, and here's the good news:
The printer shipped out our order yesterday, and they are scheduled to arrive on Monday.

Howdy, pard. 
Quick update to let you know that the proof arrived today and it looks FANTASTIC. 
Seriously, I'm even happier with how this remaster came out than I anticipated. 
The terrible camera on my phone doesn't do it justice, but together, we made an awesome book:

campaign.story:
The Unspeakable Text is a horror/suspense comic anthology. Each story in the series follows an "unspeakable" event that's been intentionally hidden from the world by supernatural forces. UT is an extremely unique anthology because every single story is written by the same person, (me) Ryan Haack! 
With this volume, we're bringing you seven short comic stories (black and white), the first act of a graphic novel (in color) and five short prose stories! It's my goal to create a cohesive, truly unique experience with UT2 and I can't be more excited to be able to bring it to you through Kickstarter! 
The goal of this Kickstarter is to fund the printing and shipping of the SECOND volume. If you look at the rewards, you get a deluxe reprint of the FIRST volume of UT with extra content along with the second. Don't worry, we got ya covered! :)
So what are these stories really about?
 In the past, Unspeakable Text focused on stories in many different places all over the world. It was fun to explore new and exciting locations but there seemed to be a lack of any real focus and the stories really didn't affect each other like I hoped they would. With this new effort, our goal is to create a more cohesive and integrated narrative thread by bringing you unique stories all based in North America. 
The Macbeth (Page 1) by Andrew Anthony
Page One of The Lost Episode, art by Magin Marques
In Unspeakable 2, you will meet the most infamous scribe of the Unspeakable Text: Ichabod Crane, and his newfound purpose after that night at Sleepy Hollow. You will read tales involving Erinyes of fate, math problems that manifest, mutated beasts and so much more. And yes, you will be taken to cities like New York and Chicago, to the unforgiving Death Valley desert,  and to secret societies hidden deep underground. Each of the fourteen stories are based in a different location and depict unique characters and obstacles. 
Whatever Happened to Ichabod Crane (Page 2) by Giovanni Oliveira
Ben Tomb (Page 1) by Jarrod Bezzina
Math Storm (Page 1), by Bobby Sassone
Mr. Frost (Page 10) by Carlos Rodriguez
Ghost Train Running (Page 1) by Todd Kale
I'm truly blessed to be able to work with some of the best artists I've ever known in this volume. Putting this line-up together has been such a joy and I hope you can see it from the samples I've provided.  This campaign features eight short comic stories all written by me (Ryan) and drawn by incredibly talented artists:
Carlos Rodriguez - @carlosrdzart
Todd Kale - @toddkale
Andrew Anthony - @axemanandrew
Robert Sassone - @coolbonesman
Boogie Bot - @boogiebotcomics
Giovanni Auditore 
Jarrod Bezzina - @jarrod_shujin_bezzina
 @pinelo_art
Eric Kent - @ericlkent
 Yes, you heard it correctly. We're bringing five short prose stories in the mix this time around, all written by Ryan. 
In these stories, you will encounter small-town legends, twists on famous Bible stories, and ancient fish that live deep down in the sea, possessing secret knowledge. There's so much more I could tell you about these stories, and I guarantee you I wouldn't put them in this anthology if I didn't think they fit. Listen to one of the stories included in the anthology, "Dogface Bridge", with this video link:
DOGFACE BRIDGE: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LUTt8OI1-Fc&t=206s
The Akashic Records (cover) by Magin Marques
And finally, we are doing something completely unique with Unspeakable Text Vol. 2 that we've never done before. Magin Marques (@magin_marques) and I have been working on a graphic novel based in the Unspeakable Text universe called THE AKASHIC RECORDS. The first act (about twenty pages) of the story will be inside THIS VOLUME and its subsequent chapters will continue in future volumes of UT!
The Akashic Records (Page 1) by Magin Marques
The Akashic Records (Page 2) by Magin Marques
The Akashic Records (Page 4) by Magin Marques
This is my third crowdfunding campaign. I'm confident I will deliver the absolute best product I can. But in order to do it, we need to have the proper funding AND have contingency plans for when something goes wrong (and these things do happen). Here's a look at the breakdown:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my third crowdfunding campaign. I have gone above and beyond to fulfill my previous campaigns so my customers (and readers) are extremely happy. I am confident I can do the same with this one, especially considering it is already 75% done!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey backers, 
You're probably wondering why I canceled the campaign. 
There are several reasons for this.

Our book will be much shorter than originally purposed without these pages. It would not be fair to give you a book that wasn't representative of what I promised.

campaign.story:
HAUNTING #1
HAUNTING is an ongoing comic series written and created by Phil Falco, with art by Anna Wieszczyk, colors by Andres Samboni, and letters by LetterSquids.
Concept art for our leads, Bram and Faith
We follow Bram, a cantankerous and irrespeonsible teen with a pesky habit of RAISING THE DEAD! Wherever he goes, ghosts appear - restless spirits that attack the living viciously and without prejudice. Bram has spent his entire life turning a blind eye to the destruction he's left in his wake and to the deaths he's indirectly caused. But when he and innocent bystander, Faith, are cornered by a vengeful man from his past, Bram will be forced to learn that his actions have consequences...whether he takes responsibility for those consequences is another question entirely.
A picture is worth a thousand words, so we'll let this six-page preview speak for itself!
Page 1
Page 2

Page 3
Page 4
Page 5
Page 6
All that and more awaits you in HAUNTING #1. So jump on board for tons of ghosts...
...plenty of action... 
...and a lot of heart! 
And know that this is only the beginning! Issue #2 is currently in production, so it won't be long before you'll get to see the next chapter of Bram and Faith's adventure! 
Now let's talk about what we're all really interested in: the Rewards.
We're super proud of our "Faith" Variant Cover, so we hope you consider backing a reward which includes it!
The art for our "Faith" Variant Cover
Now let's talk Stretch Goals!
Note for all Stretch Goal Rewards: Digital tier backers will receive Digital copies of any Stretch Goal Rewards. Physical tier backers will receive Physical copies.
Special thanks to Brant Fowler for his designing of our Kickstarter graphics, and to Geek Out Virtual Con and Mainframe Comic Con for aiding in the promotion of this project.
Two proof copies we've received from our printer, Mixam
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risk is minimal. The cover and interiors for the issue are complete, so we expect digital rewards will be sent days (or possibly hours!) after the funding period ends.

We have received a quote for and two proof copies (pictured above) of HAUNTING #1 from Mixam. We expect that printing will be completed and items will be shipped within a month of the funding period end date. We have confirmed with a Mixam representative that there are currently no delays due to COVID-19 nor any plans for normal operations to be suspended. In the event of any delays or issues that may arise due to COVID-19 or other factors, we have a back-up printing quote from PrintLore.
To mitigate risk as much as humanly possible, we will wear gloves and masks while handling all rewards and shipping materials. The health and safety of our backers is of the utmost concern to us. Even though the risk of spreading of COVID-19 via mail is very low, we intend to be overly cautious in all matters involving the transfer of goods.

We are committed to consistently and frequently updating backers each step of the way and intend to deliver as quickly as humanly possible!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi all!
We're in the midst of shipping Physical Rewards to backers and expect to have everything sent out by this Saturday. With any luck, most of our U.S. backers should have received their rewards already or will receive them by the end of next week (6/12). If you don't, feel free to message me.

updates.update_content:
HAUNTING #1 is officially available for you to read!
Digital Rewards were sent out last night to the emails specified in your Reward Surveys. If anyone didn't receive their rewards or is having trouble accessing them, feel free to shoot me a message. There are also a few backers who (as of this writing) haven't yet submitted their reward surveys. Once those are in, I'll send your rewards as well.
Next up will be Physical Rewards. The book has gone to print, so we expect to start shipping rewards in the next 2-3 weeks. I'll put out another update once we've started that process. Until then, back to work on issue #2 for us!

Hi everyone.
I'm very pleased to announce our campaign has come to its end at 287% funded with 182 backers!
Reward Surveys have just gone out. If anything is unclear or if anyone has any questions, feel free to send me a message. HAUNTING #1 goes to print this coming Wednesday (5/6). So if you have a particular way you'd like your name to appear (or not appear) on the "Thank You!" page, please make sure to you submit your survey before end-of-day Tuesday (5/5).

We're now entering our final weekend. We couldn't have made it this far without you and we look forward to getting our book into everybody's hands very soon!
To kick off the weekend, I thought it would be fun to share a few more preview images from HAUNTING #1. Check them out below!

campaign.story:
*** FULLY FUNDED DAY 1!  FINAL DAY! 8 STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED! ONLY 29 BACKERS AWAY FROM THE NEXT STRETCH GOAL! ***
After burying her only daughter, the deadliest bounty hunter in the galaxy discovers her next job will jeopardize the only thing She has left... her secrets.  


SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known is a brutal, action-packed sci-fi graphic novella from award-winning writer Ryan K Lindsay (Eternal, Chum) and illustrator Chris Panda.
Who Will Love SHE?
Fans of action packed, heart-infused, high-concept sci-fi like EAST OF WEST, BLACK SCIENCE and SAGA.
Collectors of glorious, original, and sexy-as-hell hardcover graphic novels.
Process junkies who will love taking a deep dive into the creative process with Lindsay & Panda's delicious back-matter.
What Exactly Do You Get When You Travel to the Tower of All That is Known in This Campaign?
 SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known is a 64-page OVER-SIZED FORMAT hardcover graphic novella, featuring a special DIE-CUT translucent helmet cover, sure to be unlike anything you've seen in the galaxy.
All backers $7+ will receive loads of bonus content, including an original SHE theme by George O'Connor, digital deluxe process pieces taking you deep into the SHE universe.
Higher pledge levels will have access to campaign exclusive collectibles and merchandise, included enamel pins, custom toys and much more!
And for serious fans of the standard single-issue comic format, we'll be making a special limited edition variant of SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known available. This will be a 48-page, staple-bound comic with a metallic foil cover by Chris Panda, with a special homage to the classic THE UNCANNY X-MEN #141 "Days of Future Past" cover by John Byrne.
This special foil edition variant is included in the Collector's Box and will be limited to 100 copies! 
Back With Confidence, As Ryan K Lindsay & ComixTribe Have a Perfect Track Record for Delivering on Kickstarter!
 Here's what fans of Ryan's work have been saying:
 In these uncertain times, there is one thing that you CAN count on... it's that Ryan, Chris & the team at ComixTribe will deliver one helluva a comic into your hands!  
AND HERE'S THE EARLY COMIC INDUSTRY BUZZ ON SHE...
Ryan K Lindsay writes comics.
He has partnered with artist Eric Zawadzki to produce: ETERNAL through Black Mask Studios, and HEADSPACE, with Sebastian Piriz, through Monkeybrain Comics/IDW.
He has partnered with artist Sami Kivela to produce: BEAUTIFUL CANVAS through Black Mask Studios, DEER EDITOR through his own ‘Four Colour Ray Gun’ imprint and a handful of Kickstarter successes,  and CHUM through ComixTribe.
He was selected as a participant in the DC Writing Workshop group of 2016.
His other comics include: Aurealis and Ledger Award winning NEGATIVE SPACE with Owen Gieni through Dark Horse Comics,  GLOVES with Tommy Lee Edwards in the Vertigo CMYK anthology, as well as EIR with Alfie Gallagher, INK ISLAND with Craig Bruyn, and STAIN THE SEAS SCARLET with Alex Cormack through Kickstarter for ‘Four Colour Ray Gun.’
He’s written/edited analytical texts, including THE DEVIL IS IN THE DETAILS: EXAMINING MATT MURDOCK AND DAREDEVIL through Sequart, and has had essays published in Criminal, Godzilla, Sheltered, Strange Nation, and Crime Factory.
He is Australian and when not being a family man he hones his writing skills by sacrificing blood wombats to the outback spider fight clubs.
Chris Panda is a French illustrator and comic artist living in Berlin.
He's been working as an illustrator since 6 years and decided to move to the comic book world 4 years ago.
He mainly have worked as an interior and cover artist with american publisher IDW on title like MICRONAUTS, ROM, STAR TREK vs. TRANSFORMERS and TRANSFORMERS/GHOSTBUSTERS. And also had published his own comic book WONDERLAND RESISTANCE via Kickstarter.
If you’ve been following Ryan K Lindsay’s career over the past decade, you know that he likes to dig into the emotional core of big genre stories and is passionate about making creator owned comics.
You also probably know Ryan has a keen eye for talent, and in Chris Panda has found the perfect partner to bring this action packed sci-fi, intergalactic espionage tale that doesn’t shy away from big ideas & emotions to life.
Here at ComixTribe, we’ve built a reputation for producing some of the slickest hardcovers in the world of comics… but we’re not content to rest on our laurels.
And that’s why we decided to partner with Sam Amborn at Printlore to do something truly special with this cover.
First, we decided Chris' big visuals needed more room, which is why this book is large format (7.75” x 11.25”) which is 30% bigger than your standard comic book!
Watch This to See How That Awesome Die-Cut Translucent Cover Works:
PLAY

We wanted to replicate the appeal of the visually stunning mask SHE wears by creating a special Die-Cut, transparent, layered image that will turn heads all across the galaxy.
Our goal is to create a stunning, original graphic novella package that’s beautiful inside and out! 
Creator owned comics live and die on the support of readers like you.

A Kickstarter launch lets us reach sci-fi comic fans around the globe and raise the substantial amount of funding we’ll need to fire up the press and create this one-of-a-kind hardcover, unlike anything you’ve seen before.
 Funds raised above and beyond our modest goal will go into project stretch goal enhancements for our backers as well as be invested back into the series.
 Want a Peek? Take a Look at These Pages Inside the Book... 
Want to See More Before You Ascend the Tower?
If you'd like to read even more of SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known before you back this campaign, we invite you to download this extended ashcan preview.
💀 CLICK HERE TO ACCESS THE EXTENDED ASHCAN PREVIEW 💀

The SHE team has been working on this project for well over a year. The book is done, our printer is already working on the finer details of our custom book, and we're ready to roll as soon as this baby funds! 
As usual for ComixTribe campaigns, US shipping is FREE… 
...but given that many of Ryan's fans are AUSSIE based and how rough the past few months have been due to wildfires, hailstorms, flooding and of course, viruses... 
...we’ve also decided to make AUS shipping free as well on most pledge levels!
 (Your welcome, mates!)
Here's How We Protect Your Rewards in Transit So Books Arrive in Great Condition for Collectors:
It's so not cool when you back an awesome Kickstarter campaign only to have your books damaged upon arrival, right?
To prevent that, we package our books with collectors in mind, and use Gemini Comic Mailers to protect and secure your books during transit.
And our Collector's Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition.

Once this project funds, we’re going to get right to firing up the presses so we can get it on your shelves as soon as possible.
Please know that the entire creative team has been working on this for over a year, and we’re dedicated to ensuring all backers receive more than just a story, but an experience with SHE.
And if you love her as much as we do, there will be more SHE stories in the future.
 So if you’re a fan of action packed sci-fi, intergalactic espionage, and big ideas & emotions in your comics,  then scroll down our Kickstarter page, find the pledge level perfect for you and join us for the wild ride.
And after you back, please take the time to share the link somewhere you use your voice for good.
Click to Share on FB
Click to Share on Twitter
Tell the people you know that #SheIsComing and they are going to want to get on board!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The support of backers on Kickstarter has been instrumental to the success of ComixTribe since our very first project back in 2012 and Ryan K Lindsay, who has been launching projects since 2014. 

Our success would not have been possible without the support of thousands of backers like you over the years...

So you better believe we take the trust of our backers very seriously.

We've taken a number of actions to mitigate risk associated with this campaign, including completing the creation of the book prior to launching and establishing a strong relationship with a quality printer who has done great work for us in the past and known for a hands on attention to detail and quality craftsmanship.

Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks, unforeseen hiccups, and lessons learned...and we've certainly learned valuable lessons from every past campaign.

During this time of global uncertainty, we realize that steady communication with our backers throughout the campaign and fulfillment process is key... and should any unforeseen issues cause delays, our backers will be the first to know. We're all going to get through this! 

We're committed to delivering a superior reward delivery experience for our backers, so we're investing in the best protective shipping materials for comics and collectibles, and handling fulfillment 100% in-house, to eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition.

ComixTribe and the SHE team have a long track record of delivering the goods, and the fact that we enjoy so much support from returning backers is testament to that.

So we invite you to back with confidence, as we want to be entertaining you for years to come.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Art is a journey, and I'd like to invite you to walk through mine.
Bright Ideas, Dark Mind is a 60-page softcover, perfect bound art book that celebrates the process of creating art, from the initial sketches and thumbnails to the final piece. 
This book collects the concept and marketing art from my first creator series, Sunmaker, through the last three years (2016-2019) of covers, pinups, and anthology submissions with insights to the creative process.
I believe books are works of art. Therefore, I've taken great consideration to make Bright Ideas, Dark Mind of the highest quality I can.
Of course!
Each physical book will receive a numbered and signed 3" x 4" bookplate, exclusive to Kickstarter! Pretty cool, right?
I mean, since you're helping me make this thing I wanna make sure you have something you can't get anywhere else.
Keep an eye out for an upcoming Kickstarter update where YOU can help choose the final art!
 
  Hey, there! I'm Ryan Kroboth, and I'm an illustrator, colorist, and writer from Pennsylvania. 
Most of my art education has been self-taught through books (and later blogs). However, in the last few years I've taken digital coloring, lettering, art, and digital inking courses through Comics Experience. 
Through these classes, I’ve experienced a large leap in my artistic growth in a short period of time. The biggest being learning to color digitally, and learning about color in general.
Perhaps one of the most exciting parts of Bright Ideas, Dark Mind is it contains just about all of my digital colors after the Comics Experience course. You’ll get to see my experimentation and growth across the course of the book!
I have a passion for teaching, and I love sharing the lessons I’ve learned with others. And I’ll be sharing a story or two throughout the campaign.
To bring you the best possible book, I teamed up with Dave Lentz to help me with the logo and the finalized design of the book. Dave has been a big help with Sunmaker, and you'll see some of his art in Bright Ideas, Dark Mind in our Cthulhu story!
Here's a bit more about Dave:
Dave Lentz is a family man, letterer, graphic designer, and sometimes artist. When he's not making comics he's usually reading them.
He is a fan of Star Wars, Batman, Ninja Turtles, and ninjas in general. 
Some of his credits include Metalshade, Spero: Breaker of Worlds (coming soon from Source Point Press), and Arabella Damage (coming soon from Action Lab).
You can find some of the things he do here
Few things get me as pumped as an awesome art book!
What's not to love?!
While some collectors are looking for a single image that resonates with them to hang on their wall, I prefer a book that collects the work of an artist.
I love seeing the growth across multiple projects. 
Not only that, but I feel like I get more value from an art book. I wanna see all the art!
And I wish more artists collected their work into books. I feel it's not a common thing in the comic artist space... I'm always looking when I find a new artist I dig! Seriously, every artist should make an art book!
(You can ask my friends. I'm always bugging them.)
With my passion for art books, I'd love the opportunity to offer one of my own.
Reaching the point in my artistic journey to consider this is a bit mind-blowing, honestly.
As there was a point that I almost gave up on art.
In high school I discovered Deviant Art. This was my first window into seeing art from other artists. The sheer talent of the work crushed my confidence. In retrospect I know this is silly, but at the time I felt like I'd never be "good enough". So I stopped drawing for a very long time.
Ask any artist and they will tell you drawing is a part of who you are.
Eventually I found my way back. And through the encouragement of my wife I finally took the steps of becoming the comic artist I'd always dreamed of being.
I'm still learning and growing. Over the last few years I've released two self-published creator owned comics, done several anthologies, and had the privilege of sharing the worlds of other creators by doing pinups and a few covers.
Bright Ideas, Dark Mind collects developmental material and sketches of those pieces.
And I'm hoping to raise money on Kickstarter to fund a print run of the book so I can share those with you.
At one point seeing great art crushed my confidence, now it inspires me.
I'd love the chance to inspire you and others.
The book is already 99% complete! The only page left to complete is the one bearing your name as a backer.
I'm looking to print 100 digital-press copies of the book through PrintLore.
Therefore, most of the funds will go to cover printing costs. Kickstarter and Stripe take a small fee off the top, with the rest of the money raised going to cover shipping.
 
   
  Here's what to expect for the campaign:
As an avid collector of books, I want to make sure you receive your book in excellent shape.
Not only will it be shipped in a Lil Packaging bukwrap cardboard mailer to keep your book protected, you will find it secured by cardboard inserts and wrapped in a plastic sleeve to shield it from the elements.
But the real secret?
Ninjas.
That's right. Your own personal package protector. These guys will keep your shipment safe, as no one wants to mess with a ninja.
No one.
While I've done my best to attempt to select shipping materials that will best keep your product safe, I'm aware that things do happen.
If for any reason you receive a package at fulfillment that doesn't meet your quality standards I will replace it at absolutely no cost to you.
I know there are collectors out there, and I want your book to make it to you in excellent condition.
 Thank you for the opportunity to share my project with you.
I'd like to ask for your support in bringing Bright Ideas, Dark Mind to life. Please back this campaign today and allow me to share my journey with you!
With gratitude,
Ryan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I understand what it means to ask for your support. 

This is my third Kickstarter, so I (more-or-less) know what to expect.

The biggest challenge to the campaign is the outside vendors, namely our printer. I have nothing but confidence in our printer, PrintLore. I've worked with them on my previous Sunmaker campaign. If any problems arise, I have had great communication from the company and I don't think that will change.

All the shipping supplies have been purchased, meaning all shipping costs will be for postage.

I'm very familiar with Kickstarter platform having backed over 300 campaigns. This helps give me insight to what a backer looks for and expects. In addition, I am a part of the ComixLaunch course which specializes in crowdfunding comics. With this community I have an experienced group to turn to should the unexpected arise.

And above all, I pride in communication. So if we run into any problems you can be assured that I'll let you know.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
My name is Barry Lewis. And it feels surreal to be writing this. 
I'm going to keep it short and sweet. But basically for the last 24 Months I have been reviewing lots of kitchen gadgets with the aim to put together product that I would want to use. It took a long time and I put what money I could into the stock, but eventually the Barry Lewis Veggie Prep Kit and Baking Mats, were born! 
Demand was bonkers, they sold out in the UK & USA within 5 hours. My aim is to slowly grow my brand and use kickstarter to make sure I don't run out of stock again and also help me develop the next batch of products! 
The kickstarter exists for two reasons:
1. To help me fund the stock for veggie kits, with new features.
2. To help fund my next product - a cake kit, featuring a turntable / stand as seen in my videos.
The rewards are simple - if you want a veggie prep kit or cake stand / turntable, back it, then when the campaign ends I know what to order and will ship them out!
As an exclusive to Kickstarter any Veggie prep kit or cake kit backed here can be shipped Internationally with the option for it to be signed! Just make sure to select that option when ordering. 
This really is the start of something awesome. I aim to use kickstarter to help us grow and create more product over time, this is all just new to me, but very exciting. 
I'm not a big corporation or anything. I just want to help people and this is all very bonkers, but lets see what happens!
Barry 
About the exclusive to Kickstarter cake stand / turntable:
Spins Clockwise and Counterclockwise for Easy Decorating
Removable Top for Easy Storage
Non Slip Grip Base
About the veggie prep kit:
 BARRY LEWIS VEGGIE PREP KIT & PHOTOS
INCLUDES ALL OF THE ESSENTIAL VEGGIE PREPPING GADGETS - 8 interchangeable stainless steel blades, 5 cup (1.2L) clear catchall container, 2 handheld vegetable peelers (standard and julianne), mandolin attachment, spiral slicer attachment, storage lid, cleaning tool, garlic rocker, garlic roller, and safety glove.
AS USED IN BARRY’S VIDEOS - See Barry use these prepping gadgets on his popular YouTube channel to make fun meals. After testing all kinds of kitchen gadgets Barry decided to create his own product line of high quality and functional kitchen products.
SHARP AND DURABLE BLADES - The stainless steel blades are razor sharp and high quality blades that make prepping easy and fun. A protective glove is included to keep you safe.
NON SLIP BASE - Makes chopping, slicing, dicing, grating and spiralizing much easier. The ABS plastic is nontoxic and BPA free. It is dishwasher-safe (top rack)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The new kits & stands will take a little while to order & test until I know the stock I need. But they will be available as soon as they are ready!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello, just an update to advise that all products (except for a few in the US and Canada have now been dispatched).... so if you do not receive anything in the next 3-4 weeks then please get in touch. Also a select few of you have not provided your address - I have emailed you personally & messaged you so please get in touch!
Thanks so much for your understanding with this crowdfund, sadly the postage costs with Covid have been significantly higher (double what we requested in some cases which adds up considerably) but I have taken the hit for that and did not feel it was right to pass that on to you guys for putting up with the delay and what has been a truly bizarre year.

Hey folks, just a quick update to say all products should now have been shipped to England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland, Jersey & Guernsey. The remaining products are being sent in the next few weeks so please keep an eye out. 
Please remember to update your delivery address if there have been any changes. I am not getting all notifications here so if you have a question it would be quicker to use the contact form on barrylewis.net ... thanks so much for the support again and it's been great to see the gadgets arriving to you guys!
Take care, Barry Lewis

Hey folks, just an update to say the products are here! I've started shipping them already (1 or 2 of you have received them already)...please remember depending on where in the World you are shipping times will vary over the next few weeks, but I already have a sore arm from writing and packing them all. I'm going to work through them as quick as I can, surprisingly my kids don't want to help lol
Again, thankYOU all so much for your support but more importantly patience during this crazy time in the World right now, as much as i'm excited to ship these out, I also hope more importantly that you are all healthy and getting through this as best you can.

Hello folks, just a quick update to say please look out for a survey in the next couple of days to complete. Delivery is due here in the next couple of weeks & i'll be working my way through them as soon as they arrive (the kids will be helping too, that counts as home schooling right?!)
I really do appreciate your patience, if it wasn't for the virus impacting things we would have had it all done by now but I know there are huge companies around the World having the same problems so it feels good to be almost there.

updates.update_userinfo: It's going to take a little longer, sorry
updates.update_content:
Hey folks, just another quick update.... the funds were received from Kickstarter just over a week ago and we have placed the order for the relevant units, so they are being made as I type and will be the next batch available to anyone around the World. 
As per the original campaign target we are aiming for June to have them all with you. Some of you have messaged to say you are moving house etc. This is why a survey will be sent out to find out your latest information on where we send it to (& also your personal message if you chose that option)..... so keep an eye out for that. This is the reason it will be posted last, so that we make sure it goes to the right place!

So the crowd fund campaign has come to an end and I would like to thank YOU for your support and backing of this project wherever you are in the World, it is just so amazing, i've found it quite surreal to be honest! I hope you are all taking care out there with the way the World is right now and I truly appreciate your backing during these times. We aim to launch further campaigns too with extra kits in future, so by backing this campaign you'll be the first to hear about them!
So, next steps. I've had an email from Kickstarter telling me that they will be contacting you all individually to obtain pledges, once this has been complete (apparently it can take a couple of weeks), they then take a % of this amount and then we can submit our order once i've had the funds from them.

updates.update_userinfo: Wow. What can I say?! ThankYOU so much for your support.
updates.update_content:
Hey, it's Barry here. I just wanted to post an update to say a massive thanks to every one of you for backing the campaign so far, it truly has blown away expectations and we are already in the process of getting the orders on their way. 
I know the World is not quite right at the moment and for you to support this, especially during these uncertain times is truly fantastic, so thank YOU. 
At the moment it's looking like we'll have one big old delivery that i'll head to visit when it arrives and sign items where needed (so look out for a sneaky pic or video of that) and then we will get them out to you. Remember if you want a signed item just add the signed fee to the perk as you pledge and we will pick it up from there.

campaign.story:
PLAY

Hi friends! We're Fred Schroeder & Dave Kellett: Directors of the award-winning comics documentary STRIPPED. That Kickstarter-backed film got to #1 on iTunes, and featured the first-ever interview with Calvin & Hobbes creator Bill Watterson. And today, we'd like to talk to you about a new interview series focusing on comics and animation called Story/Line.
Story/Line will be a love-letter to the art of cartooning, featuring in-depth, thoughtful interviews about the craft. These will be deep conversations, in the style of a PBS or BBC interview. Each will be beautifully shot in 4K, with one of the best crews in Los Angeles. Among our four Kickstarted interviews, we've already scheduled with Academy Award-winning Directors Chris Miller & Phil Lord (Spider-Verse, The Lego Movie, and every other great movie from the last decade), Eisner-Winning cartoonist Scott McCloud (The Sculptor, Understanding Comics, 24-Hour Comics Day), and the Eisner-Winning cartoonist Raina Telgemeier (Smile, Sisters, Guts)!  
We're still booking guests for STORY/LINE. And like we did with STRIPPED, we're actively reaching out to a diverse variety of creators for this first season, and the hoped-for seasons to come!
As you can imagine, shooting at television quality and paying our crew and artists what they rightfully deserve costs *cough-cough* a big chunk o' change. We've already conducted an interview with Jake Parker (Skyheart / Inktober), and a secret BONUS interview (see reward tiers, below!) -- so we've been able to METICULOUSLY budget the costs for four more episodes. Have a look: 
And here's the really good news: If this Kickstarter allows us to make this first mini-season of Story/Line, we're hoping it lays the groundwork for ongoing seasons with many more interviews! 
 Here's a quick guide to help you decide what rewards you'd like for backing the project! 
 This Kickstarter is about the production of delightful, downloadable interviews -- so every reward will be getting that in one shape or another. But in addition to those episodes, higher tiers will also be receiving awesome items such as...
Fred Schroeder is an award-winning film-maker, with thousands of hours of TV, film, and commercial experience here in Los Angeles and around the world. He's been nominated for Best Cinematography at Sundance, and is insufferable about it. 
Dave Kellett is the Eisner-nominated cartoonist behind Drive and Sheldon, the co-director of Stripped, and the co-host of the weekly comics podcast ComicLab. He also holds two Masters degree in the history of comics, which prepared him for LITERALLY NOTHING ELSE BUT DOING THIS SHOW.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Keeping in mind that Story/Line will be produced by just artists, not a huge studio, there are two potential risks worth mentioning...

COST: We've already shot two "test" interviews for this project out of our own checkbooks, and therefore have a pretty meticulous breakdown of our costs. So, while filmed projects are notorious for unforeseen/unexpected costs, we believe we've safely projected what we'll need to complete the project as planned.

SCHEDULE: While there is always a risk that unforeseen production delays could occur, we are committed to making Story/Line. As we imagine, in the worst-case that this or that final interview gets delayed, we'll still be able to release the already-shot-and-edited episodes as we go.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
