campaign.story:
Update 8.12
Just wanted everyone to know that the commissioned artist for “The Ring of Karma“ has completed the cover for the planned comic short and is geared up to start pumping pages out once we get the sessions going. 
The reason the characters have been drawn in silhouette is because we are missing some key elements. The Players!!! We are ready when you guys are to get your characters whipped up and plugged into their respective slots on the cover. 
I am expecting these sessions to be 100% bonkers. No need to worry about deep back stories or anything. We can handle all of that down the road. Lets just focus on getting these guys, gals, freaks, creeps and weirdos whipped up and have some FUN.
Cover for The Ring of Karma
 "A young vampire is on the run, wanted dead by both criminal and corporate factions. His father was right. In this world, there is no such thing as right or wrong. Good or Evil. There are only consequences for the choices you make."
The Angelblood Chronicles of Mystiq Volume #1 is suited for an audience 18 and up, and is inspired from game play sessions of the table top role-playing game Angelblood.
At the start of Mystiq’s story we see him at a major crossroads in his life. He isn’t sure of who he can trust, what he should do, or where he should go. But by the end of the series we see him reunite with his estranged father, and join a secret organization that was constructed to maintain a delicate balance in the world called Karma’s Hand. He gains new friends, pisses a shit ton of people off, and acquires some BADASS superpowers along the way.
This volume will include the initial 3 chapters of Mystiq's story, drawn by Gaspar Sabater in his version of a classic manga style. The book has been fully completed and is in the editing process now. We may be adding some additional pages to showcase some of our upcoming stories and add The Ring of Karma comic short. 
Currently 76+ pages of content for the graphic novel
5 pages or more of the Ring of a Karma comic short
8.5 x 11 size; glossy cover; full color
150+ pages of content for the game book
8.5 x 11 size; glossy cover; full color
Game Changer Card: Designed featuring one of the 7 major corporations in the world of Angelblood. Made with a rigid plastic (similar to that of a credit/ debit card) that will identify you as a “Game Changer“ at any event where we are present.
This story was developed during the entire time I was in the creation process of the game Angelblood. Mystiq's story is full of violence, gore, betrayal, and intrigue—the works. If you’re fans of dark anti-hero comic book heroes like Blade, Venom and Punisher or enjoy podcasts like Critical Role, Join the Party or The Adventure Zone you’ll enjoy this series. 
In many ways, Mystiq is the eyes through whom I see the world, and now you can, too. Throughout the series, you’ll experience a wide array of emotions. And with your support, we will not only be able to delve deeper into his story, but also the countless others that have yet to be awakened. 
This series of graphic novels will expose nearly every facet of the game world and show how interwoven all of the factions, clans and corporations are. I am extremely proud to have made it this far, being able to produce the 3 chapters of this story on my own.
Who are we?
Why Kickstarter?
I started Angelblood Publishing LLC with the mission to build a launching pad and a platform for up and coming creators and illustrators. I wanted to give something back to the genre that shaped my imagination as a child. I allow the fans of Angelblood to take control of it and shape it how they see fit. I firmly believe that we need to start cultivating platforms that support all artists as they are in the beginning stages of their careers. This support in turn allows them to continue to develop their skills and we as their supporters get to witness their growth 1st hand.
Just imagine if the Kickstarter platform was around when Frank Miller, Steve Dillon or Jack Kirby were first starting their careers. As a backer you could support them on their journey and purchase the first comic book they ever had drawn.  
The kickstarter audience is perfect for what it is I am trying to accomplish. I have learned so much, and am regularly blown away by the willingness to aid creators on their journeys toward becoming great and fulfilling their dreams. Not just for the amazing and creative rewards that come from backing projects, but also the joy and since of accomplishment we get as a community when a project we back is successful. 
I have been in the process of working on this publishing company for the last 15 years and I have finally reached this moment where I can start taking the next step and shining a light on so many young and talented individuals.   
Sneak peak inside the game book
Why do I want the game book?
You love playing tabletop role-playing games
You love comics and graphic novels
You have a character idea or story that you’ve been waiting to develop
You think it would be cool to be listed as a comic/ graphic novel creator 
PLAY

Where are the funds going?
Chapters 1-3 have been completed, and are in the editing process now and our game book was completed in 2017 (You can view all of the information on that project here). Please feel free to look back at both of the previous successful campaigns. The illustrators aren’t the only ones growing and getting better over time. So am I. The progressive steps we have taken to not only deliver quality rewards but deliver a quality presentation is something I am proud of. I want everyone to see how far we have come and assure them that we will continue to grow and get better with time and support. 
I do want to add color to this book and I feel like I can add a few more pages leading into the 4th chapter slightly to give readers a much more climactic cliff hanger. Printing and shipping costs are always a need based on the number of backers we get for physical copies of the books. There are a few surprises that I have for the digital backers. Keep your fingers crossed. 
You may have noticed that there are two different covers for book. YES!!! WE HAVE VARIANTS. Currently 2 and we are waiting the 3rd to be completed. We will be adding a separate reward tier for anyone interested in collecting all 3 covers. Make your pledge today and stay updated.


The priority goal after this project has been funded is to make sure that we have taken care of ALL our backers, once we have that confirmed we can then start production on the next project. If all goes as planned, we will be able to produce 1 graphic novel every 2-3 months. I am pushing to come back to Kickstarter with our 2nd graphic novel project The Angelblood Chronicles of The Cape before Christmas. It is an ambitious goal but we have gotten this far, and I think we can do it. Any funds collected beyond our initial goal are already reallocated toward bringing the backers THIS project the best possible product we can deliver both in print and digital formats.

What are people saying?
We have some of the best fans. And they are so incredibly creative I cannot wait to their stories produced so that I can share them with you all. I hope to see of you join this rapidly growing list very soon.
PLAY

How the game work?
Our unique game system simplifies the outcomes of the dice roles creating seamless and organic plot points for our players. In the following sequence, you see the main character Mystiq is having a hard time with some baddies. That actually happened on the table. I was rolling very poorly that day and the GM was hammering me. But I had a few tricks up my sleeve, as Mystiq often does.
 The dice will tell you not only IF you hit your target, but also where you hit the target, and vice versa. Did you hit them in the head, the arm, the torso, or the leg? Having this location- based combat system makes it super easy to have exciting and challenging combat sequences and you never have to worry about choreography. Just let the dice tell the story.
I sincerely thank you for taking time out of your day to visit with us and hope you like what we have to offer. Pledge your support and tell your friends about us.  
BE A GAME CHANGER!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest challenge will be the printing. We need to be able to print enough copies of the books that are ordered and keep the price point low enough so that we can get them printed and shipped without any major complication. If we get hundreds of orders for the physical copies of the books, we don't foresee an issue at all. If orders for physical copies of the books are small then we have to account for that and make the adjustment to a small run. We are looking to partner with two different printers at this time to accommodate both occurrences. Once we have those partnerships firmly in place we will be posting that update on our project page and in the project updates.

We are doing everything we can to increase the size of our audience and bring more attention to the project. Feel free to engage with me through the comments. I would love to hear from you and converse about what we have coming down the pipeline. 

Aside from printing, the only challenge I foresee would be a delay incurred from getting the additional pages added and/or adding the color to the book. We will be posting updates regularly to keep everyone up to date on the progress of the book, whether challenges arise or not.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Good morning everyone. I hope that your weekend went well. I had a great weekend, and want to share with you what we were able to accomplish.
Ring of Karma Update
We were not able to garner enough backers for the Ring of Karma event but we were able to put something together for you so you can see the process. campaign.story:
Hi guys!
My name is Tracy, and I'm the creator of Atomik Cupcake Designs, a small online store that sells kawaii-style accessories! I'm very excited to announce my third enamel pin series here on Kickstarter: The Pup Treats Collection!

ABOUT THIS PROJECT:
The 'Pup Treats' series was first inspired by my own pup, Molly, who passed away within the last year from cancer-related complications at the age of 13. Molly was a husky mix that we adopted from a shelter when she was about 5. In the nearly 8 years that I had with her, she was a wonderful little member of the family and had been there for some of the toughest times as I learned to become an adult. Dogs are far too good for this world, and the bond that we have with them means so much. 
While toying with the idea of commemorating Molly as an enamel pin, I also thought about how nice it might be for other people to have tiny renditions of their beloved pets! As an avid animal-lover, I created the Kittea Ceremony Enamel Pin Collection earlier this year for all the kitties and kitty-lovers out there--now it's time for the dog-lovers!
So, let's take a look and see what's on the menu!
 If we surpass our funding goals and are able to fund ALL of the designs, there are a couple additional goals that I'd like to try for as well!
Atomik Cupcake Designs has made a range of hard enamel pin designs in the past; here are a couple examples from our previous Kickstarters! 
 Reminder: Kickstarter is a pledge-now, pay-later platform! You have nothing to lose by pledging early (in fact, you can save a few bucks by grabbing an Early Bird reward!), and if the pin that you want doesn't get unlocked by the end of the campaign, you can drop your pledge!  
Thank you to everyone SO MUCH for your continued support! <3 Without the Kickstarter community, I would not have been able to make NEARLY as many creative goodies as I want to. Not to mention, your support inspires me to keep going and keep making more things! If you want to follow us, check us out below! 
Facebook   |   Twitter   |   Instagram   |   Website
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have now successfully created over a dozen enamel pin designs, most of which have been funded with the help of Kickstarter! As a result, I have gained valuable experience in understanding not only how to manage a Kickstarter campaign, but about manufacturer standards and quality control. For this campaign, I've lined up a couple very experienced enamel pin manufacturers to get the best product possible delivered out to all of you!

I also have a good understanding of factory timelines and the time it takes to deliver rewards to many people. Sometimes, there are factory mishaps (my last Kickstarter had a slew of them) that can include pins that have the wrong color, a high defect rate that requires a reorder, shipping delays, and other issues that can delay the production of pins. I've done my best to anticipate that sometimes these things happen, and I have set my delivery date accordingly to allow for PLENTY of time to get these all out to you!

Backers will be notified every step of the way on whether we're ahead of schedule, on schedule, or delayed, so there will be no surprises!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hi there everyone, long time no see! We live in some crazy times right now, but at least we can still collect pins. =D It's been about a year since the Pup Treats pins were funded, and I wanted to post on my previous projects an update about my newest project, the Ocean Pals: Enamel Pin Collection!

YAY, all of the Pup Treats Kickstarter rewards have been shipped! =D Even though going through a new company for the stickers resulted in a bit of delay, as I had to format each sticker for cutting myself before submitting them, the quality is FANTASTIC, and I think that those of you who ordered stickers will be thrilled!
For those of you who missed out on the rewards in this lovely Kickstarter, the Pup Treats will be available at their normal price of $11.50 in a couple weeks! Atomik Cupcake Designs will be attending DakuCon 2019 from November 15-17th (where I will be selling the Pup Treats merch and LOTS more!), and the pins and stickers will be available there after we return, just in time for the holidays!

Hurray! The backing cards have arrived, and everything looks good! Unfortunately, we're still waiting on the stickers--I ordered from a new company that had a different submission format, and there were a couple kinks to work out when submitting the designs. However, they should be in very soon as well!
In order to expedite the process of getting these out, shipping for rewards that don't include stickers will start shipping this week! There are only 30 of you guys, and only a handful who ordered stickers and sticker packs, so I'm thinking that it won't take long at all to ship everything out! Expect both domestic and international pins to start shipping in the next couple days, and I'll keep everyone updated on our progress, as well as the status of the stickers!

Hey there guys! It's been a little bit since our last update, but I wanted to let everyone know that the pins are finished and are on their way! They will arrive sometime early next week...I'm so excited! =D Here's a preview of the s'mores samoyed pin from the manufacturer:

I can't thank you all enough for your support! <3 While we weren't able to fund all of the Pup Treats Designs, we were able to fund 3 of the 8, plus 8 sticker designs! I'm so excited to start making these! =D

updates.update_userinfo: Funds Are In, Production Will Begin Soon!
updates.update_content:
It's been a little bit since I posted an update, so I thought I'd do that! We're 140% funded and less than $200 away from unlocking two more designs--thank you all so much for your support! <3
I feel very confident that we can at least unlock the two chocolate labs, for a total of 5 designs that you can choose from! Don't forget, there's also 3 inch glossy vinyl stickers! =D 
I want to get as close as we can to the $900 goal, but if we're pretty close and not 100% there (say we hit $850 or $800), I'll still unlock the labs!

campaign.story:
It's good to see you all again. We didn't raise our goal last time, so Haunted Days is back with a lower goal.
          Instead of trying to raise enough to do the entire comic, we're going to start smaller.

Just a little rundown for any newcomers:
Hello! My name is Liz. I’m a writer, mother of three, and entrepreneur. 
Haunted Days is a story about a pre-teen girl named Clair who can see ghosts. After the passing of her grandmother/legal guardian, Clair is relocated and brought to live with her Aunt Cleo in the town of Thompsonville. As if starting at a new school and having to make new friends wasn’t hard enough, Clair finds herself in the midst of a ghostly mystery.
          Hamilton House is haunted by not one, but dozens of spirits. All of which claim to have been “drawn to the house”. Clair is determined to help these spirits cross over as well as find the angry spirit that first died at Hamilton House and help them rest in piece too.
  I’m the writer behind Haunted Days. The artist working with me on this project is Satra Thai. Once the first few chapters are complete, I will be posting the series to Line WEBTOON (webtoons.com). I’m hoping to start posting chapters by November. 

For samples of my writing, please check out my Wattpad Page (@ElizaDuivenvoorde). 
          I have written a couple novellas, short stories, and a short comic, all of which you can find on Amazon Kindle. I’m currently taking a break from on two novels (a YA fantasy, and a dark fantasy series) to put all my focus in this project.
          Here’s a link to the kindle comic; Loxi Foxy and the Three Ducks https://www.amazon.ca/dp/B01IA8XJ3S/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_i_dtQ6CbQ1XKQWM
          And also a link to a fan fiction I wrote on Wattpad:
https://my.w.tt/8eNjaHmu0W
  Satra is an artist on DeviantArt. You can find her portfolio here: 
https://www.deviantart.com/satrathai/gallery/58398455/Portfolio
            She also has her own project that she posts on YouTube when she has the time. It’s titles Peppermint Winter. https://youtu.be/xrp_o7YPqdo
  Funding:
Funds that are raised will go towards helping pay the ever talented Satra. We will be making the last of the character designs, then the first few chapters.
When Season 1 is complete, that is when I will be getting the comic formatted and printed for all of you. 



Main Characters:
Clair Harper, our main character.
        Daughter of Sophie Harper and Max Crews.
  Clair’s father was never in the picture and her mother passed away when she was three years of age. She was then raise by her grandmother—Beatrice Harper—until her passing. Clair is now in the care of Max’s sister, Cleo Crews.
        Although Clair had never met her aunt Cleo before, the two formed an instant bond.
        Cleo works as an event planner and is currently organizing a haunted house event for halloween. Cleo offers to take Clair to the town’s real life haunted house, which happens to be where the event is taking place.
        Clair obviously excepts and is surprised when she arrives at the house to find that it’s not just haunted by one ghost, but multiple. She discovers that one ghost in particular is drawing all the other spirits to the house. She takes it upon herself to find out who this ghost is and help them move on.
        She’ll make some friends—both living and alive—along the way as she solves this mystery.

Grace Prince. Daughter of Ellen and Joseph Prince.
        Grace’s father passed away in a car accident five years ago, and Grace’s mom is the town’s mayor.
  Grace has a free spirit vibe to her. He loves adventure and a good mystery.
        Although she isn’t one of the “popular girls”, Grace is well known around the class and school. She makes sure she knows who most students are and what grade they’re in. Being part of the student council, and her class’ student body president, is a serious honour for her.
        Grace’s dream is to lead like her mother.
  Grace and Clair become friends almost instantly. Although Clair is a bit odd, Grace doesn’t mind. She actually finds it curious and entertaining.
        Little does she know that becoming Clair’s friend comes with its own adventure.

Esmeralda, a ghost girl who died in the 1950s.
  Esmeralda is one of the many ghosts living in the Hamilton House. She is the first ghost Clair meets in the house.
        Esmeralda follows Clair home and requests that she help the main ghost of the house move on, because the mysterious ghost seems to be very angry and restless.
  Although Esmeralda doesn’t remember how she died, or much about her past, she is a happy spirit. She still feels lonely like all the other ghosts in the Hamilton House, but she doesn’t let that keep her down.

T.J. Jones, son of Maggie and Julian Jones and younger brother of Aspen Jones.
        T.J.’s mom is a dance instruction and his dad is a privet investigator.
  T.J.’s full name is Tobias-John Jones but he shortened his name in the first grade to make it less of a mouthful.
        Along with most of the other boys in his class, T.J. is very into basketball. Although he likes other sports too, baseball is by far his favourite.
        T.J. also has a secret love of mystery novels and national mystery documentaries. It’s something he has in common with his older sister; his mom says it’s something they got from their father.
  T.J. lives across the street from Cleo and Clair and he’s also in Clair’s class.
        His detective instincts go wild when Clair shows up and he decides to investigate her. But what he discovers isn’t exactly what he expected. 

Aaric Edwards is the oldest of two. His younger sister—Alicia—is in Clair’s class. His parents are Pam and Ian Edwards.
Aaric and his sister are ten months apart in age but aren’t very close. Aaric keeps to himself and has two close friends—Zane and Zach—whereas Alicia is a social butterfly.
Although Aaric isn’t much for socializing and being the center of attention, he doesn’t let that stop him from pursuing his interests. Mainly basketball. Aaric doesn’t see himself as a basketball player in the future, as s career, but he still enjoys getting competitive with the kids in the grade lower than him.
Aaric has a pet turtle named Henry. Henry was a gift from his grandfather, given to Aaric to keep him company while in the hospital after falling down a set of stairs.

Emily Green is the daughter of Penelope and Alexander Green. Emily’s grandmother, Marylin Green, lives with her family and has since Emily was five. She and her grandmother are very close because of this.
Emily is a major book worm. It doesn’t matter if it’s a good novel or a textbook, she can get easily lost in it. Her love of literature is one of the things she shares with her grandmother; Emily sometimes even reads her textbooks or novels to Marylin, since the woman can no longer read on her own.
Emily doesn’t have many close friends at school, but she isn’t lonely. The characters in her books keep her company. She does like it when Grace Prince offers to have a homework date at the library, though. And when Clair shows up in their class, she can’t help but become friends with the girl.


Rewards:

Goals:
Clair Reward/Fully Funded UNLOCKED
Clair, T.J., Grace, Aaric, and Esmeralda as keychains.

Emily Reward/$1,100CAD UNLOCKED
Emily themed bookmark, keychain, and sticker. 


Cleo Reward/$1,200CAD
Cleo themed bookmark, keychain, and sticker.


Iris Reward/$1,300CAD
Iris themed bookmark, keychain, and sticker.

Victor Reward/$1,400CAD
Victor themed bookmark, Keychain, and sticker. 

Tabitha Reward/$1,500CAD
Tabitha themed bookmark, keychain, and sticker.

Thanks for your interest!
~Liz
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challanges we've been facing is funding and time. 

I (Liz, the writer) and commissioning Satra for the art, which costs money. And Satra in return has my commissions plus others to get through. 
We both love this story and want to badly see it come to life. We are motivated and passionate.

On top of that our first Kickstarter didn't make it, so we're hoping to make it this time. We're hoping it goes more smoothly this time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Here's chapter three of the webcomic.

Hey everyone!
I have a new chapter for you all. 
(Please note that these chapters are short because they're going to be going up on webtoon. They'll be grouped together to make longer chapters in the book).

First off, I’d like to wish you all a Merry Christmas and a Happy Holidays. I hope you’re all doing well and staying safe. We are moving into our second shutdown here in Ontario, so that’s fun.

Anyway, I wanted to just reach out and wish you all a happy holiday and all the best for 2021.
Here’s a cute illustration of Clair and Aaric, drawn by the talented Satra Thai.

Happy almost Halloween everyone!
So, I originally wanted this Halloween to be the official launch of Haunted Days, but as you all know we have run behind schedule.
BUT...
I just received the first chapter in its full completed glory. I'm hoping chapter two won't be too far behind.

Hey guys!

Just a little update with the coloured images of Clair and her grandma and Clair with her mom.

Hey guys!
Long time no see. I hope everyone is doing alright and is staying safe during this tough time.
Satra has sent me a few pieces of art, but we are behind on the comic itself. It's all written up, it's just the art that is taking a bit. I'm hoping that we will still be on track for shipping in January, though.

Hey guys!
Clair was featured in a WEBTOON Comic “Dream Boy”. It’s a great comic and I recommend checking it out.
 Click Here To Read Dream Boy

Merry Christmas Everyone
And if you don't celebrate Christmas, then Happy Holidays!
Also, I hope everyone has a wonderful New Year. We're on track to having more Character Designes done in the new year along with other things. Hoping to start the comic pages soon too. Will keep you posted.

Hey guys,
So, since this was the second attempt at finding Haunted Days here on Kickstarter, I had lowered the goal amount. Which of course means that I’ll have to do another Haunted Days themed Kickstarter to raise more money for the comic.
So, I want to run some ideas past you guys! I currently have someone designing a Clair figurine/statue, depending on printing costs we could do that. I was also thinking T-shirts/sweaters? Are there any other things I should look into for possible Haunted Days themed merchandise?

campaign.story:
Hello Minty Mountaineers!
Thank you so much for joining me here and a big thank you to those of you who have already made a pledge and contributed towards my new kiln goal! I am thrilled to have met my project target and to be in a position to add stretch goals!  
* * * Wooohah - STRETCH GOALS * * *
Stretch Goal One: Slab Roller - £150 in additional funds £1000 project total (inc fees)
A slab roller allows me to hand build my pots and plates at a faster rate and with more final consistency. The roller rolls the clay flat, clean and smooth and more importantly to the same thickness. This will mean my hand built work will have a more even drying process resulting in less loss during firing. It will also speed up my production process allowing me to offer more made to order slots with shorter turn around times. 
Stretch Goal Two: Pottery Wheel £250 in additional funds £1300 project total (inc fees)
After having to sell my pottery wheel to pay home bills I started a new venture into hand building ceramics and the journey has been fun but challenging. An ultimate goal would be to be able to purchase a refurbished kick wheel so I can continue to offer a wider range of shapes and designs and to produce a higher volume of ready to post items in larger batches.
Find me on social media;
 https://www.instagram.com/themintymountain 
 https://www.facebook.com/MyMintyMountain 
Here is my story so far... 
I am a self-taught potter based in Buckinghamshire, working around my little family and grumpy cat. I spent 3 years saving to set my own small studio up. It was so liberating to be able to purchase my kiln, pottery wheel and small garden shed along with a whole bunch of exciting accessories. I was set up and ready to throw myself in at the deep end. 
I have already been overwhelmed by the continued support from my followers and the crafting community. I really have been able to realise my dream, and since 2013 I have been sending pieces of my work from the UK all over the world. In fact, I have sent orders to 23 different countries; from Russia to Japan, from Scotland to Hawaii, from Mexico to Alaska. I have sent orders to 39 of the US states and for over 1000 sales recorded on Etsy, I have a 100% 5 star feedback rating. I am extremely proud of my achievements and more importantly, I still love what I do.  
Sadly at the start of this year due to personal circumstances I had to sell my pottery wheel to cover a months rent. To say this broke my heart would be an understatement - but I have managed to continue to run my little business by individually had building each order. As long as I had my kiln and my clay, I was golden. 
Alas, my kiln has recently started to misfire and after a short investigation and consultation it looks like her days are numbered. I've been able to source a temporary fix for a limited number of firings to complete outstanding orders, but unfortunately I have had to stop production of my most popular made-to-order items, as I can not currently guarantee quality or success. It's a bit of a punch in the gut, especially as this income is so vital for me here. 
 A working kiln is an essential to a small potter like myself. I have decided to purchase a refurbished kiln, and have already found two possibilities. I can't afford to fund the purchase entirely, but I do have a small amount of savings set aside for Christmas that I will be putting into the kiln fund as a float. So, I am looking for your to help to raise the remaining amount, enabling Minty Mountain to get back up and running.
Thank you all for your kind words and continued support. I am forever grateful to you all!
Emma
xxx
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As my business model is already running and my products are tested and well established the risks are reasonably low. 

I have already stopped producing made to order items until a kiln can be secured. 

I have secured two possible kilns and have a third back up option. 

I will be making as many rewards as I can when they come in to ensure a swift turn around and dispatch to pledgers. 

I already have a qualified electrician on standby to test the kiln so I can get cracking!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: My sincerest gratitude
support.descp:
I have already been overwhelmed by the support I have been shown during the best and worst times of this creative journey.
All pledges however great or small mean the world to me. A pledge of £2 is you taking the time to invest in me and my work. I will be forever grateful for that.
You rock!

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
It's the home stretch - the final 6 hours of the kickstarter project!

Hi everyone!
Just a little catch up as we enter the last week of the campaign. Thanks so much to you all and to those who continue to share my link and spread the word - I am so very grateful!
I have been working on a whole bunch of new stuff ready for when the kiln is replaced. These bee planters are part of my bee range - I have mug, planters, ring dishes and hanging plant pots planned for this range.

updates.update_userinfo: Thanks to all pledgers and followers!
updates.update_content:
Hi all!
Just checking in to say another thank you to my new flurry of project followers and additional pledgers! If you follow me on social media you will know I am in the process of planning and releasing my Christmas decoration collection, I slowly release Christmas info from July, its early I know haha! If you want to find me on social media the links are all at the bottom of this update!
Hi everyone, I hope you are all having a nice weekend!

Hi everyone!
Since selling my pottery wheel at the start of the year hand building has added a new dimension to making these little chaps. The bear pots are one of my most popular items and despite following a loose template each one is ever so slightly different and has its own character.

Hi All!
Thank you all for backing me on my kiln quest so far, I am totally bowled over right now! Already over half way funded over this weekend alone - you guys totally rock!
The two primary replacement options I have sourced are still available to me at this stage and I am almost finished on my outstanding orders thankfully.

project_data.project_name: The Kiln Kapow!

campaign.story:
After her father is killed in the line of duty, Kate and her mom are forced to find work. They soon find themselves hired by the Lady of Castle Carrickdain, to work in an old ruin rumored to be haunted by a ghost with a backwards head...
If you enjoy gothic horror about a castle ruined by its own dark secrets, come check out our comic WOMEN DO NOT CREEP BY DAYLIGHT.
Kate's life is thrown into turmoil when her father is unexpectedly killed in his job as a policeman. She and her mother are forced to look for a job, but no one is hiring two inexperienced maids. Eventually, they are hired by Castle Carrickdain, an undesirable ruin haunted by a lonely aristocrat and a distinct lack of servants. 
Kate wonders why the castle has such a hard time finding employees, and soon discovers that there is a rumor of a ghost with a backwards head. The young skeptic decides to investigate the rumor, and soon finds herself tangled up in Carrickdain Castle's terrifying secret. 
A page from the comic:
Why did we come to this place, Ma?

Vera Greentea is the writer of the forthcoming Grimoire Noir (coming July 23rd, 2019) and is best known for her dark fantasy stories, including an ongoing Victorianpunk series Recipes for the Dead, the completed dark fairy tale Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits, and her myth-drenched sibling saga The Idols of Solanşehir, an ongoing series elsewhere on Kickstarter. 
You can find these and other comics at her website, greenteapublishing.com.
 Kyla Vanderklugt, best known for illustrating girls with swords in Spera and blood-drenched specters in the snow in The Storyteller: Witches, is an illustrator and comic artist, an occasional designer and a pun laureate. Brilliant at setting the mood, she will be handling the moody castle design, the sumptuous clothing styles, and all of the skeletons in the closets of Carrickdain. 
Find her more of her work at www.kylavanderklugt.com and future work at First Second. 
A panel from Women Do Not Creep By Daylight
Our gothic Kickstarter campaign will be up from late June to August, during which time  we hope to collect enough money to pay Kyla for her incredible work, print the book and ship it to you lovely punkfolk, as well as the usual heres-and-theres (aka Kickstarter fees,  buying packaging supplies, all relevant merchandise, ISBN &  barcodes, etc.). The comic will be of usual Greentea Publishing quality; 32 pgs. of story + extras, all in glorious color and large-font format.  Our printer is American, so it's a bit more expensive, but we don't  mind sacrificing some money to save on costs to the environment.  
We are very proud to present some lovely rewards, all designed by the extraordinary Kyla Vanderklugt. We are especially excited to create a Women Do Not Creep By Daylight enamel pin, and are working on designs based on our ghostie... 
Kyla made a lovely digital representation of what you will get at each tier, hopefully this will be helpful to those of you who had questions! (If you still do, don't hesitate to ask!)
We are also excited and really proud to present the gorgeous Enamel Pin! (Note: This is a the sample mock-up, so it might look a tiny bit different!)
We are also excited about our mid-tier reward - our spooky door hanger, created to make sure that no one ever disturbs you again, for fear of being disturbed. I mean, why shouldn't your family be afraid of you? 
Thank you so much for taking some time to look at our spooky story about ghosts and castles! 
xoxo,
Vera + Kyla
The spooky musical accompaniment used in this video is an excerpt  from "The Inner Demon" composed by Lionel Schmitt and licensed under a Creative Commons  License. All art is by Kyla Vanderklugt.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Greentea Publishing has now been creating projects on Kickstarter for over 5 years. We're proud to say that we've been very professional about making sure that we don't miss our deadlines and follow up with our pledgers about what's happening (and we're even known to chase down a pledger if they forgot to send us their pertinent info - we want everyone to get what they pay for!). We love our supporters and we love to treat them well!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Happy (almost!) Halloween, ghostpunks!
At this point, I've shipped about 95% of the packages, and my hope is that many of you have already started receiving them! And thank you to those of you who sent me messages that you did, I always deeply appreciate knowing that they got to their destinations. The last batch is getting stamped and going into the mail today, and then we are done with WOMEN! Well, with the ones that creep at least... 
This has been an extra fun packing because I did it while watching horror movies. I re-watched The Ritual (which has one of the most fun monsters I've seen in a while!), It Comes At Night (I know... I'm late with that one and I'm not sure why; I loved It Follows), and The Apostle (which was very moody and had a pretty creative monster, but... I wanted a little more?). And I'm halfway through the novel ASYLUM by Madeleine Roux, which I definitely picked up because of the creepy cover! How about you all? Are you watching some spooky films/reading some scary books this week? I'm just curious what kind of stuff you're all going in for, ha.

Dearest ghostpunks,
A quick update! Believe it or not - and I'm still very surprised because there is usually something - but we are still on schedule! The books are estimated to come by next Tuesday, and from then on, it's up to me to ship them out! And I'm fairly quick about it these days, if I do say so myself! Next week, everyone will get their digital gifts, and some of you will start receiving your physical rewards as well. My hope is that everything will be out before Halloween. I want you all to have a scary story to look forward to!

updates.update_userinfo: Women Do Not Creep, they make Comics and go to Conventions. <3
updates.update_content:
Dearest ghostpunx,
A quick update on where we are! Well, we are still hitting our deadlines and I cannot be more excited! All of the merchandise is now in my dining room, waiting patiently to be shipped. The last thing we are waiting for is the comic itself! And the sample just landed on my doorstep, looking quite serene. Maybe too serene for the horrors inside...

Dearest lovepunks,
We did it! All of you and me and Kyla, we are making this book a reality! Thank you so much to you all for supporting our strange imaginations and helping us create a monster. Thank you for contributing your voices and hearts to our vision, and for pulling for us! We are so appreciative for your kindness, and cannot wait to take that energy and make our harrowing creation.

updates.update_userinfo: WDNCBD: FUNDED + Preview of the Cover!
updates.update_content:
Hey my dears and dearettes, 
Lovely little update to let you know that the coloring is finished! The interior pages of the comic are absolutely done and they are so good! Kyla really nailed the creepy coloring of the pages at the end of the comic, but I cannot show you because it's all a spoiler! You'll have to just wait and see! But I do think you will really like it!
For now, I will show you another page, one nearer to the beginning...

updates.update_userinfo: WDNCBD: Enamel Pin Design and Finished Pages
updates.update_content:
Gentle creatures of darkness,
It's been a busy weekend! Firstly, thank you to everyone who came to the book launch for GRIMOIRE NOIR! It really meant a lot to me to see so many of you celebrating the release of the graphic novel along with me, and I appreciated that people waited an extra hour to get their book signed (!!).

Hey my dearest lovepunks!
Just some good ole' fashioned updates! We are halfway funded with over 400 lovely pledgers! Thank you, all of you, for taking a chance on this creepy little story that Kyla and I are pouring our hearts into! 
While watching this project grow, we have also both been very busy. Kyla has begun coloring the pages and I've been working on the layouts of the supplementary sketchbook. I really love process work and pore over things like Guillermo del Toro's At Home With Monsters for hours and hours (does anyone else do this?), so it's really fun to make one for Women Do Not Creep!

updates.update_userinfo: WDNCBD: Updates, Sketchbook + Vera Greentea's New Book Is Out Today (scroll down!)!
updates.update_content:
Gentlepunks,
A good update to you, and a good update to you... truly! I'm so excited to tell you all that Kyla has finished the inks! This means that she is now working on coloring the comic and with this, we are halfway to a finished book! 
And look how beautiful the colors are already looking...

campaign.story:
It’s the law of Nature: only the strong survive. 
Mankind is long gone, and Earth went on without them. In this savage world of predators and preys, little Bianca saw her flock slaughtered by the Flesh-eaters, her mother devoured before her very eyes. She was spared, so that she could eventually become a better meal. 
Since then,many winters have gone by, 
Bianca is back, but she is not a prey anymore...

Bianca – Little Lost Lamb is a 128 pages long graphic novel that hit the Italian market for Shockdom Publishing in June 15. The high-quality visual standard quickly grabbed the interest of many users on social media, including a consistent group of foreign fans. Their enthusiasm inspired us to launch this kickstarter campaign, in order to bring Bianca also outside Italian national boundaries.
This work marks the professional debut of the two authors, Paolo Margiotta and Francesca  Perrone, and also serves as the spearhead for Shockdom’s adventure in the International  market.

So, who are these two authors, and who else contributed to the creation of Bianca - Little Lost Lamb?

If Paolo is your nerdy stereotypical writer, with an academic past in linguistics and a penchant for good food and videogames, who also happens to mildly hate social media (and people in general, he says, but nobody believes him), Francesca is a young and very talented 23 years old artist, who you might know by the online nickname Lillayfran. You also probably already saw some of her work, since she is behind some of the best Boom Studios ‘Steven Universe’ covers.
They met at the International Comic School in Naples, where both studied with some of the finest Italian comic book writers and artists. Sharing a complementary artistic affinity, the two decided to take a shot at it: the project soon came into shape and was showed to Shockdom at the prestigious Lucca Comics fair. Only 3 days later, they were talking business and contracts. It’s not something you see everyday.
Other notable people who helped a lot are Paolo’s sister, Marina ‘MaW’ Margiotta, a webcomic artist with a PhD in genetics, who hugely contributed to the coloring and lettering process, and Davide Maimone, the 3D artist who made the trailer.



WHERE DO WE GO NOW?
Well, it depends entirely on this fine community!
What happens here and now is up to you. Back us up, show us some love, and, oh boy, you will not regret it!

                           FIRST STRETCH GOAL (4.500€) - LIMITED EDITION POSTCARD
                                                                    UNLOCKED!

Hello backers and thanks for your support! It's time to announce our first stretch goal: if we hit the 4.500€ mark, we'll be sending out this limited edition postcard to anyone who pledged €20 or more! 

                 SECOND STRETCH GOAL (7000 €) - LIMITED EDITION METAL PIN (38 mm)
                                                                            UNLOCKED!

It's time to reveal our new stretch goal! If we reach the 7000€ mark, we'll be sending out a limited edition metal pin (38 mm) to all the backers that pledged 20€ or more! Thanks for your support, guys... spread your love for our little Bianca! 
               THIRD STRETCH GOAL (10000€): LIMITED EDITION KEYCHAIN (32mm)
                                                                      (LOCKED)
Hello, backers: it's time to unveil our third stretch goal! If we hit the 10000€ mark, everyone who pledged 20€ or more will receive this amazing limited keychain of Bianca (32mm)!

updates.update_content:
Hello dear backers,
we hope you are all safe in these strange, turbulent times.
We know that many of you already received their copy while others are still waiting for it. The shipping time from the storehouse are longer than anticipated due to the worsening of the pandemic situation in the U.S.A., as you can well imagine. Our expeditioner however reassured us that delivery of all pledges is currently underway and soon all remaining lists will also be shipped.

Hi backers, 
we are following the work of our international expeditioner and we have the first update for you regarding Bianca's volumes. 
They have informed us that they have sent all the pledges of the "No More Sorrow" tier. The whole list was completed on Saturday afternoon. For all the backers that are part of this list, the comic has been sent and some have already informed us that they have received it. You can request the tracking ID of your package in private and we will provide it to you.

Hello dear backers,
more good news! 
Our expeditioner just confirmed that our volumes arrived to his warehouse. so he'll start shipping them in a few days! We'll update you again when they'll be sent out!
And more surprises are coming: to help kill the time and to thank you for your patience, we are sending you an additional gift... so stay tuned!

Hello dear backers,  
as promised, here's the latest update on the delivery progress in these difficult times worldwide. 
The cargo ship just docked in the U.S.A. and unloading operations  are underway, thus the volumes will be avaiable for ground trasport in the next 48 hours. Once unloaded, it will be necessary to wait  the completion of all mandatory customs procedures and transport time.

Hello dear backers,  
we want to update you on the current status of things in this critical moment worldwide. 
We are happy to announce that the books were just shipped from Genoa's port and are due to arrive on April 2nd to our international shipper who will then proceed to individually send them to you in conformity with current health normatives.

Dear backers,  
the long awaited time has finally come!
In this previous months, seeing the success of our campaigns, we worked hard to ensure that the shipping of Bianca and of all other following volumes would be as secure and trustworthy as possible, so that the work of our artists might be safeguarded. However, finding a suitable international shipper turned out to be a long and difficult process, full of new things and a great amount of legal paperwork to fill, .

updates.update_userinfo: Some good news and a new adventure!
updates.update_content:
Hello dear backers, 
we are inches away to officially sending out the physical copies!
Authors completed commisions, sketches and signatures and we are defining details with our international shipper to assure a safe and quick delivery to all of you. All final preparations will be completed this week, and we got reassured that all copies will be delivered within a month, according to where you live.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy New Year... and get ready!

updates.update_content:
Hello dear backers, 
the time has come: the digital release of Bianca is finally ready, fully translated with the definitive lettering, and will be soon sent to all of you. We took our time, so that the final result could be the best possible one and we are fully satisfied! In the next few days, as we go through the printing process, we'll be sending you the digital file, so you can start to enjoy the story while you wait for your physical copy to arrive!

campaign.story:
Hello! My name is Liz. I’m a writer, mother of three, and entrepreneur.
  Haunted Days is a story about a pre-teen girl named Clair who can see ghosts. After the passing of her grandmother/legal guardian, Clair is relocated and brought to live with her Aunt Cleo in the town of Thompsonville. As if starting at a new school and having to make new friends wasn’t hard enough, Clair finds herself in the midst of a ghostly mystery.
       Hamilton House is haunted by not one, but dozens of spirits. All of which claim to have been “drawn to the house”. Clair is determined to help these spirits cross over as well as find the angry spirit that first died at Hamilton House and help them rest in piece too.
  I’m the writer behind Haunted Days. The artist working with me on this project is Satra Thai. Once the first few chapters are complete, I will be posting the series to Line WEBTOON (webtoons.com). I’m hoping to start posting chapters by November.
  Funds that are raised will go towards helping pay the ever talented Satra. If there are any extra funds, then that will go towards step two of the Haunted Days goal; animated TV show. The show would have two seasons with at least ten episodes per season.
  For samples of my writing, please check out my Wattpad Page (@ElizaDuivenvoorde). 
       I have written a couple novellas, short stories, and a short comic, all of which you can find on Amazon Kindle. I’m currently taking a break from on two novels (a YA fantasy, and a dark fantasy series) to put all my focus in this project.
       Here’s a link to the kindle comic; Loxi Foxy and the Three Ducks https://www.amazon.ca/dp/B01IA8XJ3S/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_i_dtQ6CbQ1XKQWM
       And also a link to a fan fiction I wrote on Wattpad:
https://my.w.tt/8eNjaHmu0W
  Satra is an artist on DeviantArt. You can find her portfolio here: 
https://www.deviantart.com/satrathai/gallery/58398455/Portfolio
       She also has her own project that she posts on YouTube when she has the time. It’s titles Peppermint Winter. https://youtu.be/xrp_o7YPqdo

  Thank you dearly for you’re interest and support. ~Liz

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challanges we've been facing is funding and time. 
I (Liz, the writer) and commissioning Satra for the art, which costs money. And Satra in return has my commissions plus others to get through. 
We both love this story and want to badly see it come to life. We are motivated and passionate.

updates.update_content:
Hey guys,
So, during the last couple days on this kickstarter I was preparing for a re-launch with a lower budget. 
I took advice from my backers and have added more information to the campaign. I made a new video too, although it probably isn’t much better than the one on this Kickstarter.

It’s the last day. Less than 24 hours to go. Sorry I haven’t posted anything lately, I was in the hospital with my baby girl. We’re back home now and doing well.
I’d like to thank everyone who supported Haunted Days. You are all amazing. It doesn’t look like we’re going to get funded this time around, but don’t worry; I’m not letting that discourage me. I’m preparing for another round. We’ll have a lower and hopefully more information ready. So keep an eye out.

I cant believe we’ve almost  made it to $1,000CAD! I feel like I might cry. 
Fingers crossed that we can make it another $4,000 after this in the few days remaining. 
Today I will be posting another reward. It includes signed copies of the comic/graphic novel and novel, as well as the chance to get sneak peeks of the story and comic before it is posted online. You will also receive a personalized voice recorded thank you message from myself (the writer).

In honour of our last few days I've added a new reward (and an early bird version).
This reward includes everything from the previous rewards plus an extra little something.
AN ACRYLIC STAND!
This stand is still being designed, but I'm very excited for it. It'll be made with 100% recycled plastic and will have Clair standing in front of the Hamilton House.

I was going to post an update saying we broke $400CAD, but somehow since I last checked my phone we made it to $500CAD! I can’t believe it! We made it to the first goal-point! As a celebration, I will be adding another 5 stickers to orders with the sticker reward. So now instead of five stickers you’ll be receiving 10! Woop woop!
The last couple days I’ve been speaking with other creators about spreading the word about Haunted Days. Thankfully there are creatures out there that we’re willing to help out. Check out their kickstarters:

Andi is a character based off my own brother (Andrew).
Andi Duffy is the son of April and Mark Duffy. He has an older sister. He loves dogs and is okay with cats too. Andi is a movie junkie; his favourites include Star Wars, the Marvel Universe movies, Cartoons (Dreamworks, Disney, etc.), Lord of the Rings, etc. He also loves watching horror movies with his sister; the two pick the movies apart and laugh at the little mistakes made in production or the story.

This is a cross-post, spreading awareness of another Kickstarter in need of support.
Kickstarter by Jack D.
The Tale follows 3 magical girls with elemental powers, who are send to "canyon of witches", a magical place out of human reach, where girls are protected and educated to master their powers; When they get to know each other, they'll realize they have more in common than they imagined, including the destiny that awaits for them in the world of magic.

This is a cross-post update to raise awareness of another project.
A Kickstarter by Justin Harris
The Story;
In the darkest corners of the night, beyond the veil of nightmares and shadow lies a world beyond the world of Humans. Within this world, our greatest fears are manifest and are free to roam living lives of their own. Once a year on a special day, October 31st, they are allowed to travel to the world of Humans to walk among them. On this day where even humans can pretend to be monsters, these creatures beyond the veil spend their 24 hours walking amongst humanity feasting on their fear and terror.

project_data.project_name: Haunted Days

campaign.story:
After 4 successful Kickstarter campaigns and 17k+ pledges fulfilled to backers all over the world, we're excited to share our latest project with you:  
Nanobag 3.0 - The ultimate reusable shopping bag
Ultra-light, ultra-strong, ultra-foldable. You won't believe how small these premium shopping bags pack. These tiny shopping bags are convenient to carry in your pocket at all times, are super comfortable to carry, and easily carries 66lbs (30kg).



Available in eleven colorful designs + black, blue and gray color.
Wouldn't it be nice to always have a comfortable bag handy?
We consume somewhere between 1 trillion to 500 billion of plastic bags per year, and it’s an unnecessary waste. Reusable bags are great for the environment, but normally they’re bulky or poor quality. Nanobag 3.0 is a premium shopping bag so compact that you'll barely feel carrying it. The compact super-soft fabric easily folds into your pocket, and does away with impractical reusable shopping bags.
Here are the designs you can choose from in our backer survey.





It's the positive feedback from our backers that drives us!





The Nanobag 3.0 can easily carry 66lbs (30kg).
18 liters of space should be enough to cover your daily needs.
The bag is so compact and soft that you will hardly notice carrying it in your pocket.
It even fits in the watch pocket of your jeans.
Our custom made diamond ripstop fabric has an extreme weight to strength ratio.
The reinforced handles distributes the weight evenly for comfortable use.



Nanobag 3.0 is 5% lighter than its predecessor.
The fabric measures only .002" (.05mm thick), or around half the thickness of a human hair.
The bag weighs only .73oz (20.7g).
We’ll plant one tree per bag 
We're committed to making you a climate positive product. That means that we give more back to the planet than we take. We consider our bags environmentally conscious, as they contain less materials than other bags in their category and help reduce single use plastic bag consumption. This time we’re also stepping up our tree planting efforts further. For each bag we sell we’ll plant one mangrove tree with the Eden Reforestation Project. Mangrove trees are one of the most effective tools against climate change, and stores ten times more carbon than land based tree species. Mangroves take the carbon out of the air and bind it to the ground, thus preventing it from escaping into the atmosphere. One single mangrove tree can store around 1750lbs (800kg) in its 40 year lifespan.  As an added bonus they prevent soil erosion and help sustain coastal ecosystems.
We will plant one tree for every bag pledged for with Eden Reforestation Projects.
Commitment to excellence
We're committed to creating high-quality products that you'll love. The bags are made with premium custom made fabrics and we've put in place a thorough quality-control and testing process to make sure you receive a great final product. We guarantee that your bags will be of excellent quality.

Shipping
We offer FREE International registered shipping to backers pledging for 4 bags and above. All parcels will be shipped with tracked air mail.









The team:
Tiptop Things are a group of friends working together to infuse everyday items with premium quality and cutting edge technology.  Nanobag 3.0 is our fifth Kickstarter campaign, and you might have seen our earlier Nanobag and Air Deck campaigns. Our mission is to make quality premium products that you will love.

Why do we need your support?
We can't do this without you. The funds we raise here will go towards producing our custom made fabric, printing and stitching the bags as well as logistics. Our Kickstarter backers will be the first to have the Nanobag 3.0. 

 Moon, River, Ocean, Ice Sheet, Astronaut - Credit: NASA
This project is promoted by Green Inbox
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 750+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $330MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our fifth Kickstarter campaign, and we’ve fulfilled all four previous projects with positive feedback and happy backers. The Nanobag 3.0 has been developed and tested over the past few months and we are confident that we can do a good job with this. As with every project, there can always be unforeseen things along the way, but we've done our best to mitigate problems. There might be minor design changes and improvements made to the product as they're continually being developed. We promise you that we're 100% committed to the project and that we’ll keep you updated every step of the journey. Our goal is to satisfy all our backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What's Project Hoax about?
Set in 1994, a group of school kids plan to get their own back on the local bully, but get more than they bargained for when they try to stage a monster hoax.
 Who will enjoy Project Hoax?
 Comic collectors who are fans of all-ages comics.
 Parents/aunties/uncles wanting to give their child/niece/nephew a unique gift.
If you like the idea of an all-ages horror comic that takes you back to growing up in the 90s and a story that you can enjoy with your child/niece/nephew.
What do you get when you back Project Hoax?
All reward backers receive a full-colour 36 page digital copy of Project Hoax.. 
All print copy reward backers (£3) and above receive a full-colour 36 page print copy, bookmark and an A4 poster.
Above the print copy reward you can also get a bike helmet sticker, Charlie's Project Hoax planbook, an 8GB cassette tape USB drive or even a video game cover commission by our artist, Dan Butcher.
My name is Samuel George London, I'm a comic book writer from Hampshire in the UK and creator of Project Hoax.
During the 90s, I was about as suburban as a young lad can get. I had a curtains-style haircut, I had a paper round, I had a tape player and I had a BMX. Most weekends and evenings I was at my local dirt jumps with my friends.
I always look back fondly on those memories, and I've always tried to think of a story that could encapsulate what it was like to grow up in the 90s. Twenty-five years on, I've written my "love letter" to the 90s with Project Hoax.
With that in mind, here are a few of the first pages...
I hope you enjoyed those pages, and that it gets you excited about Project Hoax. Feel free to read those pages in more detail by clicking here. The story of Project Hoax itself is 30 pages within a 36 page comic and the art is drawn by our awesome artist, Dan Butcher.
Dan is best known for his brilliant superhero webcomic, Vanguard, but he's also known for being co-host on the Awesome Comics Podcast. And as you just saw from the pages above, Dan has an impactful style of art that's perfect for this story.
Dan Butcher's Impactful Art
Alongside Dan, we also have an editor on TEAM HOAX, in the form of Nicole D'Andria. Nicole, is the Marketing Director and Submissions Editor at Action Lab Comics. She edits numerous comics for Action Lab, from Dog of Wonder to Zombie Tramp. She also adapts Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug and Cat Noir to comics and co-writes DollFace.
 Outside of Action Lab, Nicole writes comic book related articles for Comic Frontline, works as a freelance editor and is currently writing the second issue of her successful Kickstarter comic, Road Trip to Hell.
Our editor, Nicole D'Andria.
Now that I've had the pleasure of introducing you to the team, it's with even more pleasure to introduce you to the main characters from Project Hoax.
Our Main Characters
Charlie is the leader of the group, with Aseem being his indie-music-loving "second in command". Brian is the rich one of the group and has all the latest video games, gadgets and clothes. Then there's Dev, who keeps the group glued together with his humorous anecdotes and sometimes silly behaviour. Finally, there's Jack, who's a couple of years older than the lads and is the local bully.
The script is written and edited, the artist is on board, the printers are ready and as long as we're fully funded we'll be able to have all of your rewards with you by October 2019, in time for Halloween.
Apart from the comic itself, the first reward I'm really excited about is the Bike Helmet Sticker (10cm x 6cm). When I was a lad in the 90s I went through quite a few helmets for BMXing and rollerblading. Whenever I got a new the first thing I did was kit it our with awesome stickers, and now is my chance to pass on that tradition with the Project Hoax, Bike Helmet Sticker reward. It's also good laptops, which is more likely these days.
Bike Helmet Sticker (10cm x 6cm)
The second reward I'm excited for is the Project Hoax Planbook. As I mentioned before, I used to BMX and roller-blade during the 90s, and during school (usually English Literature class) I used to daydream about building the perfect ramp. I drew and planned these ramps in my school notebooks. With that in mind, it stands to reason that if I had planned to stage a monster hoax on a local bully Charlie would do the same. This reward is an 8 page, A5 printed booklet of Charlie's plan for the hoax. In order to not spoil the story we can't show the interior but here's a sneak peak at the cover.
Charlie's Project Hoax Planbook
The third reward I'm excited for is the 16-bit variant cover print copy by the brilliant John Stratman. If you're a fan of Mr. Sunday Movies on YouTube then you might have come across his work before on their 16 Bit Scenes videos. Anyhow, as 90s video games feature in the comic, John has drawn a 16-bit graphic variant cover that you can collect on top of all the other goodies you get through the previous rewards, including a print copy of the original cover design.
16-Bit Variant Cover by John Stratman
The fourth reward I'm excited for is the Cassette Tape 8GB USB Drive. Whether it be Green Day or The Offspring, I love looking over my old tapes but in all honesty they're completely useless and I should probably get rid of them. However, I love the reminder of how technology used to be and so this reward unites old technology and new by turning a cassette tape into a very useful and cool 8GB USB drive. This reward will be a Kickstarter exclusive, with only 20 available at this level and an additional 10 at the Video Game Cover Commission level! Once they're gone, they're gone!
Project Hoax Cassette Tape 8GB USB Drive With Accompanying Case
The fifth and final reward that I'm really excited about is the Video Game Cover Commission. Video games were a big part of my childhood in the 90s and specifically the Sega Mega Drive. When you read Project Hoax, you'll see this love of video games shine through but I wanted to add to this by offering an A5 video game cover commission drawn by our very own, Dan Butcher. And don't forget you'll be getting the Cassette Tape 8GB USB Drive reward as well!
Project Hoax Video Game Cover Commission Example
The way it works is that after the Kickstarter we'll ask you for a photo of the person or anything within reason you want featured on the cover. We'll also ask you what your favourite video game covers are in order for us to come up with a title and look for the game cover. If you love 90s video game covers, and like the idea of having your own game become a reality, then this'll be the reward for you but be aware that there are only 10 available.
£1,400 - EXTRA DIGITAL ISSUES - UNLOCKED
Once the campaign is over I'll send everyone all backers a digital copy of my first comic book, Milford Green, which is about a Victorian alien adventure. I'll also send everyone the first two issues of Dan Butcher's comic, Vanguard, which is about a UK based superhero team.
£1,600 - FEGA & FINTENDO VIDEO GAMES A5 PRINT - UNLOCKED
Along with all of your Project Hoax swag print copy backers (£3) and above will receive an A5 print of the Project Hoax FEGA and FINTENDO covers of both the original cover by Dan Butcher and the 16-bit versions by John Stratman.
£1,800 - PERFECT BOUND UPGRADE - UNLOCKED
This stretch goal will enable us to upgrade the binding of the book from staples (saddle stitched) to perfect bound. Making it a nicer book to look at, hold and store.
£2,000 - 4 EXTRA "BEHIND THE SCENES" PAGES - UNLOCKED
This stretch goal will enable us to add 4 extra "Behind The Scenes" pages to the digital and print book.
£2,200 - 16-BIT GRAPHICS WALLPAPERS & PRINTS - UNLOCKED
As mentioned before, video games were a large part of my childhood in the 90s and so I have a real affinity for 16-bit graphics. With that in mind, if we reach £2,200 we'll be able to have the Project Hoax front cover and the Kickstarter thumbnail recreated in 16-bit graphics. These will then be available for all backers as desktop and phone wallpapers. Plus for print copy backers (£3) and above you'll receive both A4 and A5 prints of the 16-bit cover and Kickstarter thumbnail.
The artist we have on board to do this is John Stratman from the US. If you're a fan of Mr. Sunday Movies on YouTube then you might have come across his work before on their 16 Bit Scenes videos. His most recent video really showcases his art and skills with the final battle from Avengers: Endgame.
16-Bit Graphics by John Stratman
Thanks for reading, and if you have any questions at all please be sure to get in touch, as I'm more than happy to help!
Best wishes and see you on the other side,
Samuel George London
twitter.com/SamuelGLondon

updates.update_userinfo: Project Hoax Prequel In Pipedream Comics Top 50 & Band of Warriors :)
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, hope you've been keeping well?
If you'd have told me a year ago that we'd be in our third lockdown of a pandemic I would have told you to write it down and make it into a horror comic. Unfortunately, it's not a comic, it's reality right now. All that aside though, I do have some good news!
My Project Hoax prequel, Midnight Monster Hunter, which focuses on Sarah's story before the events of Project Hoax, managed to get into the Pipedream Comics Top 50 indie comics of the year. Granted, it was alongside a myriad of other marvellous stories in the Comic Scene Annual but I'm still proud to have been featured twice on the list. I was also ranked at number 47 for . See who else was on the list on the Pipedream website here.

Hello everybody, hope you're well?
First, I've been very busy with work and moving house but all that aside we've now sent out the surveys for Project Hoax!
Secondly, we're eager to get your rewards out to you but before we do, we need everyone's name for the thank you section. With that in mind, if you'd like your name included in the comic please fill out the survey by this Sunday 6th October, as we'll be going to print next week.

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys Sent, Thank You Name Deadline & Defend Milford Green :)
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, long time no speak! I just realised I haven't updated you in a wee-while!
We've finished the comic pages (which look awesome) and we're currently working on the extra "Behind The Scenes" pages. Dan has also completed the video game cover commissions and we're awaiting approval from those backers over the next couple of weeks.
The plan from here is to have the extra pages finished within a couple of weeks and then I'll be able to start ordering the rewards, and then send out reward surveys at the end of the month. Meaning that your rewards will be with you right on time, in October.

Hello everyone, hope you had a nice Monday! Mine was superb because the campaign for Project Hoax finished with 279 backers at 223% funded!
With that in mind, thank you all so much for your support throughout this campaign. Dan and I are really looking forward to getting your rewards out to you by October.
On that note, if you have friends that missed out on the Kickstarter but would still like to get in on the first print run, they can pre-order on the Signal Comics website right here.

Hello everyone, just a quickie!
There are only 6 hours left of the campaign and 2 video game cover commission spots just opened up!
If you'd like to get a custom FEGA VIDEO GAMES cover by our artist, Dan Butcher, as well as all the other goodies including the cassette tape USB drive then act now to avoid disappointment by upgrading your pledge on the campaign page here.

Hello everyone, hope you had a nice weekend! Mine was very good, as we have now reached the dizzy heights of +200% and over 260 backers!
Dan and I are over the moon with the level of support we've had for Project Hoax, so thank you all so much!
Finally, today is the last day of the campaign, so if you haven't shared Project Hoax with your friends either online or offline it'd be greatly appreciated. http://kck.st/31pA8Tl

Hello everyone, hope you've been having a sunny week! It's certainly been sunny this week in my neck of the woods!
First, with only 3 days left of this campaign we're almost at my dream goal of 200%! Thank you all so much for your support!
I think we'll make that goal by Monday but to be sure, if you'd like to help us get there sooner rather than later, please share Project Hoax with your friends online and offline by sending them this link.

project_data.project_name: Project Hoax | A one-shot, all-ages horror comic.

campaign.story:
Hello and welcome! Meet the Dessert Buddies, eight animals who love to bake pastries and prepare pawesome desserts! They can be clumsy and gluttonous sometimes, but everything is made with love in the Dessert Shop that they own! 🐾 
Update: All the Dessert Buddies designs and their color variants have been unlocked! This means that you can choose any of your favorite buddies :D More Kickstarter exclusive freebies have been added as well! Thank you so much for your incredible support!
Why pre-order through Kickstarter? 
All these pins are at their lowest price during this Kickstarter, and will be listed in my shop at their regular price afterwards! You will be charged only at the end of the campaign, and you can modify your pledge (increase, decrease, or cancel) at any moment during the campaign. When the Kickstarter ends, you will receive a survey asking you which design(s) you would like! 
Mock-up with the illustrated backing cards! 🐾

Now let's meet the Dessert Buddies!

Please note that the images are mock-ups and that minor changes may occur during production!
For backers only! Receive this free sticker by spreading the word on Twitter, Facebook OR Instagram! Please directly share the post you will see after clicking on the links! If you share the campaign on Instagram, make sure to tag me in the picture so I don't miss it! (@aliam_vitam)
Please add-on the following amounts to your pledge for each additional item you would like to receive:
New acrylic charm add-on available!
To add-on any item, simply add the listed amount when pledging (if you have already pledged, then click on "Manage my pledge"). For example, if you have selected the reward "Choose 3 pins" and wish to add 2 stickers, you would add-on 4$ to your pledge: 
40$ (3 pins) + 4$ (2 stickers) + shipping = 44$ + shipping
You would then receive 3 pins of your choice, any 1 Cupcake Tier freebie (keychain, paw pin OR lanyard), 2 stickers of your choice AND 1 freebie/random sticker! :D
If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to message me!
Shipping information:
Canada: 2-7 business days
USA: 1-2 weeks
International: 1-4 weeks
These are the estimated shipping times. Please don't hesitate to message me if you have any questions! Tracking is included for shipping to the United States only. (For Canadian and International backers, please contact me about the additional fees if you would like to add tracking to your reward!)


Hello! I'm Danna, the artist behind the Dessert Buddies and the shop Aliam Vitam. I am a digital artist with a love for cute crafts, animals, sweets (who would have guessed!), and anime style art. I have been creating digital art since 2014 and hope to continue sharing my creations and projects with you guys!
Thank you so much for taking the time to read my campaign! Your support of my art, whatever form it takes, means a lot as it gives me more opportunities to do what I am passionate about, and come up with many more projects to make me (and you!) dream 🐾

Previous Kickstarters & Shop
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Please note that colors may not exactly match the ones you see on your screen. However, I will work with my manufacturer to make sure the colors come out beautifully!

Minor adjustments to the designs and delays in production may occur, but I will let you know and keep you posted about any change.

Although these are my first pins, I am confident in my ability to deliver you high quality products, after having done extensive research on them. This is also my third Kickstarter and I will do everything I can to make sure things will go as smoothly as they did in my previous ones. 

I will also inspect all the pins and other goodies to ensure you receive the Dessert Buddies in their best condition!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
