updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
I just wanted to let you know that the pins are here and we have been working hard this past week to sort through the pins, package, and mail your rewards ❤️ Some pictures of the Dessert Buddies will follow, I'm so happy with how they turned out and I really hope you will like yours!! **
All Canadian and USA orders have been mailed out and you should be receiving your package this week or the following one (if not already!)

Hi everyone!!
Some happy and exciting news today: the production is done and the pins are being shipped to me! My manufacturer also sent me some more pictures, including the ones for the cat&penguin buddies! I will be taking and posting pictures of all of the Dessert Buddies when I get the pins (estimated next week!!!) ❤️
I can't thank you enough for your patience and support, the Dessert Buddies are finally almost here! 😻 If your address has changed, please let me know in the backer survey!
Best,

Hi everyone!
I just wanted to give you a small update on the Dessert Buddies! There have unfortunately been some delays with my manufacturer and the pins are still in production. I will be letting you know when there are more news and I am really hoping production can be finished as soon as possible, so you can receive your Dessert Buddies!♥ I am very grateful for your understanding, patience, and support (and as excited and impatient as you are to receive the pins!!) The charms and most stickers/cards have been packaged already, so your reward can be sent out as soon as I receive and sort out the pins💖

updates.update_userinfo: Some Manufacturer Pictures of the Pins!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
I received some pictures from my manufacturer for most of the pins' samples!! :D They are still working on the Kitten Candy and Baked in Alaska (penguin) pins and these should be done soon too! I really hope you like how the Dessert Buddies are turning out ♥
There will be a few minor color adjustments to make the pins look as close as they can to the digital mockups, so that we can deliver you the best products! ^^ This means that production will take a bit longer, but I still think the pins can be shipped to me before mid-September and sent to you in late September-October as expected! Thank you so much for your patience and support ♥

Hi everyone,
The charms and lanyards have arrived earlier than expected!! ♥ You can find some pictures below, I hope you like them as much as I do! Cupcake Tier rewards with charms/lanyards only will be mailed out next week as well, along with the Sticker Tier! ^^
I should be receiving all the manufacturer sample pictures for the pins in the upcoming week, thank you all for your patience and support!! <3

Hi everyone,
I just wanted to give you an update on how things have been progressing! The stickers and backing cards have arrived and I'm super happy with how colorful and pretty they turned out! You can find the pictures below and I hope you like them too ♥ Rewards for the Stickers/Art Prints tier will be mailed out next week!
The charms and lanyards are in production and I should receive them in a week or two. The pins have been in production too since mid-July and I should be getting all the sample pictures soon! :D

Hello everyone!
The campaign has now ended! I am so grateful for all the support and love you have given to these Dessert Buddies!! All the designs and goodies will be produced and I can't be more happy! ♥ I hope you are excited to receive yours :D
We are now getting to the rewards and production steps! Please answer your reward survey as soon as you can, so I can get an idea of the quantity to order for every design! I have already contacted my manufacturer to make samples for the enamel pins in the meantime, and I will be sharing pictures when I get them! :) I will also be keeping you updated with the production progress and shipping!

Hello everyone!
I have two happy announcements today! The freebie sticker is now unlocked and revealed... and the full set of pins is also unlocked!! :D
I am extremely happy and grateful for your support in helping me bring these Dessert Buddies pins and other goodies to life! I hope you are excited to receive yours because I can't wait to send them in production and start packaging your rewards! ♥

Hi everyone!
Some exciting news today: our little bunny ice cream has been unlocked! This means that we only have one last design to unlock for the full set, with still over 2 weeks to the campaign! :D The Dessert Buddies and me would like to say a HUGE thank you for your incredible support so far--you guys are amazing!! ♥
I've also decided to add 2 new FREEBIE stretch goals! They will be free stickers for all backers (they are made of waterproof, scratch-resistant vinyl! :D)

campaign.story:
Sneaky Goblins at College is a 40-page full-colour comic with three awesome fantasy-adventure stories...
And we're funded! Thanks so much to everyone who has backed my project! You're the best!
We've already unlocked two stretch goals-- see below for more!
Get a free PDF comic here: www.tolcraft.com/free
This book includes 3 fun fantasy stories:
Goblins at College
Dank and Sophie were students at Fitch's Academy for Young Assassins. Dank always struggled with the practical aspects of the course, but he wasn’t always great with the book-learning, either. How did he get his grades up and what gave him the passion to do it?
How do you make that poison again?
Bog the Orc
Bog might be a giant, beefy orc with decent mutton chops, but he never quite fit in. What kind of orc leaves his tribe and strikes out alone in this wild and dangerous world? This short comic reveals all. 
It's... complicated.
Stop the Dragon
Dank, Bog and Sonya the Wizard arrive in a small town, hounded by a terrible menace: a greedy, fire-breathing dragon! They'd rather avoid a fight, but they are quickly drawn into the town's nightmare. They'll need to work together to defeat a foe more powerful than any of them have faced before! 
After a long journey, you need some R&R!

The three stories in this comic are based around the characters found in my graphic novel, Sneaky Goblins. What’s that you say-- you haven’t read it yet? Don’t worry about it, you can enjoy the book even without reading the original. Besides, every pledge level AU$15 and up gets a PDF of the original graphic novel.  
The vanilla cover plus two limited-edition variant covers. Check below for full details about all reward levels!
So whether you’re a die-hard Sneaky Goblins fan, or you’re checking out my comics for the first time, I hope you have as much fun reading this comic as I did making it.
Bog vows to spread the good name of orc-kind.
Here's what they're saying about my first Kickstarter project, the original Sneaky Goblins graphic novel:
Sneaky Goblins is a delightfully fast and funny fantasy adventure. It’s packed with incredible creatures, lovable underdog characters, and it transforms all the familiar Lord of the Rings-style quest tropes into something really fresh and engaging.
-Lucas Testro, The Radioactive Lounge podcast, Ep 109. 
This comic excels in the character design. The design for Dank and Bog passes the silhouette test, they’re interesting characters to look at. The set-up, the character design, the world-building- it’s all there. You should definitely go check out Sneaky Goblins, it’s a really fun comic! 
-Jason Sigler, Digital Strips Podcast, Ep 517.
Samwise Didier
Sneaky Goblins is a fun read and I love the characters. Glad Bog was able to somewhat get his hand back - an orc mage is a fun character. Now I'm looking forward to the mecha-ape invasion!
-Samwise Didier, art director

But it's not just for grown-ups! Did you know kids love Sneaky Goblins too?! 
Some beaut shots sent in by proud parents all over the world!
Hi! I'm René: creator, writer and artist of Sneaky Goblins at College. 
 I was a character animator at Disneytoon Studios and a storyboard artist at Southern Star Entertainment. I'm also a compulsive comic creator! I've chipped in to a number of different comic anthologies and webcomics. 
Some of the films, TV and magazines I've worked on.
I've always loved drawing and telling stories. Making this book was a labor of love, and I hope that comes through as you read it. 
So why did I write Sneaky Goblins at College?
Every one of these stories has a special meaning for me, and each is built around a theme that goes to the heart of who I am and where I've come from...
Goblins at College Have you ever had a passion and then lost it somewhere along the way? When I worked in an animation studio, I was super-motivated to progress to the department that would give me the greatest capacity for expression and the best use of my skills. Trouble was, once I got there, I discovered the new role was a massive step up! The work became overwhelming and I quickly lost the drive to rise to the challenge. I wish I had someone like Sophie to drag me through the difficulty and help me remember what I loved about animation in the first place.
Bog the Orc is a story about an outsider. Even though I'm part of the majority Anglo culture here in my native Australia, growing up I always felt a bit on the outside. When I was a child in the 80s, it wasn't cool to like drawing or comics or video games. Being an introvert didn't help either. Bog eventually has to leave his home, but now he has a chance to step out and be the orc he was meant to be!
A rare sighting of young René at the beach.
Stop the Dragon is a good old fantasy Dungeons and Dragons- style fantasy romp, but the character I most identify with is the elderly priest who just wants some peace and security for his monastery. Priests in the fantasy genre are often portrayed as self-serving and manipulative. For once I wanted a man of the cloth who was straight down the line: no machinations, no ulterior motive: just straight -up concerned for the safety of the town. 
If you'd like to know more about what makes me tick as a creator, here's a short video documentary about me and my work:
Over the last year, I've been making and posting the pages of this comic on my weekly webcomic: www.tolcraft.com. Now the three stories are complete, and it's time to print the book! With your help, I'd love to make this book a reality, and get it into the hands of readers like you.
· 40 pages plus cover  
· full colour  
· Perfect bound 
· Cover: 105lbs (It'll feel sturdier than your average floppy comic book)
· Interior paper: 70lbs
· Size: 6.625 x 10.25in. (Standard Image book size)
Why Kickstarter?  
This comic book is 100% complete and ready for print! All I have to do after the campaign is make the Thank You page and then send it off to the printer.
My process for making a comic page: from rough sketch, to inks, to final colours!
The amount raised will all go to funding an offset print run of 1000 copies of the comic. Copies of the comic left over after the campaign will be stock that I can sell at comic conventions, libraries and book shops.
I've come to Kickstarter to help get this book into as many hands as possible, and I'd love your support to bring it to life.
Let's have a peek inside!
Want more? Get a sample PDF of the comic here: www.tolcraft.com/free
What will the funds be used for? 
I'm only on Kickstarter to print the book and get them out to all of my wonderful backers! I'm not trying to make money or reimburse myself for any of the time I spent making the comic itself. 
The whole amount raised will go back into the book, the rewards, and  shipping it out safely to you:
  Here's what you get in each pledge level... with pictures!

 Here's some more of those signed sketches included in the AU$50 level and above:
Some sketch page reward examples.
 Click here to check out the Pinterest board for more examples: The Kickstarter Pinterest board
 And what kind of kickstarter would this be without...
You should have your books by the end of November 2019. 
I plan on sending the final book files to to the printer as soon as the funds come through from Kickstarter (about 2 weeks after the campaign ends).
Printing will take a couple of months- at the most. I also want to have a buffer just in case there is a delay at any stage.
I'll be packing and shipping the books from Melbourne, Australia.
Thanks so much for checking out my campaign. I'm really excited about making this book and I'd love for you to be involved. Choose a pledge and lock in your copy now.
Cheers, René
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After successfully running my first Kickstarter last year, I have a good understanding of the demands and potential pitfalls involved in this kind of project. 
The comic is totally finished - it's ready to go to press! 
The biggest risk is an unforeseen delay in printing and shipping out to me in Melbourne, Australia, and the fulfillment centre in Chicago, USA. That's why I've built in a buffer in the delivery schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New comic project Kickstarter NOW LIVE!
updates.update_content:
So pumped right now! :D
A couple hours ago I hit launch on another fantasy-adventure comic book kickstarter, Mythic Creature Trainer, and we're off to a rocking start!
MCT is a whole new story, but very much in the same vein as Sneaky Goblins. In fact, it starts out in the same city as Filtch's School for Young Assassins, so watch out! You might find an aspiring hit-goblin or two in the background.
CHECK OUT THE CAMPAIGN PAGE

...ahead of schedule!
After getting the maps and prints back, it's time to mail out some comics!

updates.update_userinfo: Books arrive and a limited Patreon offer!
updates.update_content:
This has to be my second favourite part of a Kickstarter (after funding, of course)...
the books arrived!

Hey folks,
please check your Kickstarter messages today to get your digital rewards!
You'll find a message from me with a link to a Dropbox folder where you'll get your PDFs, as well as all the other goodies I promised along the way: earlybird backer bonus, stretch goals, etc.
This Kickstarter is done! In the Bag! All wrapped up!

OK, it's close enough, so I'm gonna call it:
with just 12 hours left it's time unlock our second stretch goal...
And reveal a third!

Boom! With just one day to go, we've just busted through our first stretch goal!
Now every backer gets a PDF comic from 4 awesome independent creators... 
...and a new stretch goal has been revealed!
Casey requested I draw a couple of  elves in a Muay Thai fight.

Update:  Hey everyone! Just wanted to clear up since someone recently asked, all of the cuties pins are unlocked and available for you to choose :) Thanks so much!
Terrarium, Aquarium, or Planetarium....!
Hey everyone! I'm back with some new additions to my terrarium cuties! I will also be remaking my original terrarium cuties, which have sold out! 
Here are all the designs! 
The pins!  
They will be 1.75", pretty big pins! With 2 rubber clutches, and copper metal (except witch cutie, who will have black metal and glow in the dark). I will ask everyone which they want at the end of the kickstarter through the surveys :) Join the cutie brigade to help me get them made! Grab one or collect them all :D
Here is how the original 3 cuties pins turned out, last year: 
Shipping + Timeline 
After the kickstarter, I will order the cuties! If everything goes smoothly the pins should get to me in early July. But the more pledges there are I can afford the faster shipping time on them, so July is the absolute latest! Then I will place them snuggly in bubble mailers and send them off to you! There will be no backing cards to keep prices a little lower!
campaign.risks:

campaign.story:
TWITTER                TUMBLR                INSTAGRAM               FACEBOOK
Paul Krutcher has a little problem with gravity, but his status as the only flying human on Earth is short-lived when soon the entire human race joins him in the sky! Welcome to a Bizarre New World.
Nine years in the making, the entire 278 page story is now complete and available for the very first time. The main book is a self-contained graphic novel with a definitive ending.
You don't have to take my word for it that the book is great, go read some BEFORE you become a backer. Just click on this link for a FREE 22 page preview:
http://bizarrenewworld.com/preview.html
Also available separately is the 225 page Bizarre New World Anthology featuring 50 contributors from across the globe further exploring the Bizarre flying world in 28 short stories!
Take a free spin through some FREE complete stories now at this private link:
http://www.fracturedentertainment.com/#!the_brewery/c1pwt 
(CLICK ABOVE TO SEE THE ORIGINAL ART!)
(MOCK UP DESIGN PROPOSAL)
OWN AN EXCLUSIVE COPY WITH YOU ON THE COVER!
FROM WRITER / CREATOR SKIPPER MARTIN:
This entire 9 year endeavor exists because of the extremely talented artists and writers who helped me create it. As I said in the video, you don't need to trust me this project is worth your money. Please go to my main homepage and try some of the book out for free before becoming a backer. I hope you enjoy what you see and help support my not-so-little passion project.
Fly high!
Skipper Martin
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only real risk is printer and shipping problems, but I've done thorough research on both fronts and feel confident I can get the rewards into the hands of the gracious people who choose to back me. I've worked very hard since 2008 to make this ambitious project a totally completed endeavor so there wouldn't be any unnecessary risks passed on to the reader. There's no dreaded "TO BE CONTINUED!" waiting for you at the end of this book. There's also no waiting for contributors. Both the Main Book and the Anthology are entirely complete and ready for printing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:
Skipper Martin
First created · 33 backed
Skipper Martin is the writer / creator behind Bizarre New World. Joining forces with Goblin Chronicles creator Troy Dye, they've launched...See more

updates.update_userinfo: Buy Bizarre New World PDFs now.
updates.update_content:
Obviously thanks to the many people who really gave it their all to help push this campaign to the masses. This endeavor didn’t fail for lack of trying that’s for sure.
In the short term, I want to reward you the backers for your wonderful support. To that end I’m making available immediately both the Main Book and Anthology for inexpensive PDF purchase. Simply head to this link to buy whatever you like, then you’ll be directed to a download page:

Time for brutal honesty. If the campaign continues as it's going, we're not going to reach our funding goal. 
BUT we've still got 10 days to go, so now is the time to course correct if it's at all possible. In that spirit, we have a plan. In an effort to reach our base goal of $15,000 we're now offering a Print On Demand version of the Anthology. Unfortunately printing it this way makes the Anthology book a bit more expensive at $35, but now it means BOTH books are available in PRINT.

updates.update_userinfo: Reminder: New Original Art Rewards go live in 2 hours.
updates.update_content: Skipper Martin here. Thank you for your early support of Bizarre New World. I’ll say it again because it bears repeating: THANK YOU! It’s been a long nine years putting this book together. To say there were a lot of ups and downs would be an understatement. I tried walking away, but I wanted to finish what I started, even if it took me the rest of my natural life. Thankfully it only took nearly a decade! Seeing this book in print is the final step on my quest to complete Bizarre New World. I’m honored that you’re accompanying me on the last leg of my journey.

project_data.project_name: Bizarre New World - THE HUMAN RACE CAN FLY!

campaign.story:
"Like Father, Like Daughter" is about a teenage girl whose father left her at a young age to become a full time superhero. She has to deal with seeing her father everywhere and the world loving him while she views him in his true colors as a man who abandoned his true responsibilities.
This is just the “elevator pitch” for what will happen in the series. There are a lot of twist and turns as the series continues.
This comic puts the superhero genre on its head. It pokes fun at comic book tropes and has a lot of comic book references. But at the same time it tells a unique and grounded story.
55% of the money earned from this campaign will go towards paying the artist who worked on this project so far to finish the project. 30% will go towards printing of the project and 15% will go towards fulfilling rewards to backers.
Of course this project has plenty of rewards for our backers at various tiers. Basic Reward Tiers are listed to the right while "Big" Rewards are listed below
 While we would be happy to reach our funding goal we have also planned out various stretch goals.
My name is Kat and I am the writer for “Like Father, Like Daughter” AND host of the YouTube show “Comic Uno” where I have been doing comic book reviews for a variety of titles since 2010.
Check out my YouTube Channel here:
https://www.youtube.com/user/haydenclaireheroes
 Short Fuse Media Group, LLC. is the production company that created the visuals for this project and will serve as the publisher for this title .
 To everyone who supports this project in any way, shape or form. We have worked many months on this project so far and look forward to seeing it through to completion with your help. We truly appreciate your support!!!
 http://kickingitforward.org/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've attempted to manage all of the risks associated with this project by doing most of the leg work before this campaigns launch from selecting the right artists and negotiating rates with various production houses for items that we cannot produce in-house. 

We will consistently update backers and supporters with any issues that may potentially cause delays in the completion of this project and make the necessary adjustments to resolve those matters quickly and efficiently so we can get back to the fun part.....making comics!!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Follow Us on Kickstarter for MORE Awesome Projects!!! #WeAlwaysDeliver
updates.update_content:
We have a roster of AWESOME creators and are always preparing a new project for release. The benchmark on new releases that we set for ourselves is to ensure that we have done the bulk of the fulfillment on ANY of our previous campaigns before launching a new campaign. So our hope is that if you like the content that we release, that you'll follow us on Kickstarter so that you notified every time we launch a new project!!!  
With that said, we have a new campaign running right now for our first collected trade of Like Father, Like Daughter. The story is about a teenage girl whose father left her at a young age to become a full time superhero. She has to deal with seeing her father everywhere and the world loving him while she views him in his true colors as a man who abandoned his true responsibilities.

We're closing out 2017 with an AWESOME campaign for our comic book series Vigilance. The campaign is currently 177% FUNDED with 18 days left to go and we want to reach a Milestone Goal of 200 backers. While there are a ton of GREAT rewards on this campaign, we're offering a $1.00 Reward that will garner you digital copies of ANY 4 titles in our online catalog. Oh...and if you back the campaign at any of the higher tiers, this reward is still included. Rewards are to begin shipping the week the campaign ends!!! Check out the campaign !!!

updates.update_userinfo: Like Father, Like Daughter #4 Campaign is LIVE!!!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Hope everyone is having a good year so far. We're starting off our year with a Kickstarter for issue #4 of our Like Father, Like Daughter series and we would greatly appreciate your support to keep the story going! You can check out the campaign here! 
We have a ton of AWESOME rewards to go around and we are excited for this issue as it wraps up the first story arc in the series. One of our favorite rewards for this campaign (Make 100) even gives you the first opportunity to check out a new series with a brand new issue #1, from the series creator of Like Father, Like Daughter. As an added bonus this reward has even been sponsored by the comic book retail chain, Comic City, as they liked the series so much they offered to add a "Guaranteed Value" incentive to the reward that includes 20 Randomly selected comics to ensure that you enjoy your reward package without exception.

updates.update_userinfo: Like Father, Like Daughter #3 On Sale Now!!!
updates.update_content:
Hey Folks,

Like Father, Like Daughter #3 is now available for purchase in our online store! We have been fortunate enough to have your support on previous issues and we're closing in on wrapping the first story arc!

In this EPIC issue, Casey heroically intervenes in a dangerous situation involving school bullying then comes face to face with her father Invulnerable for the first time in 10 years!!!
PLAY

updates.update_content:
By now everyone should have received their rewards so we just want to thank you all again for backing Comic Uno and Short Fuse Media with our first release, "Like Father, Like Daughter".
We are working on the plan for issue #2 now and will communicate developments on that to you as soon as possible. But fear not as you can also check out a new project that we just launched with more dynamic writing from Comic Uno as we move into an entire new universe that YOU can be a part of called Legacy Code!

Hey Guys,
Just a heads up to all of the backers that received the "Like Father, Like Daughter" CD Rom, the disc was formatted as a "data disc" so the best way to access the files would be to download them to your computer. The pin ups that are on the disc can be accessed easily from the disc (for printing or whatever you choose to do with them....they're yours afterall), but if you want to watch the "Thank You" video we would suggest that you download that file directly to your computer for the best viewing.

campaign.story:
THE PROJECT
New Comic Day The 5 Year Journey is a collection of the first 5 years of the award winning webcomic! 
For 5 years now we've been posting New Comic Day every wednesday over on Newcomicday.net and Comicrelated.com and when the 5th anniversary hit we wanted to do something big. We've been planning this hardcover for a while now and wanted to bring it directly to kickstarter to bring it to life.
Over 275 strips have been produced by 3 different artists during the 5 years of the project.(We even had Phil Hester help us with our April fools strip back in year 1)
The hardcover itself is 152 full color pages, filled with 5 years worth of New Comic Day strips, a forward by Hack/Slash creator Tim Seeley, a cover gallery and a 2 page back up origin story for Minion.
We will also have the option to buy the first volume of the New Comic Day comic, which is 48 full pages of content with no adds and full annotations of our creative process.
Some examples of what you can expect from the hardcover:
YEAR 1
From arguing over things at the comic shop...
...to borrowing a certain vehicle.
 YEAR 2
Jumping sharks...
Ticking off superheroes...
 YEAR 3
And some super villians too
Going on some bad dates...
 YEAR 4
To making new "friends"
Going on epic quests!
 YEAR 5!
Meeting your idols...
To gaining power beyond your wildest imagination.
 New Comic Day truly has it all. And all these adventures plus 265 other strips can be yours if you support the project! It's absolutely our goal to make this the best hardcover you could possibly imagine and our goal is to order 500 copies for a first print run.
During the run of the project I'll be updating a few times a week with previews of art that will be found in the book, the t-shirt art and more!
WHERE DOES ALL THE MONEY GO:
All money raised on the project is focused on making the hardcover book the best it can possibly be as well as fulfilling all incentives on the project from prints to the individual comic volumes depending on pledge level.
We plan on ordering 500 copies of the Hardcover to start with but that number could change depending on how many people we have pledge of course.
5,000 goes towards creating the hardcover book with a slipcase and shipping and handling (the book itself is about 4,500 and the shipping and handling is almost 500)
The shirts are between 300 and 400 dollars to print.
Copies of New Comic Day volume 1 will run about 200 dollars
And then prints of the individual strips as well as shipping and handling costs to send everything out cover the rest of the costs. (As well as the 10 percent that Kickstarter/credit cards take)

THE CREATORS:
Left to right: Chad Strohl (artist of the first 3 years), Lisa Moore, Eric Ratcliffe, Bill Gladman, Brant Fowler
Jim Gallo, artist on year 4!
 http://jimgallo.com/home/ - Jim's official website
George Amaru (artist on year 5 and current artist) as well as Eric.
 http://georgeamaru.weebly.com/ - George's official website!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The most obvious one is this; if we don’t reach our goal the book doesn’t get made. Obviously your card wouldn’t be charged and that would be it. 

There’s also the possibility of shipping delays. The printer we’ve chosen does their printing overseas so there’s the possibility of the delay in arrival.

Other than those 2 specific risks and challenges, there aren’t any others. Brant has already started working on the layouts for the individual volumes as well as the books so we’re expecting to have the book to you guys as soon as possible. (Not to mention that I will be updating the project whenever I can)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:
Eric Jason Ratcliffe
First created · 61 backed
I am the co-creator, writer and one of the stars of New Comic Day. Back in 2009 I convinced my co-creator Bill Gladman to create the strip...See more

updates.update_userinfo: Update - We weren't funded but that's not the end!
updates.update_content:
Right now we're planning on what to do next. Instead of a hardcover we're planning to do 5 individual comic volumes at a smaller price point and deciding on whether or not we'll try crowd funding again. (Whether it be here or another site)
We'll keep you updated as we move forward!
Thanks for all the awesome support guys!

For the first 3 years of New Comic Day, we were very lucky to work with Chad Strohl. He really made the strip stronger at moments and managed to fix punchlines to certain strips.
That being said during that second year Chad did a piece that hasn't seen the light of day yet. It was an homage to a certain X-event that just like his secret wars cover managed to impress the hell out of all of us.

Hey guys, great first day for the kickstarter. If I'm doing my math right we're already at 6 percent on day 1 which is beyond great.
For a first update I wanted to first thank all of you and give you a tease of one of the first big art pieces that'll be in the book at the beginning of year four and that's a very rough draft of Jim Gallo's piece for the book:

project_data.project_name: New Comic Day The 5 Year Journey!

campaign.story:
A version of our video with CLOSED CAPTIONS is available here.
Jul 1 - FINAL ADD-ON REWARDS IN UPDATE 26: For our final 24 hours, we've added limited edition DODOcases, Picnic Blankets, downloadable episodes of the original series and a live online event with Donald Glover & LeVar... from a boat!
   Jun 27 - MORE HUGE NEWS IN UPDATE 22: We've entered the Top 5 Kickstarter Projects... and the other four (Pebble, OUYA, Pono, Veronica Mars) have ALL offered special new rewards to help us get into more schools! Read more now!
Important updates, in case you missed them:
STRETCH GOALS #1: What we can do if we reach $5,000,000!
T-SHIRT DESIGNS: Three limited-edition designs to choose from! 
ADD-ON REWARDS: Instructions for adding more rewards!
ORIGINAL DVDs: Now available as reward add-ons!
Hi. LeVar Burton here. You may know me as Kunta Kinte, from ROOTS, or Geordi La Forge, from Star Trek: The Next Generation. 
You also may have grown up with me on Reading Rainbow. 
It was my mother who taught me that, by picking up a book, I could "go anywhere" and "be anything." Ever since Reading Rainbow began in 1983, I have dedicated myself to fostering a love of reading in children, just as my mother did for me. 
Over the past year, I have watched Kickstarter bring communities together to support artists and inventors. Again and again, I have been inspired by watching like-minded people team up to accomplish impossible dreams, and to change the world. 
Now, I am hoping you will join me on my mission: to bring Reading Rainbow back for every child, everywhere.
Together, we can change the lives of millions of children. But you don't have to take my word for it: just keep reading!
I believe that every child has a right, and a need, to be literate. We have a responsibility to prepare our children… and right now, the numbers show that we, as a society, are failing in that responsibility.
And here’s the problem:
And: numerous studies reveal that children who can't read at grade level by the 4th grade are 400% more likely to drop out of high school.
And: as of 2011, America was the only free-market country where the current generation was less well educated than the one before.
These problems won't solve themselves.  Real change will require us all to work together. We cannot afford to lose generations of children to illiteracy. And if we work together, we don't have to.
Through Reading Rainbow, we've been working to solve these problems for over three decades. Starting in 1983, Reading Rainbow successfully used television to turn generations of kids into lifelong readers... with great results.
Of course, when Reading Rainbow began in 1983, we were using television to bring books to kids, meeting them where they wanted to be. In 2014, TV is not that place anymore. Now, we’re trying to reach a new generation of digital natives.
That’s why, two years ago, I launched the Reading Rainbow App for tablets. Building on the basics of the television series, we put hundreds of quality books – and educational video field trips – right in a child’s hands.
The response has been encouraging:
But despite this progress, there are big challenges left to face.
First, not all families have access to tablets. Our goal is to cultivate a love of reading in all children, not just those that have tablets. To reach kids everywhere, we need to be everywhere: we need to be on the web, on mobile devices, on game consoles and on connected televisions. 
Second, a resounding number of teachers have told me that they want Reading Rainbow in their classrooms, where they know it can make a difference. We will provide it, along with the tools that teachers need, including teacher guides, leveling, and dashboards. And with your help, we'll provide it to thousands of disadvantaged classrooms for FREE.
Every Home. Reading Rainbow’s digital collection already contains hundreds of books and video field trips… but with your help, we’ll be able to make the Reading Rainbow library available on more of the devices modern kids use to consume content. Now that we've met our initial goal of $1,000,000, we will be able to launch a new version of Reading Rainbow on the single most-used digital platform: the web. And now that we've reached our stretch goal of$5,000,000, we'll also be able to bring the service to mobile phones, Android, game consoles like XBOX and PlayStation, and set-top boxes like AppleTV and ROKU.
Every Classroom. Together, we want to provide Reading Rainbow to as many classrooms as possible FOR FREE! Now that we've reached our stretch goal of $5,000,000, we'll be able to provide year-long subscriptions in over 7,500 classrooms – and every additional $100K we raise lets us help 500 more!
No matter how much we raise, we promise that every dollar you pledge will bring Reading Rainbow to more platforms, and provide it for free in more classrooms.
We can make sure that millions of kids learn to love reading, but we can’t do it without you. That's why I hope you’ll join me in making a difference!
I believe that spreading the love of reading is its own greatest reward. But if you're going to join our cause, we also have some wonderful prizes. But you don't have to take my word for it... Take a look!
Aside from the signed book, the rewards above will be available to anyone who pledges! 
But we also have several LIMITED EDITION rewards... so be sure to get them before we run out! (And if we DO run out, keep checking back -- we'll do our best to add more when we can!)
Or, if you prefer, you can also pledge for a reward package that will be gifted to the classroom or school of your choice!
And, if you're just interested in Star Trek related rewards, and don't want all of the Reading Rainbow goodies above, we've also got a few special reward levels created just for you:
This Kickstarter – and Reading Rainbow – couldn't happen alone, so I want you to meet the full team behind our Kickstarter.
Everytime I walk into the office, I am reminded that the Reading Rainbow team is made up of passionate, talented artists, producers, engineers, and so many more. Most of them grew up on the show, have families of their own now, and dedicate their working day to improving the lives of the next generation.  
It's an honor to be surrounded by my Reading Rainbow family every day, and we can't wait for you to join us. And if you do, you'll be hearing from several of us throughout the campaign, and after that, in our backer updates. Click on the picture below to learn more about us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The real risks and challenges we face don't lie in completing this project, but in the problems that we'll face without it.

If we raise our minimum funding goal, we do not anticipate ANY significant challenges or risks in completing the project.

As with all Kickstarter projects, there is always a risk of delay in delivering some of the rewards, but we've been careful to give ourselves MORE time than we think we'll need – so we hope we'll have some, or all, of the rewards out SOONER than listed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
This has been such an INCREDIBLE year!
One year ago, we were getting ready to hit “GO!” on the Reading Rainbow Kickstarter campaign. The Reading Rainbow team huddled around computers, and watched closely as EVERY SINGLE ONE OF YOU pledged in support of our mission. Our dream has always been to instill a passion for reading and show children how they can experience the fun of learning through the world of literature.

updates.update_userinfo: Reading Rainbow Donates Skybrary School to 3,500 Classrooms at the National Title 1 Conference
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers, 
What a truly incredible whirlwind of a year it has been for us. We are so thankful and humbled for all of the new opportunities and doors that have opened for us thanks to Y-O-U contributing to our massive Kickstarter campaign! We have some very exciting February news to share and want you to be one of the FIRST to know! 
As part of bringing Reading Rainbow to “Every Child, Every Where”, we PARTNERED WITH YOUTUBE and their all-new kid-friendly video platform, to bring an exclusive Video Field Trip series to our children. Reading Rainbow’s series is designed to do for kids and technology today what the Classic Reading Rainbow series did for kids and reading 32 years ago: to make science and technology. In this brand new series Reading Rainbow plans to address technology ranging from electric toothbrushes to the Mars Rover, from kids and computers to space travel—and we’ll do it all in a way that makes technology exciting and easy for kids to understand!

project_data.project_name: Bring Reading Rainbow Back for Every Child, Everywhere!

campaign.story:
Table Titans is an ongoing online comic by Scott Kurtz that chronicles the adventures of Val Bronzebottom and her friends Alan, Andrew, and Darby as they embark on adventures at and away from the gaming table. The comic started in January 2013 and is currently in its second season. The purpose of this Kickstarter is to collect the first season of Table Titans into an elegant KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE hardcover book, for our fans who have shown us amazing support over the debut of our comic and for anyone who has just discovered us!
Table Titans celebrates the stories and memories we create with our friends while role-playing and is a love letter to the greatest role-playing game of all time, Dungeons and Dragons.
WHAT IF I'VE NEVER PLAYED D&D... OR ANY OTHER ROLEPLAYING GAME?! WILL I STILL LIKE THIS COMIC??
If you like high adventure, swords and sorcery, action, drama, comics, laughing and a whole lot of fun then Table Titans is for you! It DOESN'T MATTER if you've played D&D! No... seriously, it doesn't matter but don't be surprised if you makes you want to try it out! Whether you're a hardened RPG vet, a casual reader with a slight interest in the game, or if you think the whole thing is plain hooey, Table Titans, or any roleplaying game, is about telling good stories!
 TELL ME MORE ABOUT THIS BOOK!
Table Titans Volume 1: First Encounters is already finished and ready to print. In fact, If you like, you can go read the entire story right now online! Table Titans has already started its second major storyline, with a new page being posted online every Tuesday and Thursday.
Table Titans Volume 1: First Encounters collects season one of the Dungeons and Dragons inspired webcomic in print for the first time! This will be an oversized, full-color, action packed adventure featuring KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE cover treatment. That's right, the retail editions of Table Titans Volume 1: First Encounters will look completely different than the Kickstarter editions and you can only get the Kickstarter editions by being a backer!
When we first started the comic a year ago we had no idea the outpouring of love we'd receive from fans of the comic. Ever since we wrapped up the first season we've been getting asked about a print edition. So much so that it became clear to us that we NEEDED to Kickstart this book. Because alone we could print these comics but TOGETHER we can make a tome worthy of our fans!
UMMM... THAT BOOK LOOKS PRETTY NORMAL, HARDLY A "TOME" WORTH OF MY ILLUSTRIOUS BOOKSHELF!
Notice that "Designs Not Final" asterisk at the bottom there? That's because the book isn't designed yet. You see, if we'd done a design it's be a good book but with your help we can make it a great book. Our very first stretch goal features book design by the award-winning designer of the Scott Pilgrim and Sixth Gun series, Keith Wood!
UPDATE: Standard Edition Mockup from Keith Wood! (not-final)
Because our backers are amazing we funded almost immediately and got Keith started right away. He's already sent us a 3D mockup of the Standard Edition book! Please note that the art is not final but this is very close to what the cover and interior design will look like. We're hoping to have a mockup of the Deluxe Edition soon!
UPDATE: Deluxe Edition Concept Mockup from Keith Wood! (not-final)
Keith is on FIRE! We just got the concept of the Deluxe Edition and we're floored. It's a little hard to see in pics but that's PURPLE FAUX LEATHER with GOLD FOIL. Keith is also planning on adding lots of intricate details to the cover in the form of effects, deboss, and emboss, but they're not worked into the design yet. More pics coming 
WHOA, REALLY?!
Yeah, and it only gets better from there. With your help we can fill the books with extras, bonus content, and special features. Every penny we make from the Kickstarter will be going right back into the books.
BONUS CONTENT AND EXTRAS! LIKE WHAT? ELABORATE!!!
Well, we don't want to reveal all our goals at once but you might have noticed that there's a lot of content on the Table Titans website other than the comic. After all, the comic is inspired by a game. Plus, with Keith Wood potentially designing the book who knows what kinda crazy KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE cover treatments he's going to put in there. These books can only get better! We KNOW our fans can make this book amazing, let's turn Table Titans Volume 1: First Encounters from a one night adventure into a year long campaign.
SOUNDS GREAT, I LOVE BOOKS, BUT TELL ME ABOUT ALL THE OTHER LOOT!
OH HO! Adventurers after all, eh?! Well don't worry, we've got you covered with KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE tee-shirts, dice bags, even a 5" vinyl figure of Val the Barbarian, and for those Pinny Arcade collectors out there we've got a special pin just for you!
We're so fortunate to get to work directly with the folks at WeLoveFine.com and almost all of our rewards are being produced by them. Everything is in the design/prototype stages right now but we'll be posting updates, pics, and final versions on our backer blog so backers will get to see the whole process as it happens! 
I'M READY FOR ADVENTURE!
HUZZAH and thank you! Take a gander at the Reward Table below and back our book on the right. Together we're going to make an amazing book and a fantastic piece of art. Chose your rewards wisely and remember: "Titans never say die!"
 Scott Kurtz is an Eisner and Harvey award-winning cartoonist who helped pioneer online comics with his daily strip series Player vs Player, as well as a lifelong D&D player. Scott has been drawing in the margins of his character sheets for nearly thirty years. His love of art led him to devote his life to cartooning, but it was his love of storytelling that led him to create Table Titans.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks when publishing and producing product. Fortunately, we've got two of the biggest and best companies in print and merchandising taking care of all the manufacturing and shipping: Breadpig and WeLoveFine

"Breadpig is a sidekick-for-hire, offering a variety of handholding services to creators..." If you've backed any of the top comic or publishing Kickstarters recently chances are pretty high that they were supported by the fantastic folks at Breadpig. They've helped out with powerhouse projects like: Bee and PuppyCat, To Be Or Not To Be: That Is The Adventure, Atomic Robo, and SCIENCE: Ruining Everything Since 1543 (an SMBC Collection).
http://breadpig.com/

We Love Fine is one of the best known and respected merchandisers for pop culture brands internationally. They produce the merch for all our favorite stuff including: Adventure Time, Legend of Kora, Star Wars, Star Trek, TMNT, and Invader Zim.
And of course they currently make all the merch for both PvP and Table Titans!
http://www.welovefine.com/328-player-vs-player

campaign.story:
Thank you for backing Hi-Fi Color for Comics. This project was 100% funded in only 12 days. On this final day all but one of the stretch goals are unlocked. Choose your favorite reward and pledge today to help unlock the final Stretch Goal!
You probably have a few art instruction books in your collection and I bet you found some more useful than others. Some books talk at great length about art and can be quite interesting. Other books show the author creating amazing illustrations but don’t always give you the information you need to achieve similar results. The most helpful art instruction books don’t merely talk about art, or show you art, they teach you how to create something you could not have achieved before owning the book. Hi-Fi Color for Comics provides you with step-by-step tutorials and artwork teaching you how to color comic book illustrations from start to finish.
What exactly will you learn in the book?
IMPORTING and FORMATTING artwork
Whether you want to scan and color traditional artwork or color artwork created digitally this section of the book will show you exactly how to prep your pages for color using the provided template.
TOOLS & TECHNIQUES
New to comic coloring? You will learn how to use the tools and techniques needed to complete the tutorials in the book.
HI-Fi 1-2-3 AUTOMATION makes it easy
The included Hi-Fi scripts & actions simplify the technical aspects of coloring so you can focus on being creative.
Automated page set-up to start coloring quickly
Magically prep your page for special effects
Push button color separations with trapping for professional results
FLAT COLOR
Step-by-step tutorials show you how how to easily break down images into areas of flat color. Learn tool tricks that will save you time and learn how to use Adobe Photoshop Channels to give you unlimited undo’s when coloring. You can even follow along with the provided comic book artwork.
RENDERED COLORTutorials teaching you how to render backgrounds, exteriors and interiors, ground & sky, vehicles, and figures using cut-n-grad and cut-n-brush techniques. You will learn how to Paint with light the Hi-Fi way. Including new rendering tutorials featuring artwork by legendary comic creator J. Scott Campbell that you can follow along with and color yourself.
COLOR HOLDS
Knockout color holds quickly using the included Hi-Fi actions and easy to learn techniques. Learn how to apply color holds to add depth and dimension to your artwork.
SPECIAL EFFECTS
Make fire effects, flares, sparkles, glows, muzzle blasts, warp effects, and more. Learn how you can create special effects images once to use over and over again. See special effects applied to actual published artwork. 
COLOR SEPARATIONS
Need to convert to CMYK color for commercial printing? The included Hi-Fi color settings and 1-2-3 Automation™ scripts make it easier than ever to achieve professional results.
PRO ARTWORK
The artwork for Hi-Fi Color for Comics continues to come in from amazing comic book creators. Here is a list of current contributors.
Terry Moore - Strangers in Paradise 
Craig Rousseau - The Perhapanauts 
Katie Cook - Gronk 
Mike Worley - Image's Big Bang Comics 
Joe Quesada & Dani Miki - Spider-Man 
Mike Norton - Battlepug
Dan Jurgens - Tommi Trek 
Mat Wagner - Grendel & Mage 
Casey Malone & Dustin Yee - The Enigmas 
Scott Wegener - Atomic Robo 
Joe Corroney - Star Wars and Star Trek 
Shawn Pryor & Martheus Wade - Young Star 
Humberto Ramos - Fantastic Four 
J. Scott Campbell - various Superhero art 
Frank Quitely & Tim Townsend - New X-Men 
John Byrne - Tommi Trek 
Phil Hester - Sick Time 
David Bryant - Aviatrix 
Melinda Timpone - White Noise 
Paige Braddock - Jane's World 
Tom Mandrake - Devil's Gate 
Val Hochberg - Mystery Babylon with Kick Girl 
Tom Nguyen - various Superhero art 
Steve Lightle - Tommi Trek 
Chad Hardin & James Taylor - Fist of Justice 
Sapphire Tricket - Solar VII 
...and more to be announced.
BONUS CONTENT: BREAK INTO THE COMIC BOOK INDUSTRY
Get advice about creating your portfolio, attending comic conventions, and submitting samples. Learn the secret to getting started and making a great impression.

We have additional chapters, book upgrades, and bonus art packs from top name creators ready to include in the stretch goals which will make Hi-Fi Color for Comics bigger and better for all backers.  
Are you ready to get involved and put Hi-Fi Color for Comics in print? Then read on for the REWARDS!
*ComiXology edition is compatible with iPad, iPhone, Android, Kindle, & Windows 8 Tablets.
STRETCH GOALS
We have some amazing stretch goals for you. As we hit stretch goals the book will grow in size giving your more book for your pledge. 
UNLOCKED - Backers who pledge $25 or more receive these upgrades.
UNLOCKED - Backers who pledge $20 or more receive these upgrades.
UNLOCKED - Backers who pledge $20 or more receive these upgrades.
UNLOCKED - Backers who pledge $20 or more receive these upgrades.
UNLOCKED - Backers who pledge $20 or more receive these upgrades.
This goal is in-progress and will unlock at $32,500
SHIPPING FREE U.S. Shipping for all rewards levels. Shipping fees for rewards going outside the U.S. are indicated and collected by Kickstarter. We have done all we can to keep the shipping cost as low as possible but books are heavy and not cheap to ship. If shipping cost is a concern please consider the ComiXology digital edition.
HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE USED?
Production, Printing, Promotion of Hi-Fi Color for Comics
Shipping all those heavy books
Compensation for artist who contributed their original artwork for you to color as well as the book editor and designer
Any fees associated with converting the print book to digital format for ComiXology
Fulfilling additional requirements of reward levels, mini-prints, workshops, etc.
COPYRIGHT NOTICE: All artwork featured in Hi-Fi Color for Comics is done so with the express written permission of the Copyright holder or their legal representative. Art release forms for Hi-Fi Color for Comics are on file with Hi-Fi colour design and all Copyright notices within the book are as stated by the Copyright holders.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fulfillment will be handled by shipping backers all items in one package when possible to reduce shipping time and expense. This means rewards like mini-prints will ship with the completed book, not before.

The authors and editor have previously completed several art instruction books and are ready to complete the the new Hi-Fi Color for Comics, have the books printed, and ship them to backers.

Working full time in the comic book industry the challenge we face is always one of time and deadlines. Any project that involves multiple writers, artist, designers, etc. can run into deadline issues. If all stretch goals are reached the book will double in size which may require additional time for design, printing, and shipping.

If any delay or setback arises all backers affected will be notified via Kickstarter update and advised of any change in the delivery timeline. Our goal is to complete the book, have it printed, and delivered to all backers in a timely manner.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
"Bee and PuppyCat" is a very popular original cartoon created by Natasha Allegri. In it, Bee, an out-of-work twenty-something, has a life-changing collision with a mysterious creature she names PuppyCat ("A cat?... or maybe a dog?"). Between space and time, Bee and PuppyCat take on an intergalactic babysitting gig to pay another month’s rent. Now, you can help Bee write a happy ending for PuppyCat’s tale of betrayal, intrigue, and magical sparkle transformations.
Amassing 4 million views since its July release, the original 10-minute cartoon stands as a favorite among animation fans the world over (watch it again, why don't you http://youtu.be/lOG_UtLxh58 ). Now, overwhelmed with your emails and comments asking for more adventures of Bee and PuppyCat, we want to produce a Bee and PuppyCat series exclusively for our YouTube channel, Cartoon Hangover. But we need your help.
Our minimum goal is to produce six, brand new, six-minute Bee and PuppyCat cartoons. The more money we raise, the more cartoons we make. The series will be overseen by the creator, Natasha Allegri. Production will begin immediately, the first episode will be released in the the summer of 2014.
We know what you're thinking, and you're right; this is a lot of money for a handful of cartoons. To make a television-quality production, though, isn't cheap, and it takes a lot longer than most of us would like, too. Here's why we're asking for $600,000.
Bee and PuppyCat, like most of your favorite cartoons, will be "traditionally animated," which means that each element is drawn by hand. It is time - and labor - intensive.
Each cartoon's pre-production stage will consist of writing, storyboarding, casting and recording (in a top-of-the-line audio production facility), creating an animatic (shooting the storyboard with the final recorded dialogue), designing (backgrounds, characters, props, effects), coloring (of those models, effects, backgrounds, props, etc), and timing (which requires the director to go frame by frame creating exposure sheets). There will be as many as 25 cast- and crew-members on pre-production side alone.
After pre-production, we'll send all those assets to an international studio where dozens of artists will draw every element for every frame, layout, key pose, animate, in-between, ink and paint, and, finally, composite. The animation then returns to sunny Burbank, CA, where Natasha and her team will give everything a good look and recommend changes. The overseas studio will make those changes and, after a little back and forth, will deliver the final animation.
Here's what happens in the post-production stage: the animation is edited; sound effects, including foley, are recorded and added; and the composer creates the score. The sounds effects, music, and dialog are finally blended together with the animation in the last step of production, the final mix.
So, yes, these cartoons tend to be a bit pricey. But the good news is Frederator and Cartoon Hangover have tremendous partners who are eager to reward your helping the Bee and PuppyCat Kickstarter. They include: 
  As an independent production company, Frederator Studios requires outside funding to produce cartoons. 
As you can imagine, the process of rounding up financial support this way takes a long time - years, usually. 
In most cases, the companies providing funding want a voice in how that cartoon is made. We've decided seeking funding from fans through Kickstarter is not only the fastest way to bring you Natasha Allegri's Bee and PuppyCat series, but also the best way to preserve the creator's artistic vision.
This also gives you, the fans, a chance to help make a show you love possible! By working with you we can help make the show faster and better than by traditional funding streams. 

If we're fortunate enough to exceed our goal, we'll produce more episodes while continuing to reward you for your support. Here's what we currently have planned...
Bee and PuppyCat is brought to you by Natasha Allegri, Frederator Studios, the production company, and Cartoon Hangover, the YouTube channel.
Natasha Allegri created "Bee and PuppyCat" to be part of Cartoon Hangover's anthology of original animated shorts. She and Frederator Studios then spent more than eighteen months making the film, initially split into two parts. 
Since 2010, Natasha has been a key contributor to Cartoon Network's hit series, Adventure Time, as both a character designer and a storyboard revisionist. It was her gender-swapped characters Fionna and Cake, first seen through her own Tumblr page, which led to two (so far) episodes featuring the show's "bizarro" characters. The characters were such a hit that publisher BOOM! Studios asked Natasha to write and illustrate the Adventure Time with Fionna and Cake comic book series.
Frederator Studios is the independent animation studio behind some of the most beloved animated series of all time, including ChalkZone, The Fairly OddParents, Fanboy and Chum Chum, My Life as a Teenage Robot, Adventure Time, and Bravest Warriors. Founded by Fred Seibert in 1998, Frederator has produced more than 200 short films and 16 TV series. Frederator is well known for its cartoon anthology series Oh Yeah! Cartoons and Random! Cartoons, descendants of Seibert’s What a Cartoon! series of shorts, intended to give a voice to cartoonists and animators. "Bee and PuppyCat" broke through Frederator’s Too Cool! Cartoons shorts program produced for Cartoon Hangover.
Cartoon Hangover launched on YouTube on November 8, 2012, as part of YouTube’s original channel initiative. Since then, the channel has added more than 780,000 subscribers and had more than 50,000,000 views, making it the third fastest growing channel of all the YouTube funded channels. In October 2012, Cartoon Hangover launched its first series, Bravest Warriors, created by the mind behind Adventure Time, Pendleton Ward.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Frederator is expert at producing cartoons so there is very little risk that a cartoon will not be made. Frederator has made hundreds of hours of cartoons. The producers working on Bee and PuppyCat have decades of experience producing content and Frederator itself has been in business for over 15 years. Frederator has worked with dozens and dozens of creators to bring their visions to screen including the original two-part Bee and PuppyCat cartoon with Natasha. At this budget level, Backers should feel highly confident that the Bee and PuppyCat series will have a high production quality and be totally awesome. 

When it comes to the Kickstarter we're working with Breadpig, Inc to make sure everything goes well. For specific rewards we're working with other partners that have helped us bring merchandise to you in the past for other Frederator Properties!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello backers,
We know it has been SO long since this was funded but it is finally getting close to the time when the rest of the physical rewards will ship. We had to wait until all of the episodes were done so that we could manufacture the DVD/Blu-Ray and not get completely demolished by additional shipping fees for every individual item. And then those last few episodes were completed right before the Holidays here in the United States and all of our vendors for the physical rewards were too busy. Now we are almost all ready to ship you your stuff.

campaign.story:
Update: We've come up with one final stretch goal. If we make it to $110,000, we'll hire producer-extraordinaire Ben Shive and record an original song from The Wingfeather Saga: "My Love Has Gone Across the Sea." Andrew and Ben will work together on the arrangement and, since it's a song sung by Leeli, they'll find an awesome female vocalist here in Nashville to do the singing. The song will be available as a download to anyone pledging at the CAVE BLAT level or above. Thanks for all the support, folks.
Update: Wow! We're incredibly grateful for all the support you've given the book. Lots of folks have been asking for a new stretch goal, so after much deliberation, here's what we've come up with: If we reach $85,000 every backer at CAVE BLAT level or higher will receive a brand new, full-color, professionally-illustrated, poster-sized, fold-out map of Aerwiar. The map will be large and detailed and suitable for framing if you so desire.
We've also added a new pledge level: SKONK. At this level, which is limited to only 5 backers, you'll receive all the rewards associated with the CHORKNEY pledge level plus Andrew will work with you to add a name of your choosing into the story of The Warden and the Wolf King. That means you could add your own name, or a loved one's name, as a character or place in Aerwiar. Andrew will work with you in order to find a way to fit the name you choose into the world naturally. 
Update: We've crossed the $45k mark. That means we'll be issuing a new edition of The Monster in the Hollows in HARDBACK. Awesome!
Right now, everyone who pledges at the CAVE BLAT level or higher will receive the following (In addition to pledge level rewards):
-The Warden and the Wolf King jam-packed with illustrations
-The Warden and the Wolf King upgraded to hardback
-The Monster in the Hollows digital audiobook
-The Warden and the Wolf King digital audiobook
-The Monster in the Hollows in hardback
Next up? Pembrick's Creaturepedia. Thanks for all the support, folks. We're blown away.
--AP & Co.
The Wingfeather Saga began almost 10 years ago with On the Edge of the Dark Sea of Darkness (writing began in 2003/published in 2008). Since then the series has become a favorite of families around the world, winning the Christy Award for Young Adult Fiction in 2010 for North! Or Be Eaten. But like every good story, the Saga has to come to an end, and in early 2014, Rabbit Room Press will release the final installment of this epic tale.
Rallied behind Kalmar Wingfeather, the Wolf King of Anniera, the people of the Green Hollows are prepared for war. But high atop the Killridge Mountains in Castle Throg, Gnag the Nameless broods over dark secrets, and those secrets may prove more than a boy, even a boy king like Kalmar, can bear. 
While Leeli, Podo, and Nia, fight to save the Green Hollows, Sara Cobbler and the wildy transformed Peet the Sockman strive to overthrow the Fangs of Dang and liberate the long-enslaved people of Skree. 
But Kalmar and his brother Janner, the Throne Warden of Anniera, will be driven into darkness to face a nameless evil (that has no name). Dragons will rise. The Jewels will shine. And in the end, an Annieran will die.
We want to publish the grand finale of this story in style, and that’s why we’re here on Kickstarter. If we make our goal of $14,000 that will allow us to publish the book as a high quality trade paperback, just like we did with The Monster in the Hollows in 2011.
Pre-Release in time for Christmas!
If we meet our goal, we're also committed to delivering an early pre-release version of the book to Kickstarter backers who pledge at the RAT BADGER level and above--and we're going to get this version of the book to you in time for Christmas. 
This special pre-release will be an early proof of the book in PDF format that you can read on any device that supports PDFs (such as an iPad or a Kindle or a laptop). Because it's an early proof, it will not contain final artwork and will be subject to change as final edits take place, but if you are looking for something special to start reading on Christmas Day, this is just the thing.
But wait! There's more. If we can exceed our base goal, we’re going to start adding value to the book in some exciting ways. And the best part is that everyone will able to benefit from these awesome additions. 
What kind of added value?
Stretch Goal #1 - Illustrations: For The Warden and the Wolf King, we’re working with illustrator Joe Sutphin. Joe is a big fan of the Wingfeather Saga and we're really excited about the work he's doing. Visit his website here to see some of his other illustration work.
At our base goal, we know Joe will be doing 6 original illustrations for the book as well as new maps. But we want to do better than that. If we exceed the $14,000 goal, we’ll be able to pay Joe to do even more illustrations---maybe a LOT more. Joe's art will be in the book, no matter what, but the more you help, the more illustrations he’ll be able to do. Instead of 6 illustrations, as in The Monster in the Hollows, we’d like to see a dozen or more. 
But wait…there’s more!
Stretch Goal #2 - The Warden and the Wolf King in Hardcover: The second Stretch Goal takes effect when we reach $25,000. If we reach that threshold, we’ll upgrade our production plans and publish The Warden and the Wolf King in hardcover. That means everyone who contributes (at RAT BADGER level or above) will be automatically upgraded to the hardback edition. 
Stretch Goal #3 - The Monster in the Hollows Audiobook: The third Stretch Goal takes effect when we reach $30,000. Upon reaching this goal, we’ll commit to producing the digital audiobook of The Monster in the Hollows (book three). Andrew Peterson will read the book, and everyone who has pledged (at the CAVE BLAT level or above) will receive it as a free download. And don't worry, Andrew is no amateur. He's narrated several audiobooks over the years.
Stretch Goal #4 - The Warden and the Wolf King Audiobook: The fourth Stretch Goal takes effect when we reach $35,000. At this point, we’ll also produce the digital audiobook of The Warden and the Wolf King. Andrew Peterson will read it, and once again, everyone at the CAVE BLAT level or above will receive it as a free download. 
But wait! There’s more!

Stretch Goal #5 - The Monster in the Hollows in Hardcover: If we reach $45,000, we’ll publish a hardback edition of book three, The Monster in the Hollows, and yes, everyone who’s pledged at CAVE BLAT level or above will receive a copy—for free!
And, finally, here’s the one we’re most excited about: 
Stretch Goal #6 - Pembrick's Creaturepedia: If we reach $65,000, we're going to publish something really special. Throughout the Wingfeather Saga, there have been references to Pembrick’s Creaturepedia. Pembrick, the story goes, ventured all across Aerwiar, putting himself at great risk, to catalogue the strange and wonderful (and hungry) creatures of his world. And because of his great sacrifices, Annieran and Skreean people have, for many years, sat safely in the comfort of their homes to read about Gargan Rockroaches, and Snick Buzzards, and Sea Dragons, and Flabbits. For generations, the people of Aerwiar have stared rapturously at Pembrick’s well-noted illustrations and thanked the Maker that they’ve never encountered the horrors depicted therein. 
Should we reach $65,000, Rabbit Room Press will publish Pembrick’s Creaturepedia so that you too may peruse the terrors and wonders of the Aerwiaran wilds from the security of your own home. Each and every contributor (at the CAVE BLAT level and above) will receive this hallowed tome for free. (Though it won’t be delivered until the spring/summer of 2014). 
Stretch Goal #7 - Fold-Out Map: If we reach $85,000 every backer at CAVE BLAT level or higher will receive a brand new, full-color, professionally-illustrated, poster-sized, fold-out map of Aerwiar. The map will be large and detailed and suitable for framing if you so desire.
Stretch Goal #8 - An Original Song: If we make it to $110,000, we'll hire producer-extraordinaire Ben Shive and record an original song from The Wingfeather Saga: "My Love Has Gone Across the Sea." Andrew and Ben will work together on the arrangement and, since it's a song sung by Leeli, they'll find an awesome female vocalist here in Nashville to do the singing.
Let us sum up.
If we reach $14,000, the Warden and the Wolf King will be published in early 2014, and everyone receives the pledge rewards listed in the sidebar.
But...
If we reach at least $110,000, everyone who’s pledged at the CAVE BLAT level or higher will receive (in addition to the pledge rewards listed in the sidebar):
-a hardback edition of The Warden and the Wolf King
-a hardback edition of The Monster in the Hollows
-a digital audiobook of The Monster in the Hollows
-a digital audiobook of The Warden and the Wolf King
-Pembrick’s Creaturepedia 
-a poster-sized, full-color, fold-out, map of Aerwiar
-a download of an original song from The Wingfeather Saga
We’re confident that with your help, we can reach our goal of $14,000 and publish The Warden and the Wolf King. But for us to do all the rest, we need your help. 
Share this page! Link to it, and put it on your blog, and tell your friends, and your librarians, and your village elders. Spread the word!
We're excited about creating all this fun stuff, but we can’t do it without your support. 
Pledge Level Rewards
Check out the reward descriptions below. Note that most STRETCH GOAL rewards only apply to those at the "Cave Blat" level and above.

updates.update_content:
Hey, good people who helped me publish The Warden and the Wolf King.
To all of you who have jumped in to help us with the new project, THANK YOU! To those of you who are still on the fence, this is a gentle nudge. :) As you may know, as one component of the fun rewards for the backers for the Wingfeather Saga animated series, we're publishing a book called Wingfeather Tales, written and illustrated by a whole gang of wonderful authors and artists. Well, I wanted to let you know that we're getting close to the $220,000 mark, which means I'm going to write a new Wingfeather short story to be included in the book. It'll be illustrated by the great

updates.update_userinfo: Great Toothy Cows! We hit our first goal in 48 hours.
updates.update_content:
Chris and I are gobsmacked. (I just wanted to use that word.)
Seriously, we've spent the last week with our heads spinning as we've watched the Wingfeather Saga Animated Series blow past our first goal of $110K. We're so thankful to so many of you who have jumped on board to help us make this film as awesome as we can make it. When we launched the Wolf King campaign a few years ago I had no idea how far it would go (none of us did!), and I feel the same about this one. Remember all those upgrades? The map? The hardback? The song? That's all because you guys got behind this thing.
So as you know, . With each stretch goal we reach, you guys get to make this animated short into something bigger, longer, and more beautiful. We're now up to three new stories in the Wingfeather Tales book, and we've been able to expand the scope of the short to include not just thwaps, but Podo Helmer! Last I checked, we were just a handful of pledges away from being able to add Nia to the short film--but now that we've seen how this is going we're pulling out all the stops!
